story:
A New Healing Gardens album by The Lucky Sisters

Patio Records is thrilled to announce yet another stellar music project to advance its cause of building Healing Gardens at cancer treatment centres in Canada and the US. The Lucky Sisters, aka Tannis Slimmon, Allison Lupton, and Rosemary Phelan, are in the recording stage of their upcoming album "So Lucky" on the Patio Records label. (Haven't heard The Lucky Sisters? Have a listen HERE.)

Help Us Build the Next Healing Garden!
Your much-appreciated album pre-orders and donations will be applied to the (substantial) recording and manufacturing expenses for the album. This way, funds from album sales can be applied to building our next Healing Gardens project at a cancer treatment centre, instead of paying project bills.  So you will be directly contributing to building the next Healing Garden, and we'll let you know exactly where and when that will take place. Along with our gratitude, you'll receive a copy of "So Lucky" for every $25 (or multiple of $25) donation. Surplus funds, if any, will be directly applied to helping build the next Healing Garden.

Why Healing Gardens?

The Healing Gardens fund was established to honour the wishes of Mary Eagan (1947--1992), who asked that any monies raised in her honor be directed towards building patios for future patients' well-being during their times of receiving cancer treatments. The Waltham (MA) Hospital embraced this goal, and on April 27th, 2001, saw the opening ceremony and ribbon cuttting of the magnificent Mary Eagan Garden adjoining the Cancer Care Center; providing a setting of comfort and solace for people who our hearts go out to. The first Mary Eagan Garden in Canada was opened within the the 4.5 acre Richard and Annette Bloch Cancer Survivors Park in Ottawa on September 24, 2008. In all, over 40 musical benefit events and multiple recordings have helped to bring Mary's vision to life in 6 different hospitals and treatment centres so far.

You Can Help Ease the Burden

We are deeply grateful for your financial help in easing the burden and lifting the spirits of those suffering from cancer and their families, and for helping us to honour Mary Eagan's vision.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help but the wallet is slim? You can do so much by sharing this campaign page in your community, through social media, word-of-mouth, and at your workplace. Thank you in advance for helping us to fulfill our goals!

story:
Our band Sun Machine has the opportunity to record our full length  debut album with a renowned local producer, as well as a couple of Portland's top musicians who have agreed to play on the record.   Ryan Fauber has been performing his songs for over 20 years and this would be his first opportunity to work with industry professionals and to make an album that would give his songs the platform they deserve.  Sun Machine has been practicing diligently for the past year, playing shows, and networking through the Portland, Oregon music scene, which led to this amazing opportunity.  Without crowd source funding, this album would be an impossibility.  Thank you for donating, and, if you can't, please share our campaign.

We need to raise at least $3,000 to record and the 12 tracks and pay the artists involved. 

We are an independent music group fully self sustained up until this point. With growing demand for honest, heartfelt music, we feel it is necessary to take the next step and ask for help. 

We are a little nervous about reaching our goal, as we understand this is a lot of money. A friend said, ''It takes more courage to ask for help than to give it.'' So, now here we are asking. Thank you for your support and happy holidays!

Please, if you cannot help with financial support, share our campaign with others.

story:
Who?

I've been writing songs since I was 13 and releasing them since I was 20. Tracks from my last album, 2013's Skipping Away from Dissonance, received moderate airplay on independent and college radio and the record ended up on several year-end best-of lists; an instrumental version of the track "Time Machine" from that album was also featured in a trailer for the Broadway production of Peter and the Starcatcher. I've been threatening to release another record since 2014, and I love this particular batch of songs a lot and hope you'll get something out of them too.

Listen to "I.love.you" from Skipping Away from Dissonance here.

How?

With your help! This budget is split 50/50 between recording costs and distribution costs. A further breakdown:

Recording:

  • 80%: paying musicians
  • 20%: studio rental/engineer payments

Distribution:

  • 60%: Marketing and radio
  • 20%: Manufacture and artwork
  • 10%: Mastering
  • 10%: Licensing

What (do you get in return)?

Depending on your pledge level, here are some of the perks you'll be rewarded with:

  • A social media shout out (platform of choice)
  • A digital copy of the album
  • A signed copy of the album
  • Handwritten lyrics of a song of your choice
  • A YouTube cover song of your choice
  • A handmade, framed artwork of pressed leaves and flowers (see photo below)
  • I will come to your home and cook you and up to three other people dinner (Tri-State Area only, alas)
  • And a 90-minute house concert where you have input into the set list **

Risks & Challenges

As always, with projects like these, there are so many potential variables (studio availability, nuclear war, you know, the usual) that delays may occur. But know that I, John, and everyone else involved with this project are already working hard to make this record a reality, and will not stop until it's completed and in your hands

 

Why?

I'm a firm believer in the power of music. I cannot tell you how many songs and artists have shaped who I am today, not only as a musician or a writer but as a person. So many songs have made me really sit and contemplate how I live my life, and have challenged me to become a better version of myself; if I can do that for even one other person, then this record will be a success.

If you can't contribute monetarily, I completely get it -- please spread the word to friends, family, coworkers, anyone who you think might find value in this work. It's much appreciated.

story:
Singer - Songwriter - Superhero

I am an eclectic singer and songwriter whose talents have reached the ears of musicians and music lovers from all over the world. I started my music journey senior year of high school in my hometown in Maryland, where I later relocated to Florida for college and began working as a singer and songwriter for one of Orlando's premier recording studios, Plush Studios. I have been so blessed to have worked with amazing artists and producers affiliated with Sony, Universal Music, Capitol Records, Def Jam, The Voice and more. 

My writing reflects my personal experiences, hopes, dreams, the good and the bad. My Mantra: Singer - Songwriter - Superhero hints at my goals with music, not only to sing but to write lyrics to help people, that are relate-able, expressive and uplifting. I strive to be my own breed of superhero who uses my gifts and talents with melodies and lyricism to leave my mark in the world, a magical musical legacy. 

Most recently I have had my music featured in TV shows such as Orange is the New Black, Switched at birth and Odd Mom Out. I have also had the honor of performing on national television as featured singer in the National Cherry Blossom Festival Parade and the National Independence Day Parade in the heart of Washington, D.C. I was also invited to perform live on WJLA's Good Morning Washington.

I am excited to debut my first solo project titled "Metaphors" fusing rock, acoustic melodies, hip-hop and R&B.

 

Join The Adventure!

I would love for you to join my music adventure! While I have invested all I have in myself, time, money, all of my money (lol), as any true creative artist does, I need your support to complete this project and take it to the next level. Your contribution will help me the following:

  • Finalizing recorded songs
  • Album printing & shipping
  • Marketing & promotion of the album (digital and print)
  • Music videos & graphics
  • Album release event
  • Create and distribute perks
  • Taxes & fees
  • and more!

 

If I don't reach my goal, I plan to fly with whatever amount of fairy dust I have. I will work with what was raised and work hard to release what I can. I will forever be grateful for those who contributed.  

The Perks!

Anyone who contributes to this project, even without selecting a perk will receive a digital copy of the album and a personal thank you note!

  • The album
  • Autographed prints
  • Tickets to the album release party
  • Handwritten thank you cards
  • T-shirts & crop tops
  • Bonus tracks
  • Custom song written just for you
  • Video chat session
  • Join me on an adventure
  • LIVE performance in your home or place of business
  • Mystery box (filled with special gifts from me to you)
  • My album release party presented by YOU!

You don't have to choose a perk! You can contribute any amount you wish! If you would like to contribute $30 and not select a perk, I will still make sure you receive a perk from me as a thank you! 

...BTW all perk names are song titles ;) → → →

 

I Just Wanna Say Thank You!

I am so grateful to have some amazing friends and colleagues who have invested their time and talents into this project. Completing this project and exceeding my goals won't just be an accomplishment for me but for everyone involved on this journey. I would like to thank those who have been an integral part of this journey thus far:

Cristina "Cheero Citizen" Gonzales, Michael Shelly, Eva Styles, Dellevan "JetBlackson" Lee, dLowStudio, Lundon, Amanda, Christina L, Kam Ridley, Johnny (Boston) Whynock, Janelle, Timea Gaines, Tony Hemings, Incorporated Elements, Spectacle Photo, Anu, Andre Vega, Lyanne, Cassie, Josie Brooks Photography, Still+Motion Photography, R. Wallace, Paola, Kelsey, B Burtis, Brittani G, Tina S,  The Franciscos, my family, contributors, all the musicians involved in the music and all my friends featured in my videos.

Risks & Challenges

The time is now for indie musicians such as myself to take advantage of all the new technologies. With streaming being the new record store, promotion and marketing are very important. Reaching the right audiences can be a challenge, selecting the right audiences to market to can be a risk, but one I am willing to take. I feel my music is relatable to various age groups and backgrounds to both men and women.  I plan to reach out to a PR company who can help hone in on the right audiences, media and outlets and get my music heard!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everything counts in my world! If you are unable to make a monetary contribution, I am still grateful that you visited my campaign and took the time to learn more about me. If you are able to, please feel free to support in other ways: 

  • Share my campaign with friends and coworkers
  • If you are interested in providing in-kind donations or services feel free to contact: music@roquois.com
  • Send me an encouraging message via social media or email

 

Check Out Some Photos & Videos:

I have had some amazing adventures and can't wait to share more with you!

 

Throwback videos to RAW Orlando EnMasse: 

Throwback videos to RAW Orlando Marvel: 

 

Album & Perks slated to be delivered Jan 2018

Video related perks to be delivered by Spring 2018

story:
Short Summary

My stepping out on stage has been a long time coming!  The time is NOW because I have been inspired to use my singing, poetic, and story telling voice(s) for spreading the joy of Spirit, life, love, peace, joy, compassion, and laughter.

This is my professional singing débute - launching "Liberty Sings" -  I am both excited and scared. Your spiritual, emotional, moral, and financial support is gratefully appreciated.

Jim Day, jazz guitarist, will be accompanying me.  Jim is excellent and well known in the Seattle music scene.  Jim has played with some very big names (e.g. Henry Mancini) so I feel particularly fortunate to have him back me.

This performance - Vignettes: Reflections of Life - is to raise "love offerings" for the Divine Goddesses, Seattle Unity women's group, annual retreat scholarship fund, while offering an evening of reflection through the power of music.  There is no ticket price for attendance and all your "love offerings" will go to supporting the scholarship fund. 

The Richard Hugo House Richard Hugo House Cabaret Café is an intimate room that comfortably seats 40, so space is limited.  There is a beverage bar so you can buy a glass of wine, designer water, teas or coffees to sip during the performance.  The performance will be July 26, 2014, at 7:30pm-9:00pm. 

More about the Goddesses...

The Divine Goddesses have a mission to support women in discovering our strengths, enlightening our minds, owning our bodies, and celebrating our emotions.  Our annual retreat creates sacred space for women to explore spiritual development, service, fun, and community.

The Annual Women's Retreat is in its 4th year and the retreat is a profound and joyful experience, and we want to be inclusive of women of all economic means by offering scholarships.

What is Needed

An estimated $1000 is needed and will be used as follows:

  • Rent the performance space (Richard Hugo House in Seattle, WA);
  • Professional musician/Music: create charts, rehearsals, and accompanist
  • My time is entirely donated

Any funds raised beyond the basic expenses estimated will go directly into the scholarship fund!  .

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can support this very good work!  Of course you can contribute funding if Spirit inspires you to and you can share this information with your friends and family - please spread the word.

story:
My Story


Hey everyone! 

               My name is Phillip Pierce, I'm 21 years old and I have a vision. I have always written music. From short raps to power ballads, I've found that writing lyrics has been a great way of showing how I feel and getting things off my chest. Music can connect to anyone, anywhere if the lyrics are right. And that is where I got the idea for this project.

              In The Air began in February 2013 after my former band broke up. I began talking to Josh Kikta of Miss Fortune about writing instrumentals for me so that I could write meaningful lyrics to them that others could relate to. I was going through a lot, including alcohol addiction, what I wanted to go and do with my life, and just who I was in general. I could not find any music that really described what I was going through and I was tired of hearing songs about things that just didn't pertain to me or were so vague that they could have hundreds of meanings. I wanted to be able to touch others that were going through the same things I was. I know what its like to feel like you're controlled by an addiction, that you've lost someone, being homeless and helpless, and that no one is there... I want others to know that I'm here and that they are not alone in their struggles. This EP has five songs, each about a different subject: addiction, apologies, being away from your home and family, motivation, and living your life happy once again. It has taken me over a year to really write how it feels to experience these things and I know that others can hear them and connect as well. So my hope for this campaign is that I can receive enough donations to record the 'Heartfelt' EP and get this music to those who need to know someone is there. I will also be donating a large portion of any leftover money to three different charities: the National Council on Alcoholism & Drug Dependence (NCADD), American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP), and StandUp For Kids (SUFK) which helps homeless youth.

                                                                        -Thank you,

                                                                                          Phil


What I'm Aiming For:

I will be having the EP recorded, produced and mastered by Josh Kikta and Ian Marchionda, both of Miss Fortune. Since they are a few states over, I will be recording the vocals with my sister, Mackenzie, here in Springfield, MO at a studio. The recording itself will be $1,000 total. I am also printing 100 physical copies of the EP as part of my perks and to sell to those in my area, as well as a few limited edition pieces of merchandise. All total this will come out to about $1,600, but, as I said, if there is any remaining money it will mainly go to charity. So even if I have met my goal please donate to a great cause!

LIMITED EDITION APPAREL! 

Even if you cannot donate, please spread the word about my project! Or if you would just like to talk, message me at the Facebook link posted below :)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/intheairband

YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0OxRb3Ux2Y1LNRJnXu2jag/videos

I will also be donating a large portion of any leftover money to three different charities: the National Council on Alcoholism & Drug Dependence (NCADD), American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP), and StandUp For Kids (SUFK) which helps homeless youth.                                                                        -Thank you,                                                                                          PhilWhat I'm Aiming For:I will be having the EP recorded, produced and mastered by Josh Kikta and Ian Marchionda, both of Miss Fortune. Since they are a few states over, I will be recording the vocals with my sister, Mackenzie, here in Springfield, MO at a studio. The recording itself will be $1,000 total. I am also printing 100 physical copies of the EP as part of my perks and to sell to those in my area, as well as a few limited edition pieces of merchandise. All total this will come out to about $1,600, but, as I said, if there is any remaining money it will mainly go to charity. So even if I have met my goal please donate to a great cause!LIMITED EDITION APPAREL! Even if you cannot donate, please spread the word about my project! Or if you would just like to talk, message me at the Facebook link posted below :)Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/intheairbandYouTube: http://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0OxRb3Ux2Y1LNRJnXu2jag/videos

story:
FOXHUNT is a five piece band, based in Austin, Texas. Our sound is made up of a shifting mixture of alternative rock, and modern folk, shot-through with waves of dreamy electronics. The tone of the songs drifts around themes of love, alienation, and the price of both. We're in the process of producing our debut album, and need your help! Your contribution, at whatever level you can, would mean a lot to us. 

We have done all our research, laid out our budget requirements, funding options, and plausible schedules.  We feel confident that every penny earned will be put to the best and most efficient use.  The songs that will comprise "Strange Creatures" have been chosen with care. T-shirt and album artwork are created by our very own Joseph (lead vocals).  A lot of the things we're offering as perks, are only being produced in a limited run, and won't be available again, after this campaign ends. Just another reason to show your support, and get a unique thank you.

The $9800 we need, will go toward studio time, mixing, and mastering "Strange Creatures", as well as printing CDs, album artwork, the FOXHUNT key usb distribution, etc. We also have plans for anything we earn above and beyond this set goal, and we will reveal them, should we get to that point.

There are several ways to contribute...Take a look at each of our levels, and the corresponding perks. Help us spread the word about our campaign by posting online, telling friends and family, and whatever other ways of sharing you can come up with.

Visit www.fxhnt.com to listen to some music.



Levels and Perks

$5 digital album download

$25 digital download plus CD + poster + stickers

$35 digital download plus key + poster + stickers (our band logo will be laser etched on the one you get): https://www.dropbox.com/s/hrwbwqgnd6enzcp/key.jpg)

$50 digital download plus key + poster + stickers + tshirt 

$75 digital download plus CD + poster + stickers + choice of glyphs (example: http://imgur.com/a/HsfAw) or handwritten lyrics (limited run 25)

$100 hand-written lyrics with glyphs beautifully framed + stickers + CD + key (limited run 25)

$150 digital download + key + CD + poster + stickers + cover song of choice 

$200 digital download + key + CD + poster + stickers + tshirt + sketchbook booklet of the process of album artwork

$500 digital download + key + CD + poster + stickers + tshirt + private acoustic house show (must be in Austin, or provide travel/accommodations) 

$800 intimate acoustic set and "family dinner" where the band cooks dinner, and we can play video games, or board games, or cards against humanity....etc. + digital download + key + CD + poster + stickers + tshirt

story:
(Français plus bas)

English

Summary    

Tunguska Mammoth was born 3 years ago... After finding our tone, after recording our first EP in 2011, here we are, finally, with our first full-length album, who should see the light of day in September. We put a lot of energy on finding new riffs, writing down the lyrics and push our EP everywhere in Québec. Right now the drums, guitars and bass are recorded, and we are working on the vocals (as of June 5th 2013).

What you get

1$: Special thanks and a warm spot in our hearts
 
5$: Download the album before the official release
 
For the following, shipping to Canada and USA are included in the price. For the rest of the world, please add 5$.
 
15$: CD + pre-release album download + sticker
 
20$: Backer's T-Shirt + pre-release album download + sticker
 
35$: Signed CD + T-Shirt + pre-release album download + Sticker
 
70$: Signed CD + Hoodie + pre-release album download + sticker
 
100$: : Signed CD + Hoodie + T-Shirt + pre-release album download + official thanks in the album + 5 stickers

666$: We do a gig anywhere in Québec or some part in Ontario (at a bar, at your cottage, in your kitchen, at your grandma's, especially if she makes tablet), etc 

Stretch Goal

Impact    

We are pretty advanced in the recording process, but we need a    little contribution for the CD printing, mixing, mastering (which will be done by Pierre Rémillard (Wild Studio) and also to be able    to ship a couple records to medias all around the world.
   

Other ways you can help    

You wanna rip the album when it's released ? You can still help us.    Talk about Tunguska Mammoth on facebook, on blogs, forums, groups,    twitter, your local media, your local radio (or not so local), come see us play live, share a pint of beer, invite us to play in that shitty bar not to far from your place, be creative !

 

Français

Bref résumé

Tunguska Mammoth est née il y a déjà près de 3 ans, et après avoir dû trouver notre son, après avoir enregistrer notre premier EP en 2011, nous voilà enfin avec notre premier album complet, qui vera le jour en septembre prochain.  Nous avons mis beaucoup d'énergie à composer les riffs, à écrire les paroles, à pousser notre EP un peu partout au Québec, et nous venons tout juste de finir d'enregistrer le drum, les guitares, la bass, et nous sommes présentement (5 juin 2013) en train de finir les voix.

Notre projet est très DIY.  C'est Pierre-Hugues Rondeau (drum) qui a fait l'enregistrement des instruments et de la voix, et qui fera le mix de l'album. C'est lui qui avait aussi fait l'enregistrement de notre EP.

Ce que vous obtenez

1$: un gros merci et une place dans nos coeurs.
5$: Download avant la sorti officielle de l'album
666$: On fait un show pas mal n'importe où au Québec ou quelques endroit en Ontario (bar, à ton chalet, dans ta cuisine, chez ta grand-mère (si elle fait du sucre à la crème), etc.

 
Pour les suivants, ça inclu le shipping au Canada et aux USA.  Pour le reste du monde, ajoutez svp 5$.
 
15$: CD + téléchargement digital avant la sorti de l'album + sticker
20$: T-Shirt + téléchargement digital avant la sorti de l'album + sticker
35$: CD autographié + T-Shirt + téléchargement digital avant la sorti de l'album + sticker
70$: CD autographié + Hoodie + téléchargement digital avant la sorti de l'album + sticker
100$: : CD autographié + Hoodie + téléchargement digital avant la sorti de l'album + on t'remercie officiellement dans l'album + 5 stickers
 

L'impact

Nous avons déjà complété une bonne parti de l'enregistrement, mais nous aurons besoin d'argent pour l'impression de CDs, pour le mastering (qui sera fait par Pierre Rémillard (Wild Studio), ainsi que pour avoir de l'argent pour des enveloppes, des timbres et pour la bave qui servira à envoyer nos CDs aux médias partout dans le monde.

D'autres façons d'aider

Vous voulez piratez l'album quand il sortira ? Vous pouvez quand même aider.  Parlez de Tunguska Mammoth à vos amis sur facebook, dans les groupes, sur vos pages, à vos médias locaux, à la radio locale (et moins locale), venez dans nos shows, partagez votre pichet et invitez-nous à jouer dans le bar crasse pas loin de chez vous.

story:
Autumn 2014 sees the launch of a brand new cross-genre ensemble. The Engines Orchestra consists of some of London's most exciting young classical and jazz musicians who have come together in a group to challenge conventions and push the boundaries of creative music making and improvisation. In our first project the Engines Orchestra is collaborating with the Phil Meadows Group for our debut album Lifecycles, to be launched at the 2014 EFG London Jazz Festival on 22nd November.


The group is lead by Peter Whittingham Jazz Award winner and Parliamentary 'Newcomer of the Year' Phil Meadows and features the talents of trumpeter Laura Jurd, pianist Elliot Galvin, bassist Conor Chaplin and drummer Simon Roth.

'A collection of rising stars on the British jazz scene...' – Jez Nelson (BBC Jazz on 3)

In the first few months we have achieved so much already but our plans reach so much further than this initial project. We've already set up an educational branch teaching workshops and engaging communities of young music makers. We're putting together a series of performance platforms to showcase smaller ensembles from within our ranks and have a programme of artist development to help grow the scene further afield.

We're almost set to launch our debut album – but it doesn't stop there. We need your help to create a sustainable future, to set new projects in motion and to cement the foundations of our community. 

The Facts:
  • With support from the Peter Whittingham Jazz Award, Arts Council England and considerable personal investment we have raised £16,000 allowing us to make our first steps in developing the music and recording our first album. 
  •  But, the pot is running dry and we need your help. 
  • With your support we can create a sustainable future, set new projects in motion and to cement the foundations of our community.
  •  We are working to bring in new commissions, develop the ensemble and reach out to audiences through both performance and education.
  • We are looking to raise £2500 to market the group and develop the next project. Your donation will immediately help mobilise our next two educational courses, a series of smaller performance platforms and help research and develop our next large-scale collaboration.

If you would like to help but you cannot contribute through financial means, simply sharing this page and spreading the word means a great deal to us. We're also interested in people offering help in different areas (professional advice, arts opportunities, street team). The more people involved the more people we can engage!


Lifecycles Personnel:

Phil Meadows Group
Phil Meadows (composer / saxophones); Laura Jurd (trumpet); Elliot Galvin (piano / keyboards); Conor Chaplin (double / electric bass); Simon Roth (drums / percussion) 

Engines Orchestra
Conductor: Matt Roberts. Brass: Jim Davison (trumpet); Eddie Morgan (french horn); James Buckle (bass trombone). Woodwinds: Jennah Smart (flutes); Rob Cope (clarinet / flute); Gennie Joy (bass clarinet / clarinet). Harp: Tori Handsley. 1st Violins: Emily Davis (principal); Tom Aldren; Alice Zawadzki (+ vocals); Katherine Waller. 2nd Violins: Minn Majoe (principal); Kirsty Lovie; Claire Sledd; Connie Chatwin. Violas: Matt Maguire (principal); Joe Fisher; George White. Cellos: Zosia Jagodzinska (principal); Gregor Riddell.

story:
About C.O.M.P.

The Community Music School of Ann Arbor (CoMuA2) has joined forces with the Ann Arbor Public Schools in the powerful Cooperative Outreach Music Program (COMP) initiative.  COMP serves under-resourced music students in Ann Arbor by:

  • Providing after-school private music lessons with dedicated teachers.
  • Offering scholarships to highly motivated players to participate in CoMuA2's ensemble programs: Youth Orchestra, The Brandenburg Project, and Jazz Studies.
  • Nurturing a musical journey that shapes them into confident, capable and creative human beings.
****The video tells of the impact of our students' musical journey in their own words.  PLEASE WATCH!*****
Thank you to our 2013 -2014 Generous Sponsors:

-Individuals like YOU!!!!!
-Mardi Gras Fund
-Ann Arbor Area Community Foundation
-Burns Park Players

Our Goals 

The sustainability of COMP completely depends on reaching our goal of $25,000 this month.  We want to ensure that our students continue to:

  • grow in their private lessons
  • excel in their school music programs
  • be inspired in CoMuA2's intense ensemble programs
  • and learn invaluable skills that ensure success not only in school but in life.

The Impact

Watch the video and you will see, these students have been touched by their experiences in a way that can barely be expressed by words alone.  Here are a few telling quotes:

  • "Cello is the only constant in my life...it's something I can always go to and express myself." -Alex
  • "My family is just made of music...it's in my family, and IT'S IN ME." -Eben 
  • "Everything I've done with the trumpet has been magnified times ten...Paul is a great teacher." -Clarence 
  • "When I went to hold the cello in my lap, I knew I was going to play that and I knew I was going to be good." -Savannah 

Challenges

As a nonprofit organization providing these COMP lessons at little to no charge, we are constantly searching for financial support of our programs. Our instructors go far above and beyond for these students, who truly deserve this kind of opportunity.

  • If this message has moved you, please consider a contribution. EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS.
  • Through as many channels as possible, we will continue to get our message out that equal access to music education is important.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • MAKE SOME NOISE! Share this campaign with everyone you know- at the coffee shop, through social media, and any way you communicate with.  Just show them the video and they'll now exactly what you mean!
  • Click on our Facebook page below and "like" our video!!

story:
Back in August I had to decide what my “senior project” for Fresco Arts Academy would entail, and I decided I wanted to record several of my original songs and sell the tracks to raise money for a local charity.  I thought long and hard about which charity I’d support and decided to partner with the Boise Bicycle Project (http://www.boisebicycleproject.org), a great organization who have refurbished and given bikes to over 2,500 kids in need.

One person who was enthusiastic about the project was music great Curtis Stigers. Here’s the amazing thing—Curtis said if I was willing to work a little harder, write a few more songs, have the highest of standards, that he’d produce the album!  This is my dream! Of course, I said yes!

 This brings me to where I am today.  Curtis agreed to produce the album and I got srious, and decided if I was going to make an album with Curtis Stigers producing then I should get together with my amazing friends and make the BEST ALBUM EVAH!

We have Micah Stevens on guitar!

 Shad Tuck on bass!


T.J. Tuck on drums!


Together we're the band COBA and we're going to BLOW YOUR MIND!

We’ve worked hard to write a dozen songs for the album. With Curtis Stigers mentoring, Steve Fulton with us in the studio, I couldn’t be more excited.

As my ambitions grew, so did the cost of making the album.  The studio time and cost to have the record made (licensing, design, photography, digital distribution, CDs with packaging, a small run of vinyl) comes to just over $4K.

Here’s what I promise: 

1. It's going to be a great album.

2. Any money we raise beyond the cost of having the album made will go directly toward buying bikes for kids. 

3. For the first month after the record is released, 100% of the proceeds raised from the sale of the album will go toward buying bikes for kids.

It’s going to be a blast, making beautiful music and helping a great cause.

Be well, and thanks for considering donating to our project.

Sincerely,

Andrew Coba

cost of making the album.  The studio time and cost to have the record
made (licensing, design, photography, digital distribution, CDs with packaging,
a small run of vinyl) comes to just over $4K.
Here’s what I promise: 
1. It's going to be a great album.
2. Any money we raise beyond the
cost of having the album made will go directly toward buying bikes for kids. 
3. For the first month after the
record is released, 100% of the proceeds raised from the sale of the album will
go toward buying bikes for kids.
It’s going to be a blast, making
beautiful music and helping a great cause.
Be well, and thanks for
considering donating to our project.
Sincerely,
Andrew Coba

story:
To Our Divide formed 5 years ago when the Drummer (Daniel Jumaquio) and the Singer (Timon Moolman) met as roommates for college. Since then, it has gone through a number of name changes as well as lineup changes but the love for loud and large music has remained. Recording has always been a passion for the band members. Small home studios and brief stints at recording studios have been done before by To Our Divide and they are extremely excited to do a full project in studio. 

Our band is hoping to record an e.p. at Sheepdog Studios in Hamilton with Glen Watkinson. Two of our band members have had the opportunity of learning from Glen in the past and were both extremely impressed with his skill, knowledge and insight into the industry. Based on our work with him in the past as well as past projects he has released we knew that working with Glen was the way to go. 

A full e.p. package with Glen includes recording, editing and mixing of the stated number of songs. We would love to reach our goal and record a 5 song e.p. with him but have also considered a 4 song e.p, option. Any money that we raise that will not go to Sheepdog Studios will go to printing the album and supportive merchandise.

There will be some fun perks depending on the amount you wish to donate!

story:
The Project

Hi, I'm Melody and I am a songwriter. If you aren't already familiar with me and my work, please check out: www.melodywalkermusic.com . If you are already a fan, and want to know why I am hitting you up for money, please read on...


There's no doubt that the music industry has changed dramatically in the past decade. The internet has made it possible for Indie bands and artists to reach millions of fans and offer a sound and image that is competitive with commercial artists. Modern record execs, publicists and booking agents want to see someone who is talented and driven and making things happen on their own. They want the whole package, wrapped and delivered, with a built-in audience. This takes a little money and a ton of hard work. I'm asking you for help with both.


For a little history... I recorded my first live album of originals in the summer of 2005. I hatched a plan for a high-quality, low-budget live recording, and gathered about 40 people to donate $15 to come watch me do it. I had 300 copies of "Live at Shaky Hand" burned locally and I hand packaged every CD myself. Through college I collaborated with several touring world music bands and released CDs with AkaBella, WoMama and Bloco Firmeza. I also ran a women's open-mic night and started the lady-folk trio Vintner's Daughters which renewed my love of the Americana music I was raised on. I learned a lot about music production and promotion and had a great time building strong musical communities with those groups, but now It's time for my music to shine again!


In the last five years, and particularly in the last year, I have been honing my songwriting voice. The songs are here and now that voice is ready to sing! Jacob and I recorded three of these new songs in January for a live, acoustic demo (the "III EP") that we will use to get gigs and shop to record companies, but I'm not holding my breath waiting for a record deal to make the album of my dreams: I'm going to do it grassroots style... and I need your help! 


In the next nine months I will record, mix, master, manufacture, promote and release my first solo studio album. This album will consist of at least eleven new full-band, professional, multi-track arrangements with great fidelity and production value. It also comes with a commitment on my part to promote the album as a full-time job and tour tirelessly to support it. I have spent the last ten years acquiring the skills I need to undertake this project independently, and now I am ready to rock. It's now or never. All I need is a little push from the people I love.


What Your Donation Means

Your donation will directly and exclusively fund the recording and release of my first studio album. Nothing more. Funds garnered from future album sales will go to tour support and investment in future recordings. Consider your donation as a domino in the long Rube Goldberg Machine of my music career. One little push and your love and energy will still be in motion years down the line, making it all possible.


Project Timeline


May - July 2011:   Recording

Tracking and rough-mixing the songs in an affordable local studio


August 2011:   Final Mixing

Putting it all together and polishing the rough edges


September 2011:   Mastering

Making sure it sounds great on every stereo, radio and iPod


September 2011:   Duplication

Sending it off to Discmakers to become a thousand little records


October 2011:   Promotion

Getting pre-release copies into the hands of radio, reviewers, and funders


November 2011:   CD Release

Throwing a big ole party to celebrate the album release


Nov. 2011 - into 2012:   Tour

Hopping on the road to share the music



Budget Breakdown

What it will cost:

Studio time: $5,000

Final Mix and Mastering: $2,000

CD Duplication: $2,000

Publicity: $1,000


Total Budget: $10,000


How I'll raise it:

*$5,000 from IndieGoGo* (That's You!)

$3,000 out of pocket (That's Me!)

$2,000 from concerts and EP sales


The "Perks" of Philanthropy

Just in case the "love domino" analogy wasn't quite enough to sway you, there are also some pretty sweet gifts - or "perks" - available at every level of donation from "groupie" to "executive producer". Listed rewards will be sent by the end of July 2011. All donors, regardless of pledge amount, will receive one complimentary signed copy of the full-length album prior to its November 2011 release. 

Fan: $10 contribution
Receives the III EP, in your choice of a digital download or hard copy. Plus, the amazing, fabulous album once it is finished.

Groupie: $25 contribution
Same perks as a "fan" plus a color Melody Walker poster for your bedroom

Roadie: $50 contribution
Same perks as a "groupie" but both the poster and CD are signed by yours truly

Manager: $100 contribution
All the perks of a "fan", "groupie" or "roadie" plus exclusive access to project updates with images and sounds from inside the recording studio.

Engineer: $300 contribution
All the managerial perks plus a Thank You shout-out in the CD liner notes.

Executive Producer: $500 contribution
Not only do you get a signed CD, poster, exclusive updates and a producer credit, but you get to have a say in the production of the album. Track order, album title and sample mixes will all come your way for input.

Financier Extraordinaire: $1,000 contribution
Every perk ever mentioned, plus a 90 minute private performance to be redeemed at your leisure.


Can't Spare a Dime, but Still Wanna Help?

I would LOVE that!  It really does take a village to raise a Rock Star. Here are some ideas:


Help me PROMOTE online and in person. 

Please do post, tweet, email, text and otherwise share this link to as many folks as possible. This goes for the fundraising project as well as the album once it is released. 


Contribute ARTISTICALLY to the cause.

Once the CD is out, we will be in need of kick-ass design ideas for merch, posters and music videos. Not to mention a killer website. If you know how to do any of those things, let me know.


Come VOLUNTEER to help out with a show.

We can always use helpers to make shows better. Postering, decorating, ushering, ticket-taking... all these things help an event run smoothly and keep a community vibe alive. 


Check your NETWORK for influential friends.

I will be sending the CD to any and all musical big-shots I know, but my network is only so big. Perhaps you know someone who might dig my music and be able to help take it to the next level? 


Feel free to DEMAND that my music be played and sold everywhere.

This can be as simple as calling up your favorite radio station and requesting my songs, or suggesting it to a retailer. Obviously this is most effective on a local level, but who knows? Sometimes all you have to do is ask. You can also book me to play a local venue or even at your house for an intimate concert.


Bring your IDEAS to the table.

I am interested in any and all off-the-wall ideas about building this musical community. The music industry has changed completely, and the glory goes to the ingenious these days. Be my think tank!

story:
Who:

Jerdie and I are biochemistry majors and members of I Cantori,the chamber choir at Southern Adventist University (SAU).

What: The Trip

This summer I Cantori is going on their international missionary tour to Scandinavia

When:

May 2013, right after my graduation (Jerdie still has a year left).

Where: Europe!

I Cantori is touring Scandinavia Finland, Norway, and Sweden.

Why We Care:

We have been raised in the music ministry and we believe it is an amazing way to witness.

Why Contribute?

If you believe in the music ministry, have been part of an ensemble, or have been touched by a song, you have seen the power of music. Please help us share that power with others this May.

Perks!

We have great perks at different levels! You can choose one of our perks or just contribute any amount you prefer. Also, please share this campaign! Your voice is just as important as your contribution.

story:
Dear Friends,

  Let me just start by thanking every one that has supported me, and my musical endevours over the years.  I just moved to Chicago one month ago, and I have been fortunate enough to have made some amazing friends, and musicians.  I am extremely excited for these new musical projects!   Yesterday afternoon my Electric Blue Moog Voyager and Arturia midi controller were stolen, here is the serial # 10425i2 

I have already done eveything in my power to find my beloved Moog Voyager, it is like loosing a part of my soul.. SERIOUSLY!

Moog has become an essential sound for me and my keyboard arsenal, it is really a part of who I am as a musician, and sadly it is gone!  This is a 3500$ synthesizer, so any donation would be greatly appreciated.  Also, please please please spread the word about this, even if you cannot contribute, you can use the indiegogo share tools.  Tangible items may be stolen, but ones ideas will never be taken.  The music must go on!  I love you all.

story:
Pandulce 3-month Artist Residency 2015, Denver

Hello! I am Gabriel Todd aka Pandulce, vocalist/songwriter/producer/dancer/performer living in Oakland, California. Pandulce music is a genre-fluid blend of roots music, folk, experimental pop, field recordings, and electronic music. It incorporates solo and polyphonic vocals, acoustic instruments (banjo, uke, guitar, melodica, etc.) and a laptop. I produce and perform music as a solo act, in bands, in contemporary dance classes, as well as in live dance and theater performance. Over the past 5 years I have had the opportunity to tour and travel in Europe, Costa Rica, and throughout the United States as a performer, musician, and dancer. After some years of collaborating and touring in works instigated/directed by others I feel inspired and ready to take my own show on the road. I have been in the Bay Area for a few years working, occasionally thriving, and sometimes struggling, but mostly jobbing just to pay rent. Its time to take some space and time from the hustle and hone in on what really matters to me----sharing in live music and movement with you!

I am excited to announce that I will be headed to Denver in January for a 3-month independently-produced artist residency. During the residency I will work full-time to develop a live music act/show to perform on the road in all kinds of venues as well as a modest 4-song EP.  I have secured the support of some of my favorite local Colorado musicians, dancers, and videographers as well as an awesome temporary home and work space in Denver. Now I need your support to bring this vision into full flight in 2015.

FLY: a late night livingroom performance.....


The Exchange

Let's have an exchange! As an independent musician and performer I rely on the support of fans, friends, and family to share what I do with more people. I have 30 days to raise $6000 to launch the Denver residency and production of the downloadable 4-song EP. I would love the opportunity to share this project with you in a live or recorded context in 2015 and beyond. This residency is the next step in making that possible. Before I tell you about the perks of donating, here is the budget.

Residency Budget: $6000.

$1400.    work studio/room rental and basic utilities for 3 months

$1200.    Food for 3 months

$3000.   Recording, producing, mastering downloadable 4-song  EP.

$400.      Air fare SFO>DEN>SFO

Your donations however big or small will enable me to develop and share this music with more people. In exchange for your donation I am offering some awesome perks. If you donate at least $10. you will receive a download of the 4-song EP, to be released by the end of April. Donate $25 and you can download the EP plus receive a set of 4 unique postcards featuring prints of my collage art work. Folks who give $100. or more will have access to a weekly video blog featuring updates, mini concerts and short interviews with collaborators. I am also offering a limited edition of handmade (by me) Pandulce bird dolls for those who donate $500. There are other perks on offer, please have a look to the right. >

I am confident that funds can be raised to make this happen. Any and all funds raised here will support the residency and recording project no matter what. If I raise less than my goal I will eat beans and rice and record the EP in my work studio with less professional engineering support. If I make more than my goal, I will put that money toward the best recorded sound possible as well as pay collaborators, musicians, and videographers modest artist fees.


The Process

What's an independently-produced artist residency? Independently-produced is simply referring to the fact that I have no institutional sponsorship or support for this residency. That's why I am reaching out to you. One of the benefits of independently-producing is that artists have more control over what we make and how and where we distribute and perform. With your contribution and support I can spend the time it takes to develop and produce something that I will be excited to take on the road and share with a wider audience.

Why Denver? I spent 7 years in Denver and Boulder training, making and performing with some amazing musicians, artists, dancers and friends. I am looking forward to some collaborations, inspirations, and re-connections with the landscape and the people. I know the quiet and the spaciousness of the mountains and plains has much to offer me, especially in the winter. I look forward to returning to the Bay Area refreshed and renewed and ready to share some new music and performance with all of you. If you don't live in Denver, Boulder or the Bay Area then I look forward to seeing you on a future tour!

What experiences have led you to this? I have been making art and performing most of my life. Some specific moments stand out as testament to my ability to take my music performance and new album to the next level.

In 2002, I was a featured vocalist and musical collaborator in a contemporary circus called Circo Zero. A little less than a year after a successful one month run in the SF Bay Area we produced a CD version of music from the show. We also performed for 3 consecutive summers at the Oregon Country Fair in Eugene, Oregon. I grew a lot as a performer and music maker in the process of writing, rehearsing, performing and then finally recording in collaboration with Loren Olds, Neal Stewart, and Keith Hennessey.

In the 7 years I was in Boulder/Denver I completed 2 degree programs, a BFA in Performance at Naropa University and an MFA in Dance Performance and Choreography at CU Boulder. My focus in both degree programs was the intersection of live music, dance, and video/film.  During that time I also continued to make and perform original music both inside and outside of the university context in bars, theaters, and local festivals. 

For the past few years I have maintained a presence on Soundcloud, producing sound/music content for a growing international audience. I have been sharing new music, experimental tracks, as well as sound scores created for live performance. Here are some links to recent tracks produced for soundcloud listeners:

https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/good-morning-traveller

https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/untethered

https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/tangentia-magnifique

What challenges might you face? When it comes to preparing to share my work with a live audience I am sometimes a perfectionist. This isn't always a bad thing, but it can slow me down at times. During the residency I will have a set schedule of working on new material, rehearsing for performing, recording and interaction/collaboration with other artists. I plan to keep myself moving, making and performing so that my perfecting is part of a generative context of doing/sharing live music.

My past experiences in living, making and performing have laid the foundation for this next phase of my artistic development. During the 3-month Pandulce residency in Denver I will work full-time, fine tuning a few old songs as well as developing new music for live performance. I am grateful to share this journey with you, and I thank you in advance for your support and generosity. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate funds you can still support this project by spreading the word, coming out to see a live show and/or by donating services such as printing, studio time, web design, or whatever else you feel inspired to share.

Why 
Denver? I spent 7 years in Denver and Boulder training, making and performing with 
some amazing musicians, artists, dancers and friends. I am looking 
forward to some collaborations, inspirations, and re-connections with 
the landscape and the people. I know the quiet and the spaciousness of 
the mountains and plains has much to offer me, especially in the winter.
 I look forward to returning to the Bay Area refreshed and renewed and 
ready to share some new music and performance with all of you. If you 
don't live in Denver, Boulder or the Bay Area then I look forward to seeing you on a future
 tour!
What experiences have led you to this? I have been making art and performing most of my life. Some specific moments stand out as testament to my ability to take my music performance and new album to the next level.
In 2002, I was a featured vocalist and musical collaborator in a 
contemporary circus called Circo Zero. A little less than a year after a
 successful one month run in the SF Bay Area we produced a CD version of
 music from the show. We also performed for 3 consecutive summers at the
 Oregon Country Fair in Eugene, Oregon. I grew a lot as a performer and 
music maker in the process of writing, rehearsing, performing and then 
finally recording in collaboration with Loren Olds, Neal Stewart, and 
Keith Hennessey. 
In the 7 years I was in Boulder/Denver I completed 2 degree programs, a BFA in Performance at Naropa University and an MFA in Dance Performance and Choreography at CU Boulder. My focus in both degree programs was the intersection of live music, dance, and video/film.  During that time I also continued to make and perform original music both inside and outside of the university context in bars, theaters, and local festivals. 
For the past few years I have maintained a presence on Soundcloud, producing sound/music content for a growing international audience. I have been sharing new music, experimental tracks, as well as sound scores created for live performance. Here are some links to recent tracks produced for soundcloud listeners:
https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/good-morning-traveller
https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/untethered
https://soundcloud.com/pandulce/tangentia-magnifique
What challenges might you face? When it comes to preparing to share my work with a live audience I am sometimes a perfectionist. This isn't always a bad thing, but it can slow me down at times. During the residency I will have a set schedule of working on new material, rehearsing for performing, recording and interaction/collaboration with other artists. I plan to keep myself moving, making and performing so that my perfecting is part of a generative context of doing/sharing live music. 
My past experiences in living, making and performing have laid the foundation for this next phase of my artistic development. During the 3-month Pandulce residency in Denver I will work full-time, fine tuning a few old songs as well as developing new music for live performance. I am grateful to share this journey with you, and I thank you in advance for your support and generosity. 



Other Ways You Can Help 


If you are unable to donate funds you can still support this project by 
spreading the word, coming out to see a live show and/or by donating services such as printing, studio time, web design, or whatever else you feel inspired to share.

story:
BIO:

Krematorium is an energetic thrash metal band with  five band members from Croatia. 

We had many distinguished gigs in Rijeka and close surrounding, among them where Opatijske barufe and Rirock, and participated in Bosnia and Herzegovina in the war of the bands show which featured on OBN. We have two studio recording Without fucking remorse (2009) and Evil is released (2011) and don't plan to stop there.

THE PROJECT:

 Currently we are working on a new album which will feature 8 brand new song with new sound and a lot more creativity.

We manage to keep our expenses to a minimum but there is still a lot of work to be  done. The recording process is nearly done but the album still needs to be mixed and mastered and this part can be very expensive since we need to hire a professional.

In addition to the mixing process we are also preparing for a tour, and for that we need to make CD covers, printed CD-s, a banner, T-shirts, badges, patches, and other merchandise, (not to mention strings, cables, and other small and boring but necessary stuff)

Of course we will be offering incentives for contributions like T-shirts, patches, stickers, badges... Some of them we already got some still need to be made.

SUMMARY TO WHAT YOU ARE CONTRIBUTING: 

  • Album Mixing 
  • Album mastering
  • Cover artwork
  • CD Pressing
  • Merchandise 

IF WE DO NOT REACH OUR GOAL:

We will still go forward with our plans as they stand, the album will be finished within the deadline, but the release will be postponed until we have the appropriate CD pressing, artwork and merchandise for a proper release.  
For now these are the things we got:

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute financially we would appreciate if you would share our campaign with your friends.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION 

And if you got any questions you can contact us via E-mail on 

krematorium01@gmail.com

Or on Facebook:                                                                                           www.facebook.com/krematoriumRI

story:
Final Update!

Album is ready, busy with download and package delivery! Please contact me if you have any questions and  don't forget I owe you your downloads and packages!!! Cheers! :)

Update 3!

Time's up!  Unfortunately I haven't raised enough money even for basic operations but thanks to people who contributed, they gave me some chances! I'm finishing some stuff, it will take a week, two weeks maximum! Don't lose contact, I'm still here! Or send me a message to my mail box!

Update 2!

So it's two weeks left, the album is almost ready, finishing some micro stuff! :D

Btw

If you have a better idea on a $2 perk, leave a comment here, k? :)

Update!

You can already take a look at Super Meat Boy cover in Danny B's album on MeatBoyMusic.com, track 30!!!

My Story

(Words from video)

Hi, I'm George Dziov, also known as Android-Music over the web! So why am I sitting here in front of HQ cam and talking to ya? I'm pretty sure there's a lot of indie gamers who love metal as much as I do and would like to listen to their favorite music in heavy mind breaking arrangement! So I'm here to bring some metal to the Indie Scene! Let's go to my cabin!
Currently I'm working on an album devoted to the 5 best and most promising indie games of this decade, those are Aquaria, Braid, Overgrowth, Super Meat Boy and Machinarium. Why did I make such a crazy decision? It all begins from the Wolfire website...
Once I heard some cool rock tracks on Wolfire web blog I decided to make my own contribution, I showed the track to the Wolfire guys, they liked the track and suggested me to make a guest post, that was really awesome! Later they organized Humble Indie Bundle which gave me great inspiration! That's how that idea with an "indie" album came to me.


The Impact

There was a lot of Mario, Sonic, Contra, Castlevania remixes, why not make metal remixes on these 5 really rocking games? My opinion? That will sound epic, some tracks are already done!!! Of course these games have already great soundtracks, I'd prefer to  call 'em masterpieces but I DO NOT imagine Indie World without some hot metallic teeth scratching remixes! It's a really nice surprise for indies, nah?

What I Need & What You Get

Well well, what about the money? I'll use them to construct a giant robot that will conquer the world(http://www.newgrounds.com/art/view/android-musi... )!!! Joking, this is one of my game characters. I'm raising money to set up a normal site, music store, make some decent t-shirts for you, pay for my flat debts(sometimes  it's really hard to live in Russia) and to upgrade my home studio equipment, my pc is very old and weak(Celeron 2 Ghz), I work with a USSR stereo system  RADIOTECHNIKA S-30B and old Audigy2 so obviously I need to obtain  new pc, studio monitors and better soundcard.

Plus I need to finish my bonus material, you know, that's not that easy(bonus is a really sweet thing, I just want to keep it in secret yet)!

Other Ways You Can Help

Awwww no need really but if you wanna help or just wanna see something else, here you go:

1 - Share tools

2 - Visit the camera guy's page at vimeo - http://vimeo.com/hidjrati - their works are really cool, I'll proudly say - professionals!

3 - Visit my site - I really like to see rising statisitcs :)

4 - Suggest me some physical help(any idea, arghghgh!)

5 - Visit

http://wolfire.com/

http://supermeatboy.com/

http://machinarium.net/

http://braid-game.com/

http://www.bit-blot.com/

6 - Spread a word or two about this project (but no more :D  )


Thanks for attention! :)

story:
Our Story

Raul has been a member of the British Columbia Boy's Choir since 2004. He has had the good fortune over the years to participate in tours to China, France, Italy, Holland, Australia as well as various places in North America. This year the choir is scheduled to tour Costa Rica in March 2012, but due to financial constraints Raul and his family are unable to come up with the funds. As an important part of the Baritone section, he would be greatly missed, and as well, being that he is in grade 11 and will be graduating highschool the following year, this tour to Costa Rica would likely be his last tour with the choir. The choir has been such a huge part of Raul's life and has been such a positive force in his life, musically and otherwise. He deperately wants to sing with the choir on this his last international tour.

The Impact

If Raul cannot raise the money, he will not be able to tour with the choir to Costa Rica. He is searching for a part time job to help fund it and his parents are also doing their best to contribute but these are difficult times. He would be sorely missed by the choir if he was unable to come up with the funds.


What We Need & What You Get

The total cost for Raul to tour (everything included) and perform in Costa Rica in March of 2012 is $2900.00.

If you would like to be eligible for a tax reciept you may send a cheque made out to the BC Boys Choir with "Tour for Raul" written on the memo line. Receipts will be issued for donations over $20 and can be sent to BC Boys Choir c/o P.O. Box 321, Stn A Nanaimo BC V9R 5L3 Canada


UPDATE JAN 2ND 2011

Thank you to all of you who have contributed! With the money that was sent directly to the British Columbia Boy's Choir I have reached my goal... Costa Rica here I come!!!!!!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of any patrons of the arts, or those who may be willing to help a young musician- please pass this along, every dollar counts! As well, if any of you know of a part time job for Raul please contact us!

story:
Who is Katie?!

Hi! So my name is Katie Clarke and I am a tea drinking, cat loving English pianist living in Los Angeles. I started playing the piano at a very young age, and trained as a classical concert pianist.

So who is Estela?!

Well now you have met Katie, time to meet Estela. Estela is a new character I have created that is hoping to blur the lines between the past, present and future. Her music takes inspiration from the classical piano music from centuries ago, and fuses it alongside the pop culture and musical trends of today. She's fierce, she's fun and she's out to revolutionise the piano music world! 

To make the dream a reality

Now in a perfect world, I would click my fingers and Estela would be ready to go, fabulous outfit and all! But unfortunately to make this wish come true I need your help. 

My goal is to raise $5000 so I can transport Estela from the page to the stage (oh yes, I'm so excited I'm rhyming!) Your donations will go towards:

  • An in ear monitor system - so I can hear what I'm doing while performing
  • A music video - that includes a videographer, photographer, makeup artist and venue
  • Sound engineering - professional mixing and mastering
  • An album - ready for digital download or hard copy sales
  • A fabulously fierce outfit - for the final touch in live performance  
  • Cat toys - Ok....this one is fake.....although cat toy donations will always be accepted 

Perks

Aside from my enternal gratitude, perks will include a free signed copy of the album, a signed copy of my lead single score, and a personalised dedication in the liner notes. 

On a personal note... (pun intended)

This is definitely a project that means a lot to me. Not only is it a chance for me to share a vision that I have been working on for years, but I really want to highlight how not all musicians have to stay in their pocket, and instead can branch out and experiment. For many years, classical music, in particular, conjures up images of being "boring", "old" or "dry". Although Estela isn't keeping it in it's original form, she still heavily uses and references many of the amazing pieces of music written hundreds of years ago, and hopefully showcases them off in a new light that will bring in an audience who may have passed the original by!

Please Share!

So finally.....thank you so so much, and if you aren't able to contribute, please share it with your family and friends and help me make this happen!
