story:
*Great news! Thought we've only raised $340 on our Indiegogo campaign, though other sources we've currently raised around $3100! We're a third fully funded! Read our update for more info!!*

Hello, we’re Everember!

Everember is an young alternative Christian, Pop/Rock band from the cotton covered lands of Eastern, NC. Since its birth in late 2009, Everember has existed as a mission to be a positive witness through lifestyle and substantial musical production. This isn’t your stereotypical rock band.

Check the music out on iTunes or Facebook

The Campaign


Everember has been presented the amazing opportunity to record an EP with Grammy nominated and Dove award winning producer/engineer, Travis Wyrick. He has produced and mentored groundbreaking artists such as P.O.D., Pillar, Dolly Parton, Disciple and many others. With your help, Everember can be on that list. Through Wyrick’s professional caliber and connections, we have the potential to not only reach the Christian market, but also to breach the mainstream industry and make a difference. This isn’t just the creation of an EP, it could very well be the start of a full-time career.

Where does the money go?

On November 26th, Everember will head on up to Knoxville, TN and begin tracking the EP. The money raised on from this campaign will be used to cover the cost of as much studio time possible. The more time Everember spends in Knoxville, the better this EP will be. In addition to the money that Everember has already raised, the current goal of $9,000 dollars translates into two complete weeks of studio time. The EP can be produced in much less time than that, but hey, let’s shoot for the stars!

-Every dime raised will be spent on as many hours of studio time as possible!-

*Funding Facts*

Backers, should this entire project end due to some unforeseen issue that keeps the band from actually recording this EP, your contributions will be reimbursed in full the week of December 9th, 2012. This, however, doesn’t include a rescheduling of studio time due to possible illness, injuries or things of that sort.

The Product

After completing this project with Wyrick, Everember will effectively have a professional quality 5-6 song EP ready for some serious promoting. Songs one a level like these can be the best first impression a band could ever have. Some of the possible open doors as a result of this project are; professional touring opportunities, radio interviews, substantial amounts of radio play and a further developed live show. As we've stated before, this could be the first and largest step into creating a career of our a hobby.

A Final Note

Please feel free to share this project with your friends and family. We can't thank you enough for all of your support and love over the past three years. We know we can count on you to help us launch this ministry into a career!

For those of you who’ve been keeping up with us for a while, Everember will still be releasing its self produced album, entitled "Artifacts", early this January! Thanks for anticipating this along with us!

God Bless you all!
-Everember

story:
Hello Friends!

Thanks for checking out my project.  I'm a Multi-Instrumentalist Singer, Songwriter, Music Director, Educator, and Touring Artist. 
 
With a soulful voice and acoustic guitar, Basim’s music is almost entrancing; a certain element of relativity makes his songs personable and inviting. His voice is reminiscent of John Legend with a certain uniqueness that is refreshing. He has a neo-soul style of playing that mixes in a little folk and hip-hop. Addicting and memorable, he will have you humming the tunes of his music.
T. Tillman, Creative Loafing CL

Short Summary:

This is my first ever Indiegogo fundraising campaign. The purpose of the campaign is to fund the production of my new album and 9 city North American Tour Sprin 2013.

What I need and what you get:

My goal is $5,000 which what I need to record, mix and master my new CD, as well as covering touring expenses. This amount will commit me to finishing the CD and the first leg of the tour. 

All of the songs are written, arranged, composed and ready to be recorded. I will be playing all of the instruments including Guitar (Acoustic & Classical), Bass, Drums, Bamboo Flute, Accordian, Keys, African Thumb Harp, Ukulele, and more!

Until now I have recorded, mixed, produced, duplicated and distributed my last two albums all out of pocket. (as well as the filming and editing of the video above) This go round I am looking to raise the bar on my production, and this is where you can help.  

 

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help!!

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing this on Facebook and other social media!

THANK YOU!!

 

 

I truly appreciate the loyalty and trust that you give me by contributing to this CD and tour, so I am designing some perks into this preorder as a way of thanking you. 

 

IMPORTANT NOTES:  <Shipping charges are not included in the price of the items and must be manually added by you upon check out.>  Please carefully read the Indiegogo product description to determine the shipping price for the item you are ordering, and then please add that amount to your total.  IT WILL NOT AUTOMATICALLY BE ADDED TO YOUR TOTAL, YOU MUST DO IT MANUALLY.  For example, if you order a CD ($15) and you live outside of the U.S. and Canada, your shipping price would be $8, so you would change the total checkout amount to $23.  (Each ordering option has its own set of shipping charges) 
 
T-Shirt sizes - There is no way to tell us what size of t-shirt you need on the Indiegogo order page, so just go ahead and order the t-shirt and we will contact you via email to get the size of t-shirt that you want.
 
THANKS!

story:
I've got a new album (listen to the special edition here), featuring the song I See You, that you can get now. You'll receive six extra songs (for a total of 20 on the download), bonus features and better quality audio. Why should you get the album now? 

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to hire a publicist or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could wait for the album to come out in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. When you buy through a store I get less too and I don't even receive that smaller amount from albums sold until months later.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, churches and charities -- something for everyone. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out the special edition and the five bonus Christmas songs.

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Kondoot, ReverbNation, Stageit, MySpace and Pinterest. 

FAQ

Why have you set your goal so low?

Indiegogo charges higher fees if I don't reach my goal. So, I set a low goal in hopes of exceeding it and paying lower fees.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! I’ve had such great experiences with my international audience and I want you involved. Plus, the guy who helped me put this campaign together is a Canadian and he’s helped me figure out how to make it easier for you be a part.

You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Download, Let's Talk, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something -- CDs, shirts, etc. So, you can simply add a bit to your pledge to cover those costs. I’ll trust you to be fair when estimating that amount.

If you choose a reward package that involves travel you’ll be responsible for the travel costs.

How can I buy the Conversations album and/or the Conversations video?

I'm offering the album and video through this Indiegogo campaign right now. A shorter version of the album, with fewer songs and none of the bonus features, will be available through other channels. Indiegogo allows you to use a credit card or your PayPal account.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

What do you need for concert rewards?

It's pretty basic: You provide a sound system suitable for the size of audience and venue, along with a keyboard, an acoustic/electric guitar and two direct in boxes/connections.

My accommodation needs are simple too: One hotel room (two for Christmas concerts), meals and transportation to/from the airport.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

If I can send your rewards earlier than estimated cost-effectively, I will. I'll work hard to get your perks to you as quickly as possible after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, may need a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, may need a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.
What happens if you don't reach your goal?
You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.
How can I help with this campaign?
There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).
What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?
Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

story:
Background

     Hi, my name is Andre. I am a aspiring musician, who loves to help people no matter who they are as long as they have good intentions. Am currently operating a live Stream Internet Radio Known as Meknoise Radio. www.meknoise.com Meknoise is design for streaming Reggae/Dancehall, Gospel, Soca and other caribbean music. With the main focus on playing songs from Artist that are new and emerging. 

 

 Why your suport is needed.

     Since the inception of Meknoise Radio. I have been recieving plenty songs from independent, new and emerging artist from countries all over. They are passionate about thier art and eager to have you listen to the songs they are producing. I am dedicated and steadfast in providing these songs with quality entertainment. But at this point I am the only operator of the stream, with my laptop as my studio. There are many music submissions by artist and I have limted resources. This situation hinder me from effectively serve a growing audience of music lovers and accommodate all submissions. So I need your support, to make the operation much smoother and interactive.

     It is the intention to grow Meknoise Radio into a mainstream Internet Radio Station where you the listeners can convene to learn about caribbean music and its culture. It is part of my wish for new and emerging artist that are of the caribbean music genres to have global opportunities where their music gets play without prejudice.  A place where any artist can showcase their music and not seen it get lost in the music community. The channel am hoping to create with your help, will be a place where music is play because of their good content and the disire of the consumers. You the listener will be able to access information about your favorite artist while you are empower to make the next artist.

     All listeners will be given the oppertunities to choose what they would like to hear and what is worth your time. This will also facilitate for people who wants to engage the music either new or classic, you will now have access to a channel that is informative and real. Preminent musicians will be highlight from the past and current eara for playing their part in the music and its culture. It his my deepest desire to bring music to your finger tips. I want to expose all the great music of the caribbean. What about you? Would you like to learn and hear more. With your support it will be a reality.

 

Why should you support the project?

You will benefit from Meknoise directly or indirectly. Because you maybe or know someone who is a producer, Disc Jocks, songwriter, enginer, singer, poet, music videographer, webdesigner, may need a job or others involve in the music business. It is possible you may know someone who his a music lover or you just like to see positive things, people progress and be successful.

What is need 

  • 2 Mac Computers                                                          
  • Headphones  
  • Studio Speaker/Monitor                                          
  • Mic
  • Analog Board/Digital Mixing Board                      
  • Cables
  • Same Broadcaster                                                    
  • External Hard Drive
  • Numark CD Player                                                     

              We need website designer and DJs.  Web designers and DJs may call 1917-731-5306 for more details. I will accept equitments if you wish to give. But please, only new equipements. Thanks!

 

We Will give

            Everyone will have a people station

            Shoutouts thanking you for your efforts.

            This plattform will bring you closer to the music.

            We will invite you to hang out with us at our studio once    it his finish

            Invitation to our promo party in Jamaica where you will meet many   Artist.

 

If we do not reach our goal 

We will use whatever amount we recieve and put towards the project to do what it can.

 

A kind heart can do alot!

Many people dream and it never comes to life. Why? most times we need help and no one help. But you can change all that, and not only will you make my dream a reality. But also the many singer songwriters, producers, Mom and Dads, children and even yourself and one of these aspiring talent could or maybe you. Please make dreams turn into reality.

This is  for a cause that will change our lives immensely.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

        You can tell your friend about us on social media by texting and blogging, Sharing out link and use word of mouth to spread it. What ever mean you have available.  Get the word out!  we want your tweets, Facebook posts, calls and messages to your friends and family members. We need to join forces to create a positive change in music, and every voice helps add to the reach of our message.  

Meknoise Radio Your Local Global Radio!

story:
Kaitie's Story

She is far from home, but marching closer to her dream every day. Kaitie Wade is a country pop singer-songwriter, performer, and recording artist originally from Seattle, Washington. Kaitie could sing before she could talk, and has a passion for music that only keeps growing. She made the move to Nashville, TN in 2012 where she studied music and vocal performance at a local four year university. Aside from school, the vivacious 22 year old spent time writing, recording and performing both solo and with other artists. She was recognized as a "Featured Artist" on Next Star Now, and "Superstar in the Making" by Hillbilly Express Radio. Kaitie has a unique sound stemming from influences such as Shania Twain, Miranda Lambert, Bon Jovi, and worship music from church.The dedicated singer has performed in some of Nashville's most famous venues including Tootsies Orchid Lounge. Kaitie's Debut EP, "Starts With A Song" has truly been making waves in the music industry. The lead single from the record, "Don't Wanna Miss", was released on March 21st and has already been featured both internationally and locally on Music Row Reporting stations such as Renegade Radio Nashville. 

 

About the Campaign

As an independent artist, the funds I need to further my career do not come easily. I am ecstatic that my lead single is receiving radio airplay and must grab ahold of this opportunity while I have the chance! The next step is to embark on a radio tour. The goal of this radio tour is to help get my music heard all over the country and hopefully playing on more stations- so that all this hard work and dedication may finally pay off! This is where your help is needed.  By contributing, you are not only helping me share my music with you and the rest of the world, but you are helping me take the next step in my career as a musician.

ANY contributions - whether it be hundreds or simply a penny, are INCREDIBLY appreciated from the bottom of my heart. Also, there are PERKS for donating, which can be found under the "perks" section! Thank you so much for supporting my journey and being a part of making this tour a reality!

 

All funds that are raised go straight to:

- Gas to make the 2,600 mile trip

-Food

-Hotel and lodging costs

-Other extra and unexpected expenses

 

FOR MORE:

Website- kwademusic.com (Full record available with free streaming)

Lead single, "Don't Wanna Miss" - https://open.spotify.com/track/4a0KvEHbSIiir0ekNL7GfB

Follow Me- Facebook.com/kaitiewademusic 

@kaitie_wadey

 

Other Ways You Can Help

*Request "Don't Wanna Miss" on your local radio stations.

*SPREAD THE NEWS (Every share means the world to me)

story:
Short Summary

In a nutshell, we are a progressive rock outfit that met in Cincinnati, Ohio through a unique set of circumstances. The music produced has been a labor of love influenced by bands we grew up on ... Yes, Genesis, Kansas, Rush, Pink Floyd, Jethro Tull, Peter Gabriel, etc.  We've been likened to the modern sounds of Porcupine Tree, Tool, Lifesigns and Spock's Beard to name a few. This album is a compilation of musical ideas that have been brewing for the past 25 years. Thanks to a resurgence on the musical scene of progressive rock, we were inspired at this time to bring this album to fruition.

What We Need & What You Get

We're not asking for the world ... We've already been blessed with great studio support that enabled us all the hours needed to complete tracking, editing, mixing and balancing of the album.

Now we need funds to master and replicate our music to bring this to the public.  We will do a small first run on CD's, digital download cards, posters and T-shirts. All funds raised will go directly to fulfilling the perks we have to offer for your contribution.

The Impact

We are the only original modern progressive band from Cincinnati, the Queen City.  We're not saving the world here ... just your ears.  YOU will be helping to continue the resurgence of the prog rock genre. Not only in Cincinnati, but throughout the globe.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Be our street warrior. Everyone knows a prog rock fan. Please pass this word on and help us make this 2 year endeavor come true.  Feel free to use Indiegogo and other social media tools to help spread our news.

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT "YOU!"

story:
Jaaleekaay - 

Global music with far reaching outcomes

Hi. I am Jennifer Lalor and I would like to share an exciting project with you.  Australian musician Steve Berry and I are reaching out for funding for Jaaleekaay, an international musical collaboration that provides an opportunity to develop the careers of some fabulous musicians from The Gambia in West Africa.

The Gambia is a country most of us know little about, so I’ll give you some background.  It is the smallest country on the African continent, and one of the poorest countries in the world. It’s sparse natural resources and high unemployment make daily life very difficult, and creates a subsequent dire effect on critical social factors such as health and education. One in ten Gambian children won’t live to see their 5th birthday and only 50% of the population over the age of 15 are literate.  It’s clear that improving economic opportunity is crucial to the health, wellbeing and development of the Gambian people.  This project supports that aim by helping two world class Gambian musicians  develop an international career.

Our vision

Jaaleekaay means “Crossing Point” in the West African language of Wolof and represents a powerfully creative meeting between the accomplished Aussie guitarist/producer Steve Berry and Gambian musicians Amadou Suso (Kora) and Yusupha Ngum (vocals).  These musicians first met when Steve travelled to Gambia in February this year, and it was from the creative spark that fired during this connection that Jaaleekaay was born.

Our long-term vision with Jaaleekaay is to establish a model where collaborations with Western musicians such as Steve create both wonderful music and opportunities for top musicians from economically disadvantaged countries to ply their trade in the wider world.  Such engagement connects financially poor countries with Western economies through the culturally rich art of their musicians, and through their art brings significant economic benefits back to their communities at home.

Our music and background

The video above showcases Jaaleekaay’s wonderful music, and gives you a taste of life in The Gambia, where this project was born.  The track is called Continental Drift, and is Jaaleekaay's debut track, recorded in Gambia in February 2013.

Jaaleekaay first came into being when Steve Berry, an award-winning guitarist, composer and producer from Byron Bay, NSW first visited The Gambia in February 2013.  Steve's Australian musical lineage goes back to the emergence of contemporary folk and world music in Australia in the 1980's, having mixed his musical DNA with some of the most innovative Australian acts in the genre, including Coolangubra, Kev Carmody, Shane Howard and Robyn Archer.  Steve's month long immersion in The Gambia began with an invitation to visit the country by King Marong, a Gambian traditional master percussionist now living in Australia.  Through King's many musical contacts in Gambia, Steve met the innovative young Kora player Amadou Suso, and through Amadou the Wolof singer Yusepha Ngum.  From the special musical connection that followed, Jaaleekaay emerged.

Amadou Suso  comes from a long lineage of Kora players, including his father and grandfather before him.  Suso is one of several influential Mandinka Griot names in West Africa, indicating a long family heritage of musicians.  With an ear for the contemporary and global influence, Amadou is now taking his family tradition on the next evolutionary step.

Yusupha Ngum is a singer from the Sengagambian tradition of Mbalax, which means 'Rhythm' in his first language of Wolof.  Like Amadou, Yusupha's musical heritage has been handed down through his family, his father also being a singer of reknown in Gambian Mbalax ensembles.  Yusupha himself leads an eight piece  group known as Jolef, and along with Amadou is now crossing cultural boundaries, bringing international audiences and Jaaleekaay  his expressive and authentic Wolof vocal style.

Jaaleekaay represents a convergence of musical expression between Steve, Amadou and Yusupha.  The trio's music embraces parallel influences while crossing between diverse cultural backgrounds.  It is music that adapts and evolves, exploring new territories and dispersing new musical ideas.

Current campaign 

Later this year our project aims to bring Amadou and Yusupha to Australia for a tour beginning November 2013.  One of our first steps however, is to build on the debut track Jaaleekaay recorded in February and record a full length album.  To do that we are asking for your support through this campaign.

Our plan is to take advantage of a trip Steve is taking to Germany, and bring Amadou and Yusupha there to spend a couple of weeks with Steve developing and recording their music.

Your support of this phase of the project would enable us to keep the project’s momentum and creative development growing, creating a recording that both promotes this multi cultural and multi-layered project while building a potential income stream for these talented Gambian musicians – income that will have a positive carry on effect for their families and community back home.

The bigger picture

It’s no wonder Steve has been inspired to engage in this new project. It is a natural offshoot from his years of experience blending music with philanthropy.  Along with a team of fellow musicians and supporters, over the past decade Steve founded and developed Music Outback Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to increasing positive outcomes for Indigenous children in remote Australia. Through developing ongoing relationships with schools and communities, Music Outback Foundation has successfully promoted and delivered music based education in over 50 remote Indigenous communities across Australia. This includes the production of nine music festivals known as Mobfest – events that see Indigenous kids performing their own songs on the big stage for their friends, family and communities.  To see some awesome examples of Music Outback’s Mobfest events and programs go here:

http://www.musicoutback.com.au

With almost 30 years on the Australian music scene, from playing the Sydney Opera House with Coolangubra to directing Mobfest events in remote Australia, Steve’s dedicated passion for music and social justice has had a powerful and important impact on the lives of many.

My role with Jaaleekaay is that of co-producer and organization development. I am a leadership consultant and associate of the Strozzi Institute, USA where I received my embodied leadership training through Richard Strozzi-Heckler. I have a passion for exploring human development and the arts in the context of leadership. I am also a former classical dancer and performance artist. I worked for many years with Anna and Daria Halprin of the Tamalpa Institute in California where I taught on core faculty utilizing movement and the performing arts in education, health and social change. In addition I have worked in live show production in the US and Europe.

What excites me about working with Jaaleekaay is the opportunity for my passion for human development, leadership and the arts to support new practices and pathways for social and economic growth for artists in disadvantaged economies.  Besides that, this unique convergence of music that is Jaaleekaay is so fantastic it deserves to be made available to a wide audience of music lovers!

Budget and Logistics

For the Jaaleekaay recording project, and this – our first crowd funding campaign - we had three scenarios to choose from: recording in Australia, The Gambia or somewhere in between!  The recording needs to take place soon, as it will be used to help build and promote the tour in Australia at the end of the year.   Coming to Australia twice in one year would not be cost effective, and with the Gambian rainy season being mid-year, plus unreliable power supplies and Ramadan being observed in July, recording in Gambia is not the best option either.  However, Steve is already scheduled to be in Germany mid year for a family visit, so we decided the best and most economical option is to bring Amadou and Yusupha to Germany during this time, where they can spend a couple of weeks with Steve recording, using equipment that he brings with him from Australia.

This campaign is reaching out for help with the cost of travel and accommodation  for Amadou and Yusupha, and other necessities for recording while in Germany.


Budget details (Australian dollars):

$2,400  -  Airfare from the Gambia to Frankfurt return for two

$400    -   European Visas, processing fees (including mandatory
              travel to Dakar, Senegal to obtain their visas)

$900    -   Accommodation and work space in Germany for 16 days

$300    -   Ground Transport                                                              

$500    -   Hire of equipment (specifically equipment too bulky to bring from Australia
              such as mic stands, speakers etc.)

$500    -   Food & living expenses
_____

$5000  -    TOTAL COST


We are crowdfunding for $5,000 to help make the development and recording phase of the Jaaleekaay project viable (Phase 1). Your help with this phase will be instrumental in kick-starting the greater project into motion. Any funding we receive beyond our goal of $A5,000, will go directly toward the expense of bringing Amadou and Yusupha to Australia at the end of the year for the Australian tour (Phase 2).

Down the track

We have already received great encouragement from three significant music festivals in Australia just with our debut track. With a full-length recording we will be able to engage numerous music festivals and venues across Australia  with the aim of earning Jaaleekaay invitations to appear.   The recording will also enable us to attract the attention of music promoters both in Australia and elsewhere in the world, especially those who specialise in showcasing world music and international acts to the global festival market, which will lead to expanded touring opportunities for the band in the future.

If you haven’t done so already please watch our video of life and imagery from the Gambia set to Jaaleekaay’s debut track, Continental Drift. You can access it above or go to: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fp_8LQqlHw8

Thanks!

Supporting this project will have a profound affect on the lives of these two Gambian musicians and their communities.  It will also enable Australian and potentially world wide audiences to share and enjoy the wonderful cross cultural music and creativity that Jaaleekaay embodies.  It’s a great project to be a part of, and we’d love you to be there from the beginning!  

Thanks for your support!! We can’t wait for you to hear the whole album!

Our long-term vision with Jaaleekaay is to establish a model where collaborations with Western musicians such as Steve create both wonderful music and opportunities for top musicians from economically disadvantaged countries to ply their trade in the wider world.  Such engagement connects financially poor countries with Western economies through the culturally rich art of their musicians, and through their art brings significant economic benefits back to their communities at home.
Our music and background
The video above showcases Jaaleekaay’s wonderful music, and gives you a taste of life in The Gambia, where this project was born.  The track is called Continental Drift, and is Jaaleekaay's debut track, recorded in Gambia in February 2013.
Jaaleekaay first came into being when Steve Berry, an award-winning guitarist, composer and producer from Byron Bay, NSW first visited The Gambia in February 2013.  Steve's Australian musical lineage goes back to the emergence of contemporary folk and world music in Australia in the 1980's, having mixed his musical DNA with some of the most innovative Australian acts in the genre, including Coolangubra, Kev Carmody, Shane Howard and Robyn Archer.  Steve's month long immersion in The Gambia began with an invitation to visit the country by King Marong, a Gambian traditional master percussionist now living in Australia.  Through King's many musical contacts in Gambia, Steve met the innovative young Kora player Amadou Suso, and through Amadou the Wolof singer Yusepha Ngum.  From the special musical connection that followed, Jaaleekaay emerged.
Amadou Suso  comes from a long lineage of Kora players, including his father and grandfather before him.  Suso is one of several influential Mandinka Griot names in West Africa, indicating a long family heritage of musicians.  With an ear for the contemporary and global influence, Amadou is now taking his family tradition on the next evolutionary step.
Yusupha Ngum is a singer from the Sengagambian tradition of Mbalax, which means 'Rhythm' in his first language of Wolof.  Like Amadou, Yusupha's musical heritage has been handed down through his family, his father also being a singer of reknown in Gambian Mbalax ensembles.  Yusupha himself leads an eight piece  group known as Jolef, and along with Amadou is now crossing cultural boundaries, bringing international audiences and Jaaleekaay  his expressive and authentic Wolof vocal style.
Jaaleekaay represents a convergence of musical expression between Steve, Amadou and Yusupha.  The trio's music embraces parallel influences while crossing between diverse cultural backgrounds.  It is music that adapts and evolves, exploring new territories and dispersing new musical ideas.
Current campaign 
Later this year our project aims to bring Amadou and Yusupha to Australia for a tour beginning November 2013.  One of our first steps however, is to build on the debut track Jaaleekaay recorded in February and record a full length album.  To do that we are asking for your support through this campaign.
Our plan is to take advantage of a trip Steve is taking to Germany, and bring Amadou and Yusupha there to spend a couple of weeks with Steve developing and recording their music.
Your support of this phase of the project would enable us to keep the project’s momentum and creative development growing, creating a recording that both promotes this multi cultural and multi-layered project while building a potential income stream for these talented Gambian musicians – income that will have a positive carry on effect for their families and community back home.
The bigger picture
It’s no wonder Steve has been inspired to engage in this new project. It is a natural offshoot from his years of experience blending music with philanthropy.  Along with a team of fellow musicians and supporters, over the past decade Steve founded and developed Music Outback Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to increasing positive outcomes for Indigenous children in remote Australia. Through developing ongoing relationships with schools and communities, Music Outback Foundation has successfully promoted and delivered music based education in over 50 remote Indigenous communities across Australia. This includes the production of nine music festivals known as Mobfest – events that see Indigenous kids performing their own songs on the big stage for their friends, family and communities.  To see some awesome examples of Music Outback’s Mobfest events and programs go here:
http://www.musicoutback.com.au
With almost 30 years on the Australian music scene, from playing the Sydney Opera House with Coolangubra to directing Mobfest events in remote Australia, Steve’s dedicated passion for music and social justice has had a powerful and important impact on the lives of many.
My role with Jaaleekaay is that of co-producer and organization development. I am a leadership consultant and associate of the Strozzi Institute, USA where I received my embodied leadership training through Richard Strozzi-Heckler. I have a passion for exploring human development and the arts in the context of leadership. I am also a former classical dancer and performance artist. I worked for many years with Anna and Daria Halprin of the Tamalpa Institute in California where I taught on core faculty utilizing movement and the performing arts in education, health and social change. In addition I have worked in live show production in the US and Europe.
What excites me about working with Jaaleekaay is the opportunity for my passion for human development, leadership and the arts to support new practices and pathways for social and economic growth for artists in disadvantaged economies.  Besides that, this unique convergence of music that is Jaaleekaay is so fantastic it deserves to be made available to a wide audience of music lovers!
Budget and Logistics
For the Jaaleekaay recording project, and this – our first crowd funding campaign - we had three scenarios to choose from: recording in Australia, The Gambia or somewhere in between!  The recording needs to take place soon, as it will be used to help build and promote the tour in Australia at the end of the year.   Coming to Australia twice in one year would not be cost effective, and with the Gambian rainy season being mid-year, plus unreliable power supplies and Ramadan being observed in July, recording in Gambia is not the best option either.  However, Steve is already scheduled to be in Germany mid year for a family visit, so we decided the best and most economical option is to bring Amadou and Yusupha to Germany during this time, where they can spend a couple of weeks with Steve recording, using equipment that he brings with him from Australia.
This campaign is reaching out for help with the cost of travel and accommodation  for Amadou and Yusupha, and other necessities for recording while in Germany.
Budget details (Australian dollars):
$2,400  -  Airfare from the Gambia to Frankfurt return for two
$400    -   European Visas, processing fees (including mandatory              travel to Dakar, Senegal to obtain their visas)
$900    -   Accommodation and work space in Germany for 16 days
$300    -   Ground Transport                                                              
$500    -   Hire of equipment (specifically equipment too bulky to bring from Australia              such as mic stands, speakers etc.)
$500    -   Food & living expenses_____$5000  -    TOTAL COST
We are crowdfunding for $5,000 to help make the development and recording phase of the Jaaleekaay project viable (Phase 1). Your help with this phase will be instrumental in kick-starting the greater project into motion. Any funding we receive beyond our goal of $A5,000, will go directly toward the expense of bringing Amadou and Yusupha to Australia at the end of the year for the Australian tour (Phase 2).
Down the track
We have already received great encouragement from three significant music festivals in Australia just with our debut track. With a full-length recording we will be able to engage numerous music festivals and venues across Australia  with the aim of earning Jaaleekaay invitations to appear.   The recording will also enable us to attract the attention of music promoters both in Australia and elsewhere in the world, especially those who specialise in showcasing world music and international acts to the global festival market, which will lead to expanded touring opportunities for the band in the future.
If you haven’t done so already please watch our video of life and imagery from the Gambia set to Jaaleekaay’s debut track, Continental Drift. You can access it above or go to: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fp_8LQqlHw8
Thanks!
Supporting this project will have a profound affect on the lives of these two Gambian musicians and their communities.  It will also enable Australian and potentially world wide audiences to share and enjoy the wonderful cross cultural music and creativity that Jaaleekaay embodies.  It’s a great project to be a part of, and we’d love you to be there from the beginning!  
Thanks for your support!! We can’t wait for you to hear the whole album!

story:
The basic tale of Son Of Cecil by Brian Edwards.

I've made music in some small shape or form for most of my life but throughout my formative high school years and after I was a skateboarder. Eric used to be in a band called Proper Word in high school. We knew each other but didn't hang out much until after I graduated and would come to parties at Eric's house. He had a practice room and I had begun rapping so sometimes me and my current roommate BBQ Chuck would go and freestyle while Eric played drums. Sometimes I'd play the guitar or bass that was lying around. We just did it for fun. Not to have a band together. Around 2000 I began writing more rock based songs. Some real sappy,sad stuff but rockish I guess. I did this concurrently while being in a rap group called Translu as well. Eventually Translu dissolved and I focused more on the guitar based stuff which led to a duo with me and Kevin Martin called Ten Year Gap around 2006. Kevin and I separated as well and I started doing Son Of Cecil solo around 2008-2009. I've always written with a lot of instrumentation in mind so I always wanted a band to realize the ideas more fully. That's when I contacted Eric and some other friends I had made music with over the years and Son Of Cecil as a band was created around 2010.

This album has been a mission to complete but now we are two steps away from releasing: Mastering and Pressing. Unfortunately we've exhausted all our monetary resources and are reaching out to all to help us bring this project into full fruition. "Group Therapy" is the title of the album and now we are asking for a group effort from all our friends and fans to help us realize this project. 

Love and God bless!

SON OF CECIL

story:
We are rosewood a candian deathcore band that has been together for over 5 years .We released an ep in 2011 titled "We The Apocalypse". Since then, we have been plagued with member changes and finacial instability. We finally have our next album fully recorded and ready to go along with merch designs ready to be printed we are just lacking the financal support.                           

This album means the world to us and we are tired of stringing our fans around with a new album that has taken far too much time to release as it is. Any donation would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Logo by Michael Brunk of NW Lens

Overview

Estafets are a musical trio from the tiny town of Sequim in western Washington. We combine the sounds of post-punk and metal to make multi-genre songs that can be described as eclectic and progressive.

We have been a part of the Pacific Northwest music scene for over 4 years, and have been working with bands in our area to foster a strong local music community. 

Video by Les Graves

We are in need of monetary support in order to complete a three week tour through the midwest and up the west coast. This tour is vital for us, as we have finally recorded an EP, have our own tour van, and are expanding our audience.

This tour is important for our growth, and would be another step towards building our foundation in the music industry. With your help, Estafets will be able to establish a larger sphere of influence, creating more opportunities for our developing band.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $2400 for our tour. This money will be used to pay for the gas required for our 6,000 mile round trip, as well as our campaign fees and supplies for incentives.

We are very excited about our perks, as we produce the majority of them ourselves! Our incentives include:


A Homemade Screen Printed Estafets Logo Shirt

A Limited Edition DIY EP of All Is Forgotten

A Homemade Screen Printed Estafets Logo Patch

An Estafets Logo Button

A Digital Download of All Is Forgotten EP

& A Limited Edition Estafets Postcard mailed to you on the tour!

If we can't reach our goal, we will still use the funds we receive for gas, campaign fees, and supplies for incentives.

The Impact

By going on tour, we will be able to bring our music to new places and people, which is something that we find great joy in doing.

Going on tour will also help us connect our local music community to a wider network of musicians, venues, and listeners.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, there are a bunch of ways that you can still help!

  • Please spread the word about Estafets and our campaign! Indiegogo has some great sharing tools that you can use.
  • Please 'Like' us on Facebook by going to http://www.estafets.com
  • If you'd like to listen to or buy our EP All Is Forgotten, you can do so at http://estafets.bandcamp.com
  • You can request our music on The Puget Sound Underground on KGRG or other radio stations. Radio play would bring attention to our band, and our campaign. 
  • If you are in our area, please come to our shows! Our show schedule is available at http://www.reverbnation.com/estafets 

Thank you for your support!

Photo by Katie Dendez

story:
[ENGLISH]

I'm Santiago, an actor and songwriter from Colombia. I have been in London for 5 years and I've made music for different projects in that time. One of my main collaborators is Camilo Menjura: award-winning singer, musician and producer, also from Colombia. This time, Camilo and I are coming together to create something that I have been dreaming about and planning for a while: recording a collection of songs inspired in different genres of the Latin American folklore, with lyrics in English. 

In order to give every track its particular sound, we will be joined by some talented guest musicians (details to be announced).

As a foreign artist in the UK, one of my passions is to find new ways to bring my own cultural background into the work I do. This is the main idea behind 'Flowers': to introduce the sounds of Latin folklore in songs that are accessible to English speakers.

'Flowers' is my first album, and I need some financial support to make it happen. That's why I would like to ask for your help. Join this campaign and get some great rewards in return!

 

Here's the last project that Camilo and I worked on together: 'The Other Side'. This song and its music video were recorded entirely in isolation during the first months of lockdown (A re-mixed, masterised version of this track will be included in the album).

 

Here's a sample of Camilo's album 'Loop Explorations', which he recorded and produced in 2018 - 2019.

 

Here is a detailed breakdown of the the project's budget:

 

  • Musicians & Recording: The main part of the funding will cover the work of the musicians. The recording will mainly take place at Camilo's as well as each guest musician's home studios. This will make the process safe in the current circumstances.
  • Mixing & Mastering: This final phase of musical production is essential and it will be done at a professional studio to guarantee that the sound of the album is of the best quality.
  • Image & Marketing: The photography and design, by our visual artist Elena Molina, are an important part of this project. Some funding will also be used for the diffusion of the campaign on online platforms.
  • Campaign Costs: Finally, some of the money will cover the fees related to this campaign, the transfer fees and shipping costs for the delivery of the perks.

 

*NOTE*

Even if we don't reach our goal the project will go ahead. However, the recording of one of the tracks could be compromised due to the lack of funds.

If, on the other hand, we exceed our goal, the extra money will go into the sound production, making every track as good as possible. The extra money will also be used to create new perks for you, our contributors!

 

​

Depending on the amount that you can contribute with, you can get different combinations of perks. From a public 'Thank You!' on Social Media to a Private Serenade, there are many exciting rewards for those who can join in. You will find the details of every package in the menu on the right.

The objective of this project isn't just to reach our financial goal and make the album. Most importantly, we would like to create a community of listeners: people who are interested in our work and would like to see it grow. With your support, we can make our contribution to the spread of Latin American music abroad.

 

Like any project, 'Flowers' might face certain delays in the recording and production process. These delays could be caused by the restrictions related to the pandemic. However, as mentioned previously, most of the recording will happen at Camilo's and the musician's home studios. This means the process will not only simplify the process, but it will also make it safe for those involved.

We will keep you updated throughout the process and let you know of any modification in our plans. This also applies for the delivery of the perks.

 

We completely understand if you are not able to contribute with money. If that is the case, you can still help by letting other people know about this project: you can use the links provided at the top, or simply spread the word about the campaign. We would love 'Flowers' to reach as many people as possible!

 

--------------------------------

 

[ESPAÑOL]

Soy Santiago: actor y músico colombiano. Vivo en Londres desde hace 5 años y he escrito música para diferentes proyectos. Uno de mis principales colaboradores ha sido Camilo Menjura, cantante, músico y productor colombiano premiado en el Reino Unido. Esta vez, Camilo y yo vamos a trabajar juntos para crear algo que he soñado hacer y llevo planeando desde hace tiempo: la grabación y producción de una serie de canciones, escritas en inglés, inspiradas en distintos géneros del folclor latinoamericano.

Para darle a cada pieza su sonido particular, vamos a contar con la participación de algunos músicos invitados (quienes serán anunciados pronto).

Como artista extranjero en el Reino Unido, me apasiona encontrar nuevas maneras de incorporar mi cultura en el trabajo que hago. Ésta es la idea fundamental detrás de 'Flowers': música que contiene los sonidos del folclor latinoamericano y cuya letra es accesible a la población anglohablante.

'Flowers' es mi primer álbum y necesito apoyo financiero para llevarlo a cabo. Por eso quisiera pedir tu ayuda. Únete a esta campaña y recibe una o varias recompensas a cambio de tu participación.

 

Éste es el proyecto más reciente en que Camilo y yo trabajamos juntos: 'The Other Side'. Esta canción y su video musical fueron grabados en aislamiento durante los primeros días de la cuarentena. Una versión re-mezclada y masterizada de The Other Side' será incluida en el álbum.

 

Aquí hay una muestra de 'Loop Explorations', el álbum más reciente de Camilo. Fue grabado y producido por él en 2018 - 2019.

 

Aquí hay una descripción detallada del presupuesto para este proyecto:

 

  • Músicos y Grabación: La mayor parte de los fondos serán destinados a reconocer el trabajo de los músicos involucrados. La grabación se hará, mayormente, en el estudio en casa de Camilo y los demás músicos invitados. Esto hará que el proceso sea seguro, teniendo en cuenta las circunstancias actuales.
  • Mezcla y Masterización: Esta etapa final de la producción musical es esencial y se hará en un estudio profesional para garantizar que el sonido del álbum sea de la la mejor calidad.
  • Imagen y Marketing: La fotografía y el diseño de la imagen, a cargo de nuestra artista visual Elena Molina, también son parte importante del proyecto. Una parte de los fondos también será invertida en la difusión de la campaña en plataformas virtuales.
  • Costos de Campaña: Por último, algo de dinero será necesario para cubrir la cuota por la publicación de la campaña, los costos de transferencia y el envío de algunas de las recompensas.

 

*NOTA*

El proyecto se llevará a cabo aunque no se reúna la totalidad de dinero esperada. Sin embargo, es posible que la falta de dinero comprometa la producción de alguna de las pistas.

Si, por el contrario, excedemos nuestra meta, los fondos adicionales serán invertidos en la producción musical, para hacer de cada pista lo mejor. El dinero extra también será usado para crear nuevas recompensas para ustedes, nuestros contribuyentes.

 

Hay diferentes combinaciones de recompensas que puedes obtener dependiendo del monto de tu contribución. Las opciones están en el menú a la derecha. Aquí hay una descripción detallada de cada una:

 

SEED (Semilla): Álbum Digital y Material Gráfico

Podrás descargar el Álbum y el Material Gráfico antes de su publicación.

 

BUD (Capullo): Agradecimiento Musical

Además del Álbum Digital, recibirás un Mensaje Musicalizado de agradecimiento con tu nombre, creado con la Loop Station de Camilo. ​

 

ROSE (Rosa): Carta y Postal

Adicionalmente al Álbum Digital y el Mensaje Musicalizado de agradecimiento, vas a recibir una Carta Escrita a Mano  acompañada por una Postal con la imagen oficial del álbum.

 

BUNDLE (Ramo): Serenata Virtual

Esta opción incluye (además del Álbum y la Carta) una Serenata Virtual Privada en la que Santiago interpretará dos canciones de tu elección.

 

BOUQUET: Sesión en Vivo

Adicionalmente al Álbum y el Agradecimiento Musical, tendrás acceso a una Sesión de Música en Vivo con Santiago y Camilo que incluye una Conversación con el Equipo en que se dará a conocer más sobre el proceso de creación y producción del álbum.

 

VASE (Florero): Envío de Flores 

Esta opción incluye la Entrega de Flores en la puerta de tu casa, además del Álbum, el Agradecimiento Musical y la Sesión en Vivo.

 

GARDEN (Jardín): Serenata Premium

Con esta opción obtendrás la mayoría de las recompensas anteriores. Además, tu Serenata Virtual incluirá la lectura y el envío de un Poema Personalizado escrito especialmente para ti por Santiago.

 

El objetivo de este proyecto no es sólo alcanzar la meta económica y hacer el álbum. Lo más importante para nosotros es crear una comunidad de oyentes: personas a quienes les guste lo que hacemos y estén interesadas en ver su desarrollo. Tu apoyo nos permitirá hacer nuestra contribución a la creación y difusión de la música latinoamericana en el exterior.

 

Como en cualquier proyecto, puede haber retrasos en el proceso de grabación y producción de 'Flowers'. Estos retrasos podrían ser causados por las restricciones relacionadas con la pandemia. Sin embargo, la mayor parte de la grabación se llevará a cabo en los estudios caseros de Camilo y los músicos invitados, lo cual no sólo hará el proceso más sencillo sino que también será seguro para las personas involucradas.

Nos mantendremos en contacto durante todo el proceso para informarte sobre cualquier modificación a los planes y todo lo que tiene que ver con la entrega de las recompensas.

 

Entendemos perfectamente si no puedes contribuir económicamente con el proyecto. Si ese es el caso, aún puedes ayudarnos hablando a otros sobre el álbum: puedes usar los vínculos en esta página o simplemente correr la voz. ¡Nos encantaría que 'Flowers' llegara a tantas personas como sea posible!

If, on the other hand, we exceed our goal, the extra money will go into the sound production, making every track as good as possible. The extra money will also be used to create new perks for you, our contributors!
 
​

Depending on the amount that you can contribute with, you can get different combinations of perks. From a public 'Thank You!' on Social Media to a Private Serenade, there are many exciting rewards for those who can join in. You will find the details of every package in the menu on the right.
The objective of this project isn't just to reach our financial goal and make the album. Most importantly, we would like to create a community of listeners: people who are interested in our work and would like to see it grow. With your support, we can make our contribution to the spread of Latin American music abroad.
 


Like any project, 'Flowers' might face certain delays in the recording and production process. These delays could be caused by the restrictions related to the pandemic. However, as mentioned previously, most of the recording will happen at Camilo's and the musician's home studios. This means the process will not only simplify the process, but it will also make it safe for those involved.
We will keep you updated throughout the process and let you know of any modification in our plans. This also applies for the delivery of the perks.
 


We completely understand if you are not able to contribute with money. If that is the case, you can still help by letting other people know about this project: you can use the links provided at the top, or simply spread the word about the campaign. We would love 'Flowers' to reach as many people as possible!
 

--------------------------------
 [ESPAÑOL]
Soy Santiago: actor y músico colombiano. Vivo en Londres desde hace 5 años y he escrito música para diferentes proyectos. Uno de mis principales colaboradores ha sido Camilo Menjura, cantante, músico y productor colombiano premiado en el Reino Unido. Esta vez, Camilo y yo vamos a trabajar juntos para crear algo que he soñado hacer y llevo planeando desde hace tiempo: la grabación y producción de una serie de canciones, escritas en inglés, inspiradas en distintos géneros del folclor latinoamericano.
Para darle a cada pieza su sonido particular, vamos a contar con la participación de algunos músicos invitados (quienes serán anunciados pronto).
Como artista extranjero en el Reino Unido, me apasiona encontrar nuevas maneras de incorporar mi cultura en el trabajo que hago. Ésta es la idea fundamental detrás de 'Flowers': música que contiene los sonidos del folclor latinoamericano y cuya letra es accesible a la población anglohablante.
'Flowers' es mi primer álbum y necesito apoyo financiero para llevarlo a cabo. Por eso quisiera pedir tu ayuda. Únete a esta campaña y recibe una o varias recompensas a cambio de tu participación.
 

Éste es el proyecto más reciente en que Camilo y yo trabajamos juntos: 'The Other Side'. Esta canción y su video musical fueron grabados en aislamiento durante los primeros días de la cuarentena. Una versión re-mezclada y masterizada de The Other Side' será incluida en el álbum.
 
Aquí hay una muestra de 'Loop Explorations', el álbum más reciente de Camilo. Fue grabado y producido por él en 2018 - 2019.

 

Aquí hay una descripción detallada del presupuesto para este proyecto:

 


Músicos y Grabación: La mayor parte de los fondos serán destinados a reconocer el trabajo de los músicos involucrados. La grabación se hará, mayormente, en el estudio en casa de Camilo y los demás músicos invitados. Esto hará que el proceso sea seguro, teniendo en cuenta las circunstancias actuales.

Mezcla y Masterización: Esta etapa final de la producción musical es esencial y se hará en un estudio profesional para garantizar que el sonido del álbum sea de la la mejor calidad.

Imagen y Marketing: La fotografía y el diseño de la imagen, a cargo de nuestra artista visual Elena Molina, también son parte importante del proyecto. Una parte de los fondos también será invertida en la difusión de la campaña en plataformas virtuales.

Costos de Campaña: Por último, algo de dinero será necesario para cubrir la cuota por la publicación de la campaña, los costos de transferencia y el envío de algunas de las recompensas.

 
*NOTA*
El proyecto se llevará a cabo aunque no se reúna la totalidad de dinero esperada. Sin embargo, es posible que la falta de dinero comprometa la producción de alguna de las pistas.
Si, por el contrario, excedemos nuestra meta, los fondos adicionales serán invertidos en la producción musical, para hacer de cada pista lo mejor. El dinero extra también será usado para crear nuevas recompensas para ustedes, nuestros contribuyentes.
 

Hay diferentes combinaciones de recompensas que puedes obtener dependiendo del monto de tu contribución. Las opciones están en el menú a la derecha. Aquí hay una descripción detallada de cada una:
 
SEED (Semilla): Álbum Digital y Material Gráfico

Podrás descargar el Álbum y el Material Gráfico antes de su publicación.
 
BUD (Capullo): Agradecimiento Musical

Además del Álbum Digital, recibirás un Mensaje Musicalizado de agradecimiento con tu nombre, creado con la Loop Station de Camilo. ​
 
ROSE (Rosa): Carta y Postal

Adicionalmente al Álbum Digital y el Mensaje Musicalizado de agradecimiento, vas a recibir una Carta Escrita a Mano  acompañada por una Postal con la imagen oficial del álbum.
 
BUNDLE (Ramo): Serenata Virtual

Esta opción incluye (además del Álbum y la Carta) una Serenata Virtual Privada en la que Santiago interpretará dos canciones de tu elección.
 
BOUQUET: Sesión en Vivo

Adicionalmente al Álbum y el Agradecimiento Musical, tendrás acceso a una Sesión de Música en Vivo con Santiago y Camilo que incluye una Conversación con el Equipo en que se dará a conocer más sobre el proceso de creación y producción del álbum.
 
VASE (Florero): Envío de Flores 

Esta opción incluye la Entrega de Flores en la puerta de tu casa, además del Álbum, el Agradecimiento Musical y la Sesión en Vivo.
 
GARDEN (Jardín): Serenata Premium

Con esta opción obtendrás la mayoría de las recompensas anteriores. Además, tu Serenata Virtual incluirá la lectura y el envío de un Poema Personalizado escrito especialmente para ti por Santiago.
 
El objetivo de este proyecto no es sólo alcanzar la meta económica y hacer el álbum. Lo más importante para nosotros es crear una comunidad de oyentes: personas a quienes les guste lo que hacemos y estén interesadas en ver su desarrollo. Tu apoyo nos permitirá hacer nuestra contribución a la creación y difusión de la música latinoamericana en el exterior.
 

Como en cualquier proyecto, puede haber retrasos en el proceso de grabación y producción de 'Flowers'. Estos retrasos podrían ser causados por las restricciones relacionadas con la pandemia. Sin embargo, la mayor parte de la grabación se llevará a cabo en los estudios caseros de Camilo y los músicos invitados, lo cual no sólo hará el proceso más sencillo sino que también será seguro para las personas involucradas.
Nos mantendremos en contacto durante todo el proceso para informarte sobre cualquier modificación a los planes y todo lo que tiene que ver con la entrega de las recompensas.
 

Entendemos perfectamente si no puedes contribuir económicamente con el proyecto. Si ese es el caso, aún puedes ayudarnos hablando a otros sobre el álbum: puedes usar los vínculos en esta página o simplemente correr la voz. ¡Nos encantaría que 'Flowers' llegara a tantas personas como sea posible!

story:
KINGDOM COLLAPSE UPRISE

KC Army! 2020 is shaping up to be a big year for the band, and we want to bring all of you along for the ride. We’ll be releasing more new music and touring to more states than we ever have before. All of this comes with costs, so that’s way we want to offer our fans the opportunity to join us in making this happen!

Our goal is to raise at least $4,000. This money will be used in various ways, including:

-Production costs
-Marketing costs
-Touring 
-New Merch

 

Package Options


Aside from normal donations, we are offering a few different exclusive packages:


$25 Contribution
-Access to exclusive content, such as new songs, photos, music videos, and other behind the scenes material!
-Signed digital copy of promo picture

 

$50 Contribution (only 75 available)
-Kingdom Collapse "Uprise" limited edition OR brand new "Suffer" T-Shirt
-Access to exclusive content, such as new songs, photos, music videos, and other behind the scenes material!
-Signed digital copy of promo picture

 

$100 Contribution (only 25 available)
-Drum head signed by the band 
-Kingdom Collapse "Uprise" limited edition T-Shirt
-Access to exclusive content, such as new songs, photos, music videos, and other behind the scenes material!
-Signed digital copy of promo picture

 

$200 Contribution (only 2 available)
-Used Kingdom Collapse stage banner
-Kingdom Collapse "Uprise" limited edition T-Shirt
-Access to exclusive content, such as new songs, photos, music videos, and other behind the scenes material!
-Signed digital copy of promo picture

 

The Significance

Being an independent band like Kingdom Collapse means we don't have the budget of a record label. With the contributions from our fans and followers, we are consistently able to deliver new music and afford to bring our live show to a city near you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but by spreading the word, you will be helping us more than you think. We want everyone to feel a part of the KC Army!

story:
In the summer of 2012 Jordan August and Phil Chorney began jammin to some epic bluegrass music on a front porch in Baltimore City. Soon Phil decided to research the history of Folk and Bluegrass music in the city and learned of its rich and vibrant history. And so an idea was born. Union brewery was chosen as a location for the event because of its quality beer and its local ties. The Believe in music charity was chosen to be a beneficiary of the event becasue where would music be without brite and curious music students.

It's not often remembered today, but in the '50s and '60s, Baltimore was a major center for bluegrass music. A Baltimore band, Earl Taylor and the Stoney Mountain Boys, was the first bluegrass act to ever play Carnegie Hall. It was in Baltimore rowhouses that Hazel Dickens first met Mike Seeger, who co-founded the New Lost City Ramblers, a well-known old-time revival band, and Alice Gerrard, with whom Dickens formed the first major female bluegrass duo. And it was here that Del McCoury first met bluegrass godfather Bill Monroe and got the break that changed his life.

Back in 1966, "The Streets of Baltimore" was one of the biggest hits on country radio. Despite Chet Atkins' string-sweetened countrypolitan arrangement, Bobby Bare's warm baritone made Tompall Glaser and Harlan Howard's lyrics ring true. Like the characters in the song, hundreds of thousands of rural Southerners moved to northern cities in search of work from the 1930s to the '60s--a migration that changed Baltimore forever.

When these Southerners moved, they brought their music with them, and for white Southerners that meant hillbilly music--a catch-all term encompassing the mountain ballads, old-time string bands, bluegrass, and Grand Ole Opry country that Appalachian people scrambled together whenever they pulled a guitar or fiddle out of its case. And it's in that music we can most readily discern how those mountain immigrants remade themselves to fit Baltimore--and remade Baltimore to fit themselves.

Even today, that Southern Appalachian influence is part of what makes Baltimore so different from other stops on the Washington-to-Boston Amtrak line. When people talk about Baltimoreans' earthy frankness, their stubborn nontrendiness, and their willingness to dance at the drop of a hat, they're often referring to lingering hillbilly traits. From meat-and-potatoes diners to John Waters' poor white film characters to the Deer Creek Fiddlers convention, the mountains still affect Baltimore culture.

When young people fled the mountains in search of better jobs, they had a choice of destinations. Cincinnati was the most popular, followed closely by Baltimore, Chicago, Washington, Columbus, and Detroit. Most often, the new migrants chose the town where relatives or friends had already landed. That was the case for Dickens, whose older sister Velvie was in Hampden, and for Hensley, whose divorced mother had moved to Dundalk.

When these Appalachian refugees poured into Baltimore in the '40s and '50s, they were not met with welcoming arms; rather, they were usually were shunted into bottom-rung industrial jobs and "hillbilly ghettos" in Dundalk, Hampden, Highlandtown, Lower Charles Village, Middle River, and elsewhere. (City Paper)


As it can be seen, Baltimore has a rich history of Folk and Bluegrass music, this festival aims to revive that traditon and create a yearly event that families, musicians and friends will want to gather at.

story:
Short Summary

Hailing from the rolling green hills of Berkshire Country, Massachusetts, The Interlopers are a 6 piece band, currently comprised of Curtis Kelley, Nick Veinoglou, Ariel Shrum, Jakob Rabitsch, Nick Frenay ad Kama Bell. 2012 marked the release of their debut self produced album, “Don’t Forget to Breathe” as well as a wildly successful summer of over 40 performances. Now moved out to Boston, the band is expanding it’s sound, with the addition of Keys and saxophone, writing new material, and of course working tirelessly to spread the music around the country.                                              2013 has offered them their chance! Now working with a booking agency, they will be booking all over the East Coast, however have only one problem; Transport and the funds necessary to provide it. They now call upon their fans and friends to support their journey through their “Get on the Road” Campaign 2013.

What We Need & What You Get

As city dwellers know very well, owning vehicles can be very expensive, especially as collage students. We currently don't have our own means of transport, so for local gigs we will be relying on Taxi's and Buses. We would need 2 taxis to transport 6 humans and a band worth of gear, traveling an average distance of 6-12 miles to play in the Boston, Cambridge area. Each taxi would cost roughly $60 bucks round trip, 2 taxi’s adding up to $120. We would be performing roughly 2 shows a month in Boston, and the rest will be outside the city, requiring us to put a down payment on our own transport (be it a van or a trailer). So we are asking to raise $4000 which is enough put a down payment on a van or purchase our very own gear trailer! If you pledge, we will be giving away anything from CD’s, tickets and posters, to private performances and personal songs, written, recorded and filmed in HD for our fans that pledge large sums!  With your help we can finally get our music to those who want to listen. If we exceed our amount we could even get enough funds to own our very own van! For further information, check out the campaign video!

The Impact

There is a point in a song where the energy reaches a climax, and a moment that precedes it where every member can’t help but look at on another, their eyes reflecting one another’s excitement for that incredible moment to come. But every once in a while, a guitar cable pops out just before that moment is reached, the excitement and collective enthusiasm comes crashing down…We now find ourselves in a similar situation, having found for our chance to give our music mobility, but needing your support to reach our goal. These past 4 months, we have worked incredibly hard, finding one of a kind friends to enrich our music, venues to host it, and resources to lead a musical career of love and longevity. We are ready to actualize out full potential, and with your help, we can. If you extend a loving hand out to us, you will not only help us share our music with our fans and friends, but you will be part of making our dreams of performing all over the country a reality. You will instill confidence in music’s ability to unite people, create everlasting bonds, and of course, have our love, our groove and our gratitude for as long as we continue to make music together. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unfamiliar with our music, we'd be honored if you'd check out our record "Don't Forget to Breathe", or any of our latest posts and take a chance to be inspired! However, times are tough and if you cannot help by pledging to our campaign, please use Indiegogo's share tools, post our campaign on facebook, twitter, share it via email and extend it to those you think could provide financial assitance. we thank you fro the bottom of our hearts for any contribution you can make and we look forward to be seeing you down the road.

story:
Hi, we're Driven Serious!  We're an unsigned band from the North East of England, playing original folk music with a punk edge.  We are:

  • Rob: vocals, guitar, songs
  • Cathy: fiddle, viola, piano
  • Tim: double bass, bass guitar, piano, occasional songs
  • Johnnie: drums, percussion

We all work full-time, and spend most of our spare time creating and performing music.

Over the past few months, we've spent many evenings and weekends recording our first album.  (You can hear some samples on our Soundcloud page or watch the video for our single.)  We've funded the recording through gigs across the North East, and we've been helped by some amazing people who've contributed their skills to make this project happen, either for free or at reduced rates.

We're really happy with this CD, and we'd like as many people as possible to be able to hear it.

There is one final step, though: getting the CDs duplicated.  We don't want to just produce 50 or 100 CDRs that we wouldn't be happy with the quality of - we want to aim for success.  So this campaign is to raise the money to get at least 500 high-quality CDs that can be sold across the North East and the world; and if possible to make a bit more to advertise the CD as widely as possible.

What We Need

Our target of £600 will pay for 500 copies of the album to be glass-mastered and reproduced, with an 8-page booklet laid out by Dave Marsdin and containing lyrics to all the songs, original art by Sara Borges and photos by Paula Smart.

If we raise more money than this, we have various plans:

  • An extra £120 would get 1000 copies of the CD, so we can get it out to even more places.
  • An extra £175 would buy a month's advertising in NARC and on kyeo.tv
  • An extra £475 would buy a month's advertising in The Crack.
  • If we go far beyond this, it'll help fund future band projects and a future album.

If we raise less than the target, then it will still go towards CD duplication - we might have to get fewer copies or dig deeply into our own pockets.

What You Get

A pledge of £10 gets you a copy of the album, posted to you (or picked up at either of the album launches).  If you might be buying our album anyway, you might as well buy it now and help us at the same time!

If money is really tight, then our double-A-side single Accidental Crimes/Buddhas in the Emptiness is available for just £3.  (This mix of Buddhas in the Emptiness is not on the album, so it's just for you.)

Then there are a few ways of getting a unique piece of Driven Serious.  You can get us to write you a song.  You can get Cathy to knit you a scarf.  Or you can get us to do a unique gig for you and whoever you invite, in a time and place of your choosing (but you will need to pay travel expenses and accommodation if you take us far from the North East!).

Our top item is the original oil painting by Sara Borges that is the album cover.  It would really break our hearts to part with this, hence the price; but we would be glad to see it go to someone who gave us that much support.  £100 of the money from this perk would go as additional payment to Sara; so with this perk you get to support two local artists at once!

Then there's that other item.  We don't talk about that one.

The Impact

Your support will enable us to put our music out into the world; to be heard by as many individuals as possible, and possibly by those with the power to take us even further.  And we promise to pay it back by supporting other up-and-coming bands that the world needs to hear.

Our album is original music straight from our hearts. We know that we are blessed to be in this position; to have met each other and be involved in this project. We promise as ever to keep loving music and all original art and encouraging it for the sake of the greater good and self discovery. But, most of all we believe in having a good time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the links below to Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and publicise our website.  Spread the word to your friends and on social media. 

Take the time to seek out new music in your area. Everywhere we go, we hear amazing music, which isn't being played on the big radio stations, just because it hasn't been heard by the 'right' people.  Get out and hear the world of new music beyond the X Factor.  Discovering new music is one of the things that makes the world a better place.
