We all work full-time, and spend most of our spare time creating and performing music.
Over the past few months, we've spent many evenings and weekends recording our first album.  (You can hear some samples on our Soundcloud page or watch the video for our single.)  We've funded the recording through gigs across the North East, and we've been helped by some amazing people who've contributed their skills to make this project happen, either for free or at reduced rates.
We're really happy with this CD, and we'd like as many people as possible to be able to hear it.
There is one final step, though: getting the CDs duplicated.  We don't want to just produce 50 or 100 CDRs that we wouldn't be happy with the quality of - we want to aim for success.  So this campaign is to raise the money to get at least 500 high-quality CDs that can be sold across the North East and the world; and if possible to make a bit more to advertise the CD as widely as possible.
What We Need
Our target of £600 will pay for 500 copies of the album to be glass-mastered and reproduced, with an 8-page booklet laid out by Dave Marsdin and containing lyrics to all the songs, original art by Sara Borges and photos by Paula Smart.
If we raise more money than this, we have various plans:

An extra £120 would get 1000 copies of the CD, so we can get it out to even more places.
An extra £175 would buy a month's advertising in NARC and on kyeo.tv
An extra £475 would buy a month's advertising in The Crack.
If we go far beyond this, it'll help fund future band projects and a future album.
If we raise less than the target, then it will still go towards CD duplication - we might have to get fewer copies or dig deeply into our own pockets.
What You Get
A pledge of £10 gets you a copy of the album, posted to you (or picked up at either of the album launches).  If you might be buying our album anyway, you might as well buy it now and help us at the same time!
If money is really tight, then our double-A-side single Accidental Crimes/Buddhas in the Emptiness is available for just £3.  (This mix of Buddhas in the Emptiness is not on the album, so it's just for you.)
Then there are a few ways of getting a unique piece of Driven Serious.  You can get us to write you a song.  You can get Cathy to knit you a scarf.  Or you can get us to do a unique gig for you and whoever you invite, in a time and place of your choosing (but you will need to pay travel expenses and accommodation if you take us far from the North East!).
Our top item is the original oil painting by Sara Borges that is the album cover.  It would really break our hearts to part with this, hence the price; but we would be glad to see it go to someone who gave us that much support.  £100 of the money from this perk would go as additional payment to Sara; so with this perk you get to support two local artists at once!
Then there's that other item.  We don't talk about that one.
The Impact
Your support will enable us to put our music out into the world; to be heard by as many individuals as possible, and possibly by those with the power to take us even further.  And we promise to pay it back by supporting other up-and-coming bands that the world needs to hear.
Our album is original music straight from our hearts. We know that we are blessed to be in this position; to have met each other and be involved in this project. We promise as ever to keep loving music and all original art and encouraging it for the sake of the greater good and self discovery. But, most of all we believe in having a good time!
Other Ways You Can Help
Please use the links below to Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and publicise our website.  Spread the word to your friends and on social media. 
Take the time to seek out new music in your area. Everywhere we go, we hear amazing music, which isn't being played on the big radio stations, just because it hasn't been heard by the 'right' people.  Get out and hear the world of new music beyond the X Factor.  Discovering new music is one of the things that makes the world a better place.

story:
Short Summary

Peter Reynolds is listed in the Guinness Book of Records for having composed the shortest ever opera. Yet despite being a highly talented Welsh Composer, he was quite unassuming when it came to the promotion of his own music. A typical characteristic of Peter Reynolds was his selflessness, giving so much of this time to the support and promotion of others. This included founding the PM Music Group which was devoted to performing contemporary music, an advocate of the work of Ty Cerdd, artistic programming music concerts and festivals, to his support of young composers around Wales, organising and running workshops, visiting schools, and teaching privately and at the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama.

In 2016 Peter sadly and suddenly died, leaving so many bereft. For those of us who attended his memorial service in Cardiff, the amount of people there from all over the UK, and of all ages, spoke volumes.

Peter Reynolds was my compositional mentor and good friend for a number of years. This disc which we'd like to release called Penllyn, is an opportunity to bring Peter's music to a much wider public. Very few of his solo piano works are recorded, and I've been on a mission to track down his scores over the last few years since his death. This will be the World Premiere recording of the collected solo piano music by Peter Reynolds, and will be performed by Duncan Honeybourne, for whom Peter composed and dedicated his final solo piano work, Penllyn.

In collaboration with the composer David Power, another friend of Peter's, we're project managing this CD along with Duncan, to bring you Peter's music. For a person who gave so much, we'd like to create this disc for Peter. We've two recording sessions in the diary which I'll be producing: 24th of October, and the 14th of November 2021. The CD will be released in Spring 2022 on the Prima Facie label.

For all those who knew Peter in some way, we'd like to ask that you help us bring this recording to fruition, through buying a copy of the CD in advance, or making a donation. It is an opportunity for us to give something back to Peter.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we're looking to raise £4,500. This includes the cost of releasing the disc with Prima Facie, the pianists contractual fee, a page turner, travel etc. In turn, for the very first time, this disc will bring together the collected solo piano music of Peter Reynolds:

Penllyn (2016); Ein Kleines Albumblat Fur Baren (2015); Ecco Mormorar L’onde (2013); Epithalamion (2011); Bayvill (2011); Far Down In The Forest (2010); In One Spot (2009); Lullaby (2009); Tango (1993). 

Also, to make up the duration of the CD, there will be a couple of works by David Power (Six Afterthoughts, and Two Way Dream), and also a small suite by myself (Oceanic Interludes).

What we're asking is that you donate/buy a copy (or more) of the CD in advance, in order to generate the funds needed so that we can bring Peter's music back to a wider public. More specifically:

£20.00, and we'll send you 1 copy of "Penllyn", and name you as a supporter in the CD booklet.

£30.00, 2 copies of "Penllyn", and name you as supporter in the CD booklet.

£40.00, 2 copies of "Penllyn", plus 1 copy of “A Hundred Years of British Piano Miniatures” performed by Duncan Honeybourne, and name you as supporter in CD booklet.

£50.00, 3 copies of "Penllyn", plus 1 x “A Hundred Years of British Piano Miniatures” performed by Duncan Honeybourne, plus “Vestiges” by David Power and David Lancaster, plus “Flowing Waters” by Luke Whitlock. Also, name you as supporter in CD booklet.

£75.00, 4 copies of "Penllyn", plus 1 x “A Hundred Years of British Piano Miniatures” performed by Duncan Honeybourne, plus “Vestiges” by David Power and David Lancaster, plus “Flowing Waters” by Luke Whitlock. Also, name you as supporter in CD booklet.

£100.00, 4 copies of "Penllyn", plus 1 x “A Hundred Years of British Piano Miniatures” performed by Duncan Honeybourne, plus 1 x “Vestiges” by David Power and David Lancaster, plus 1 x “Flowing Waters” by Luke Whitlock. Also, an invitation to an exclusive zoom event (strictly limited to 15 places), hosted by Duncan Honeybourne, David Power and Luke Whitlock (myself), where we'll share some of our memories of Peter Reynolds, and Duncan Honeybourne will perform some music by Peter Reynolds, in advance of the CD being released. Also, you'll be named as a Primary Sponsor in the CD booklet.

 

The Impact

Peter Reynolds gave so much to thousands of people throughout his life, and yet he was very unassuming when it came to his own compositions. Whether teaching, conducting, ensemble manager, writing programme notes and so much more, he had a significant impact upon the classical music industry in Wales and far beyond. This is an opportunity for us to give something back, and to hear Peter's music once again.

 

Risks & Challenges

It has been a challenge to track down Peter's music, for not all of it was listed on his personal website. However, works came out of the woodwork, often gifts he'd written for special people in his life.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For all of you who knew and loved Peter, please do spread the word and share this Crowd Funding appeal. So many I am sure will want to support this project, and if this gets off to a good start, I hope to then manage a follow up disc exploring some of Peter's as yet unrecorded chamber music too.

Thank you so much for your support. All your donations will be gratefully received.

Luke Whitlock

story:
WELCOME!

Hello, World! We are Blue Lenex - a Singer/Songwriter group that fuses piano, vocals and beatboxing to create a sound that has not yet been achieved in music.

We currently attend Hofstra University on Long Island, NY and have gained a following in New York, New Jersey and Philadelphia, PA!

We have been together for about a year and have been writing songs that we really believe in. We are finally ready to record our first album BUT, we NEED YOUR HELP!

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

In order to make this first album, we need to raise $10,000. That sounds like a lot, but with a little help from a lot of people, we think we can do it!

The funds will be going towards pre-production, studio time, mixing, mastering, and distribution. 

WHAT THIS MEANS TO US

It is IMPOSSIBLE to express how much this album means to us. We poured every little bit of ourselves into these songs and want nothing more than to make them finally come to life. 

Any little bit you can contrbute is so immensely appreciated.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you are struggling college students like us or simply cannot afford to donate, don't fret, there are other ways to help us. 

The most important thing you can do is help us spread the word about this campaign. Share it with everyone you know!!!

Thanks so much for your support. With your help, we hope we can make our dream album become a reality!

XO,

Blue Lenex

story:
His Promise is a touring production incorporating music, poetry, live art, dance, and theater weaved together to tell a modern day story of the prodigal son. It focuses on the perspective of the prodigal son (representing those who stray from God) and his brother (the faithful, yet unfulfilled believer) to tell a compelling audio-visual story about the present state of the world and church.

At times it will appear like a concert, others like a musical. You may think you're at a poetry slam, or maybe a hip hop cipher. These elements seamlessly flow in and out of one another weaving you into this story that we believe is for such a time as this. We can't wait to share it with you!

 

Why are we doing this?

As we look around us, we see more and more people giving up on institutionalized religion and tradional Christianity. Like you, we've seen and felt what it's become, and can tell that much of it simply couldn't be what God desires of "His" Church. We, like so many others, have experienced a form of Godliness, but a complete and utter lack of POWER, INTEGIRTY, UNITY, and VISION. There obviously has to be more; and as many of us have asked God to show us what His true intentions and will are, we believe He is beginning to show us. We believe this is a fulfillment of a "Promise" he has made to us. Greater works, more than we can ask or think, things that eyes haven't seen...LOVE. These are the things our hearts desire to see realized for the Church. That's why we believe He has given us...His Promise.

 

What's the vision/mission?

Our vision for this tour is to cultivate hope in attendees through Inspired creative expression via the story of the Prodigal. We want to release a new sound that affects our culture causing people to see things as God sees them and not as the media, government, music industry, or even the "church" at large portrays them. Our goal is to awaken, inspire and share a hope in a living God and real Father who loves them and will make good on the promise He has made to them as individuals as well as mankind as a whole.

The mission wil be to travel to cities and exemplify the nature of Christ as we serve communities, connect, and share this production. There is a "movement" (cliche I know!) manifesting around concept and we simply want to seek God corporately while being open to connect and share while we steward this call.

We are all "Products of Promise" and we want to receive and walk in our destined promise and help others to do the same.

 

Phases:

Phase 1: Winter Assembly

January 18th-20th we will be bringing everybody together here in Atlanta the weekend of January the 18th - 20th where we will be meeting for th first time to jam, record, and document our time (video footage so you can follow your investment!). We'll also be meeting with and auditioning dancers, poets, and more.

Video content, new music, websites, and blogs will be on the way for you to stay connected.

Phase 2: Spring Forward

We will be making all pieces of the puzzle concrete, while building strategic partnerships with various organizations and companies. This will also be the time for us to lock down all cities and dates and fortify our relationships in each place. Near the end of this phase we will be finalizing the production and beginning rigorous rehearsal.

Phase 3: Summer Plunge

Tour begins!


What are we asking for:

Prayer Support: Our main objective for this tour is to CHANGE lives. We are hoping that millions of people would be impacted through this tour. Join us as we pray for our performers, staff, tour supporters, and mostly our tour audience. If you like to be a part of our prayer team email us at hispromisetour@gmail.com.

Financial Support: The total cost for the full production of this tour is $150,000. We've separated the cost of this tour into two different phases. We did this so you can see the results of each phase as we move forward. We will be updating our IndieGoGo campaign with update videos on our progress weekly. The first phase of tour includes the cost of travel arrangements for participants, tour promotions, tour rehearsals, and some staffing. Total cost of Phase 1 is $20,000. The second phase of this tour includes tour coordination, tour expenses, travel arrangements throughout the tour, production cost, and staffing for 3 months. Total cost of Phase 2 is $130,000.

Team Support: Become apart of our team! Help us come to a city near you by becoming an advocate for this tour in your area. You can join our Promotion team and assist in helping us organize our events. If you’re interested please contact our promotion team at hispromisetour@gmail.com. If you’re not able to join our team, you can still help us by passing along our IndieGoGo link to all your friends and family, this may be for them. IndieGoGo Link:


What are we giving:

We know that this is a significance amount for this tour. We understand that you value your money and want to ensure its proper use. We are putting together a host of update videos, and social media sites that will keep you well informed and connected from the start to finish of this tour. We have also listed a variety of incentives to all of our partners on our IndieGoGo campaign. We are prepared to show any partner/donor a copy of our budget for this tour. There are also partnership opportunities for anyone who wants to partner or help assist our team financially or through promotions. For example, a $5,000 partner will receive a 30 second commercial advertisement during one of our shows.

We would like to thank everyone who stopped by to visit our IndieGoGo campaign. May God bless you and May "His Promise" for your life be fulfilled and manifested.

Meet some of the crew!

Brandon “Love” Burke – (Artist. Tour Facilitator) Brandon Burke has years of experience touring, recording music, performing, and advising celebrity artist such as Justin Bieber. Mr. Burke is founder of GoGettaz for God and Visionary for His Promise Movement.  GoGettaz 4 God    Revival Spoken Word - Brandon Burke

Promise – (Artist. Songwriter) Wit.Flow. Drive. These are the monikers that describe Hip-Hop soul artist, Promise. He seamlessly blends conceptual songwriting and potent lyrical content with a focus on life, love & the consciousness of mankind. Deemed a hip-hop sensation, Promise has the proven ability to take any person beyond the shallow surface of life. As Peace Magazine duly noted: “Promise has a rhyme style reminiscent of Rakim".  www.ipromisemusic.com

Anthony Gaba-DeLaCroix – (Artist. Produce. Head Musical Coordinator) Anthony Gaba-DeLaCroix is a man after God's own heart. A father of three with his wife Deborah, Anthony's mission is to share the love of God by example. "When you choose to love and open your heart to others, the life you reflect becomes a mirror for others to see themselves in. Choose LOVE, and fill the earth with it. It will cover the blinding ignorance of the world, and help them see." Take Your Time - Anthony Gaba-DeLaCroix

Profess Aphetic – (Producer. Composer) Profess Aphetic has been called to help change the message in music with a soulful, classic sound. His music presents itself as a new light in culture today while introducing the correct standard back into society. Profess Aphetic

Sam Collier – (Singer)With an uncanny ability to capture emotion through song, Sam Collier is the voice of love in its most raw state. Through his music, Sam Collier captures the essence of the beautifully human needs of freedom, peace and love. New Day - Promise ftCecoya, Sam Collier

Cekoya – (Singer) Combining the best of worship and love, Cekoya is a breath of fresh air in both arenas. How to Love Cover - Cecoyaft promise

Alex Whitfield – (Singer. Songwriter)A brilliant and prolific singer/songwriter, Alex brings a sound of what it must have been like to witness the psalms been written by David. Deeply penetrating the very soul of man, Alex has a unique gift that calls upon the intimacy of God through song. Alex resides in Minnesota with his beautiful wife and two children.

Henry Lopez aka Lil Lopez  – (Producer. Songwriter) Founder of D.R.E.A.M
(Dare.Risk.Everything.Always.Maintan) Lil Lopez Beatz

Larissa Wilson – (Singer. Songwriter. Storywriter)LarissaWilson is an ordinary girl who's faced extraordinary obstacles culminating in a beautiful testimony and a special way of seeing the world. Her story is the story of the prodigal. http://www.MyDesireCoach.com

Eshon Burgundy – (Emcee. Videographer) This emcee extraordinaire has garnered an impressive following in the gospel music scene in a short period of time. The blend of lyrical prowess, presence, and content is a rare find in any cypher across the planet. This husband, father, producer, director, rapper’s skill set is simply, second to none.www.eshonburgundy.com


Branden Burch –(Sponsor. Producer) This music producer turned app developer is a devoted husband, loving father and brilliant business mind. It is refreshing yet rare to come across a person with such a sharp mind, clear vision, and high commitment to integrity. www.xmeinc.com 

Benjamin Whitfield – (Tour Coordinator. Co-Founder of His Promise Movement) A pioneer for this generation and revolutionary who oversees many Kingdom ventures including the His Promise Movement. With years of experience in the world of music, servitude, and networking, Benjamin is a well-respected figure amongst entertainers throughout the nation. www.facebook.com/fishermanjones 



This information has been Sponsored by "His Promise" Tour Movement.

For example, a $5,000 partner will receive a 30 second commercial advertisement during one of our shows.We would like to thank everyone who stopped by to visit our IndieGoGo campaign. May God bless you and May "His Promise" for your life be fulfilled and manifested.Meet some of the crew!
Brandon “Love” Burke – (Artist. Tour Facilitator) Brandon Burke has years of experience touring, recording music, performing, and advising celebrity artist such as Justin Bieber. Mr. Burke is founder of GoGettaz for God and Visionary for His Promise Movement.  GoGettaz 4 God    Revival Spoken Word - Brandon BurkePromise – (Artist. Songwriter) Wit.Flow. Drive. These are the monikers that describe Hip-Hop soul artist, Promise. He seamlessly blends conceptual songwriting and potent lyrical content with a focus on life, love & the consciousness of mankind. Deemed a hip-hop sensation, Promise has the proven ability to take any person beyond the shallow surface of life. As Peace Magazine duly noted: “Promise has a rhyme style reminiscent of Rakim".  www.ipromisemusic.comAnthony Gaba-DeLaCroix – (Artist. Produce. Head Musical Coordinator) Anthony Gaba-DeLaCroix is a man after God's own heart. A father of three with his wife Deborah, Anthony's mission is to share the love of God by example. "When you choose to love and open your heart to others, the life you reflect becomes a mirror for others to see themselves in. Choose LOVE, and fill the earth with it. It will cover the blinding ignorance of the world, and help them see." Take Your Time - Anthony Gaba-DeLaCroixProfess Aphetic – (Producer. Composer) Profess Aphetic has been called to help change the message in music with a soulful, classic sound. His music presents itself as a new light in culture today while introducing the correct standard back into society. Profess Aphetic
Sam Collier – (Singer)With an uncanny ability to capture emotion through song, Sam Collier is the voice of love in its most raw state. Through his music, Sam Collier captures the essence of the beautifully human needs of freedom, peace and love. New Day - Promise ftCecoya, Sam CollierCekoya – (Singer) Combining the best of worship and love, Cekoya is a breath of fresh air in both arenas. How to Love Cover - Cecoyaft promise
Alex Whitfield – (Singer. Songwriter)A brilliant and prolific singer/songwriter, Alex brings a sound of what it must have been like to witness the psalms been written by David. Deeply penetrating the very soul of man, Alex has a unique gift that calls upon the intimacy of God through song. Alex resides in Minnesota with his beautiful wife and two children.Henry Lopez aka Lil Lopez  – (Producer. Songwriter) Founder of D.R.E.A.M(Dare.Risk.Everything.Always.Maintan) Lil Lopez Beatz
Larissa Wilson – (Singer. Songwriter. Storywriter)LarissaWilson is an ordinary girl who's faced extraordinary obstacles culminating in a beautiful testimony and a special way of seeing the world. Her story is the story of the prodigal. http://www.MyDesireCoach.com
Eshon Burgundy – (Emcee. Videographer) This emcee extraordinaire has garnered an impressive following in the gospel music scene in a short period of time. The blend of lyrical prowess, presence, and content is a rare find in any cypher across the planet. This husband, father, producer, director, rapper’s skill set is simply, second to none.www.eshonburgundy.com
Branden Burch –(Sponsor. Producer) This music producer turned app developer is a devoted husband, loving father and brilliant business mind. It is refreshing yet rare to come across a person with such a sharp mind, clear vision, and high commitment to integrity. www.xmeinc.com 
Benjamin Whitfield – (Tour Coordinator. Co-Founder of His Promise Movement) A pioneer for this generation and revolutionary who oversees many Kingdom ventures including the His Promise Movement. With years of experience in the world of music, servitude, and networking, Benjamin is a well-respected figure amongst entertainers throughout the nation. www.facebook.com/fishermanjones 
This information has been Sponsored by "His Promise" Tour Movement.

story:
Our Goal:

Our goal is to raise funds to open our new creative space located in the Woodland Hills area of Los Angeles County.  This new space is approximately 800sq ft and newly remodeled.  It features polished concrete floors, 15' exposed industrial ceilings, and floor to ceiling windows for plenty of natural light.  It is located on Ventura Blvd directly off the 101 freeway in a modern and beautiful building that has recently won a triple diamond award for design.

We will provide low cost rental time to photographers and students that may not have regular access to professional grade studio equipment and space.  This new space will also be open to educators and instructors at a discounted price for workshops and education.

Who we are:

We are photographers from the Los Angeles area and we are passionate about what we do.  We love photography of all genres, learning, and providing assistance to those with equal passion and eagerness to learn.

Since starting our photography business, it has been our biggest drive to expand and create a business in which other photographers, can use to create and grow their artistic skills.  The art of photography is a very expensive practice and we feel being able to provide a comfortable, private, and professional working space will help enhance the local artistic community as well as helping other photographers achieve their creative goals.

Your contributions will help directly impact these goals.

What Your Contributions Will Provide:

We have broken down our goal in to 3 categories.

  • Studio Supplies and Equipment.  This portion will provide things like office supplies, equipment, small storage, dispensable and consumables.
  • Renovation of the current space.  A small portion will be dedicated to providing a space with a more creative and artistic feel.  This will include paint, lights, etc.
  • Marketing.  Helping us spread the word to local photographers and educators.

Every cent counts and even if our campaign does not reach its 100% goal, your contributions still impact these areas.

Current Traction and Progress

We are very close to opening the doors. We have already acquired our space and our studio equipment, but we are asking for your help in completing our project.

What are your perks?

We have attempted to gather unique gift ideas for every contribution.  We have collected a grab bag of gift resources that have been reserved for each tier level ranging from cards, to photographic prints and services,  but the biggest thing we could ever offer is our eternal gratitude for believing in us and helping us achieve our dreams. 

We will also provide every contributor with a HUGE social media thank you and discounted opportunities to use our studio or give to a friend as a gift.

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust us, we know that not everyone is able to provide contributions or may not even need studio services, but even if you can only provide $10,  it is greatly appreciated. 

You can also help us spread the word about this campaign by posting our link our your social media pages like Facebook and Twitter.

For more information, please email us at:info@dieterchaney.com

For News and Updates, please follow us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/fotoazzurro

story:
Short Summary 

The Music is Art Festival, now in it's 11th year is a one-day, all day, absolutely free festival that will be held on Saturday, September 21, 2013 at Delaware Park by the Marcy Casino.

The festival features over 150 bands and DJ's on more than 10 stages, over 75 displaying artists & photographers, dozens of dance troupes, live art creations, non-profit tents, our ever popular kids village, food vendors, beer & wine tents, and surprises around every corner!

Music is Art is a not-for-profit, federal 501c3 organization founded by Goo Goo Dolls bassist and Buffalo resident, Robby Takac.  Music is Art is dedicated to exploring and reshaping music's cultural, social, and educational impact on our community - supported by a variety of programs and events.

The goal of the Music is Art Festival is to showcase the creativity we have right in our own backyards and to keep the festival free to our community.

What We Need & What You Get

We have decided to raise additional funds for 2013 through this campaign so that we can get even more creative with the festival yet keep it free for attendees.

Check out the unique perks and get your own piece of Music is Art, and feel good that you're helping keep our little festival alive!

The Music is Art Festival is not a fundraising event for our organization, rather all the funds raised go to produce the festival and allow us to be even more outrageous than ever!  Every dollar raised goes right into the 2013 event.

The Impact

The Music is Art Festival is dedicated to providing the Western New York community access to all forms of art and creative expression.  The Festival is for all ages and all walks of life.  we have been fortunate to continue growing the Festival each year and adding new elements to help us achieve this goal.

Please consider contributing today!  Besides the perks listed, you have our undying gratitude and appreciativeness.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the means to contribute financially.  There are still ways you can help!

  • Help us get the word out about this campaign.  Share it with your friends via email, facebook, or twitter!
  • Sign up to be a volunteer at the Festival!  It takes an army to pull this event off each year and we can't do it without our most generous volunteers!  Just visit our website at www.musicisart.org and click on the contact us tab to sign up today.

story:
Short Summary

The purpose of this campaign is to fund the mastering and duplication of my new album, Terra Ultra. But who am I? 

My name is T.S. Moth and Transdusk is my solo project/music baby. To be more succinct, it is my life's work. The music is of the industrial metal persuasion but I like to think of it as a bit more than that (not that I mind being labeled as such) so I tend to refer to it as 'thrash wave'. 

It could be said that I have a very strong DIY ethic and do all my own writing, recording, artwork, promotion, and more. I indeed did this all for my eponymous debut album as well as (just barely) financing it. In doing so, and due to the fact that I was incredibly eager to get it out there, things were a bit rushed that time through. But now that I'm gaining a bit of traction and the scope of this album is greater than the last, I can't go it alone!

By contributing to this campaign, you actively help me make this album everything it could be and to those who contribute, I cannot thank you enough!

What I Need & What You Get

So what I'm looking to pay for via this campaign is simple:

  • To pay for mastering ($250)
  • To pay for the production of the CDs (at least $450. Though if there's greater demand, which would be boss-as-hell, I will need more)
  • The rest of the money will go towards shipping costs for the packages.
There are a ton of options for what you can get depending on how much you contribute!


Risks & Challenges

In terms of risk, there isn't too much here thankfully. As previously stated, the album is fully recorded and mixed, I just need your help to get it mastered and the CDs printed up!

This is not to say that $800 is a small sum of change (though compared to some other campaigns on here, it is definitely on the lower end. But I think this is a highly attainable goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Simply put: spread the word!

There's a month to do this and for people to have the chance to get down on some extremely limited merch so every person you tell helps!

story:
You can find the text in English,French,Turkish and Arabic.

English;

Hi everyone. I am Yusuf Celik. 25 yearsold professional Cello player from Turkey. I made my studies in Turkey and Germany,worked with great people.  Until today I used to play with an instrument which was not mine and now I had to give it back. So I don't have a cello to play with anymore. As you can understand it is such a hard situation for a professional musician to be without an instrument! I still have concerts to play but.. 

I am the principle cello player of Karsiyaka Chamber Orchestra in İzmir Turkey. Also the cello player of Saygun Quartet. Need your help to continue my career and my life.. Some small help will not change so much in your life but you are gonna touch my life as much as you can not imagine.

#####################################

Türkçe;

Ben profesyonel bir viyolonsel sanatçısıyım. İzmir Karşıyaka Oda Orkestrasında viyolonsel grup şefi ve Saygun Quartet üyesiyim. Bu güne kadar benim olmayan bir enstruman ile çalıyordum ve geri vermek zorunda kaldım. Şu an mesleğimi icra edebileceğim bir enstrumanım yok.  Profesyonel bir müzisyen için olabilecek en zor durum. Konserlerim ve yarışmalarım var fakat enstrumanım yok.  Kariyerimi ve hayatımı sürdürebilmem için yardımınıza ihtiyacım var. Sizin için küçük bir yardım benim hayatımı hayallerinizin ötesinde etkileyecek...

########################################

Francais;

Je suis un violoncelliste professionnel originaire de Turquie. Jouant jusqu’à aujourd’hui sur un instrument qui n’était pas le mien, j’ai été dans l’obligation de le rendre. De fait, je n’ai pour l’heure plus de violoncelle sur lequel exercer mon art. Comme vous le comprendrez, je me retrouve dans une situation extrêment difficile, puisque j’ai de nombreux concerts prévus. Je suis le violoncelliste principal de l’Orchestre de Chambre de Karsiyaka (Izmir, Turquie) et le violoncelle du Saygun Quartet. Je vous écris aujourd’hui pour vous demander de l'aide, afin de pouvoir poursuivre ma carrière et ma vie de musicien. Un soutien, même modeste, aurait une influence considérable sur mon futur et ma carrière.

####################################

Arabic

أنا عازف محترف لآلة التشيلو من تركيا. حتى يومنا هذا كنت أقوم بالعزف على آلة موسيقية لم تكن ملك لي ، و كان علي أن أعيدها إلى مالكها الأصيل. الأمر الذي جعلني حالياً بدون آلة موسيقية لأقوم بالعزف عليها. بالطبع كما تعلم كيف هو مثل هذا الوضع الصعب بالنسبة لموسيقى محترف مثلي أن يكون من دون آلة موسيقية! فأنا لا يزال لدي حفلات موسيقية مهمة لأقوم بالعزف فيها ، و لكن كيف ؟؟

أنا عازف التشيلو الأساسي من أوركسترا الحجرة كارسياكا في إزمير تركيا. كما أني عازف التشيلو من رباعي سايغون الوتري. أنا بحاجة ماسة لمساعدتك على مواصلة حياتي المهنية .. قليل من المساعدة لن يغير كثيراً في حياتك ، و لكنها تعني الكثير لتغير حياتي بقدر لا يمكن أن تتخيله.

و لك جزيل الشكر،،،

story:
We're Echo Black from New York City and we are humbly asking for your help. We create music because it is what we NEED to do to communicate and to survive. Unfortunately, what we need doesn't always bring us financial stability or the means necessary to continue. 

Before we get into what we're asking of you, let us give you some background on Echo Black in case you are new to us:

We are a pop/rock four piece band based out of New York City/New Jersey. We have all been making music for quite a few years now, but, as this band, we've only been together since March of 2015. In that time, we've released 3 singles with accompanying music videos, toured the country and been featured on such publications as Billboard, AP, FUSE, and Revolver. We believe in the fusion of fashion, music, creativity, political and social awareness, and intelligence. We make music you can feel; music that is meant to stick around. Check out "Chemicals" and see what we mean! 

We have done a lot in a short time, and... spent a lot... in a short time. We have the most important thing: MOMENTUM. We have more music written and, it seems, the demand for its release is high. We're coming up to a period where we feel that frequent touring will be able to sustain us in the near future, but we need to get to that point. If we lose this momentum, we will have to start from scratch. And that will bury us. Without your help, we'll be unable to release our album until 2018. 

To be completely upfront with you all, in order for us to have released the singles we released and back it all with the right promo, we had to spend 15,000 over 4 months. And it truly tapped us out. We're musicians, yes, but we're also bartenders, graphic designers, retail clerks, etc. Music is expensive and all we want to do is make it and play it for you.  

We just need a push... to get to that point where the music sustains itself. And, guys... we're SO close. We are at the boiling point. It's now or never.

Again, we are humbly asking for your help to get us to that next level. We do what we do for the fans and the listeners and we feel that our music has an important place. We have to believe that, or else, why keep making it?

1.   Finish out our album: we have 5 more tracks to record

2.   Shoot one hell of a music video for our next single to help push the album.

3.   Get on the road for most of 2017 to bring our show to YOU

It is possible, we know it is. But we need you in order to make it happen. 

$5,000 will go towards producing, mixing, and mastering the remainder of the album

$1,000 will go towards pressing the physical CDs

$3,000 will go towards the most epic video we've made yet

$1,000 will go towards the start of promo and getting us on the road

Any extra money we make will go towards the video and further promotion and will only increase our momentum. Believe me, we are still putting money towards our dreams. But if we do it ourselves, our timeline will totally bury us.   

Here's the exciting part! 

We're offering some pretty cool sh*t in order to further entice you to help us out! 

Want to hear the album before anyone else? Done. 

Want to come hang out in the studio with us while we record? We'd love to have you! 

Want a custom cover song recorded specifically for you? Great! 

Want Danny's custom Swarovski crystal microphone (still in working condition)? Its yours! 

Want some great merch in time for the holiday season? It's all here! 

Want to hang out with Echo Black on our bus in your city? Let's do it! 

We're asking for $10,000 to put us where we need to be... and, honestly, it will mean the world to us if we get there! 

This album will mark a turning point for us as a band. And you can be a part of this journey with us. We all work outside of music in order to survive and keep the dream alive... but sometimes its still not enough. 

Can't Contribute Right This Second? 

Just share, share, share! Every eye on this campaign will help us. We always say that people should support music because music supports people. 

Never has that meant more to us than right now. 

Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for reading and becoming a part of the Echo Black family. 

We love you all and cant wait to see you on the road!!! 

-Danny, Billy, Felix, and Rob
story_txt:
We're Echo Black from New York City and we are humbly asking for your help. We create music because it is what we NEED to do to communicate and to survive. Unfortunately, what we need doesn't always bring us financial stability or the means necessary to continue. 
Before we get into what we're asking of you, let us give you some background on Echo Black in case you are new to us:
We are a pop/rock four piece band based out of New York City/New Jersey. We have all been making music for quite a few years now, but, as this band, we've only been together since March of 2015. In that time, we've released 3 singles with accompanying music videos, toured the country and been featured on such publications as Billboard, AP, FUSE, and Revolver. We believe in the fusion of fashion, music, creativity, political and social awareness, and intelligence. We make music you can feel; music that is meant to stick around. Check out "Chemicals" and see what we mean! 

We have done a lot in a short time, and... spent a lot... in a short time. We have the most important thing: MOMENTUM. We have more music written and, it seems, the demand for its release is high. We're coming up to a period where we feel that frequent touring will be able to sustain us in the near future, but we need to get to that point. If we lose this momentum, we will have to start from scratch. And that will bury us. Without your help, we'll be unable to release our album until 2018. 
To be completely upfront with you all, in order for us to have released the singles we released and back it all with the right promo, we had to spend 15,000 over 4 months. And it truly tapped us out. We're musicians, yes, but we're also bartenders, graphic designers, retail clerks, etc. Music is expensive and all we want to do is make it and play it for you.  
We just need a push... to get to that point where the music sustains itself. And, guys... we're SO close. We are at the boiling point. It's now or never.
Again, we are humbly asking for your help to get us to that next level. We do what we do for the fans and the listeners and we feel that our music has an important place. We have to believe that, or else, why keep making it?

1.   Finish out our album: we have 5 more tracks to record
2.   Shoot one hell of a music video for our next single to help push the album.
3.   Get on the road for most of 2017 to bring our show to YOU
It is possible, we know it is. But we need you in order to make it happen. 

$5,000 will go towards producing, mixing, and mastering the remainder of the album
$1,000 will go towards pressing the physical CDs
$3,000 will go towards the most epic video we've made yet
$1,000 will go towards the start of promo and getting us on the road
Any extra money we make will go towards the video and further promotion and will only increase our momentum. Believe me, we are still putting money towards our dreams. But if we do it ourselves, our timeline will totally bury us.   


Here's the exciting part! 
We're offering some pretty cool sh*t in order to further entice you to help us out! 
Want to hear the album before anyone else? Done. 
Want to come hang out in the studio with us while we record? We'd love to have you! 
Want a custom cover song recorded specifically for you? Great! 
Want Danny's custom Swarovski crystal microphone (still in working condition)? Its yours! 
Want some great merch in time for the holiday season? It's all here! 
Want to hang out with Echo Black on our bus in your city? Let's do it! 
We're asking for $10,000 to put us where we need to be... and, honestly, it will mean the world to us if we get there! 
This album will mark a turning point for us as a band. And you can be a part of this journey with us. We all work outside of music in order to survive and keep the dream alive... but sometimes its still not enough. 

Can't Contribute Right This Second? 
Just share, share, share! Every eye on this campaign will help us. We always say that people should support music because music supports people. 
Never has that meant more to us than right now. 
Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for reading and becoming a part of the Echo Black family. 
We love you all and cant wait to see you on the road!!! 
-Danny, Billy, Felix, and Rob

story:
Wir bieten inklusive Sportangebote in Berlin-Karow

"Karow aktiv" im Berliner Bezirk Pankow ist ein Netzwerk verschiedener Vereine und Organisationen, das vom Sporttreff Karower Dachse initiiert wurde.

Mit unseren inklusiven Lauf- und Walkingtreffs bringen wir Menschen mit Down-Syndrom, mit Suchterkrankungen, mit Sehbehinderung, mit Diabeteserkrankung und gesunde Menschen dazu, gemeinsam Sport zu treiben.

Gemeinsam veranstalten wir u. a. auch einen Volkslauf und eine Gesundheitsmesse.

Wie kannst Du helfen?

In der Regel sind die meisten Menschen mit körperlicher und/oder geistiger Behinderung von der Teilnahme an sportlichen Aktivitäten ausgeschlossen. Es gibt es kaum Sportmöglichkeiten im inklusiven Bereich für Menschen mit Behinderung außer im Sportleistungsbereich. Um das zu ändern bietet das Team von „Karow aktiv“ in Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Institutionen und dem Bezirk Pankow  sportliche Aktivitäten an, an denen Menschen mit und ohne Behinderungen gleichberechtigt teilnehmen können, im Alltagssport und völlig ohne Leistungsdruck.

Hierzu erstellen wir im Naherholungsgebiet "Neue Wiesen" einen Lauf- und Walkingpark. Die Strecken sind vermessen, die Schilder bereits erstellt und die Genehmigung des Bezirksamts liegt auch schon vor.

Leider wird die Aktion durch Auflagen und Vorschriften des Bezirksamts für uns teurer als geplant. Uns fehlen 2.000 Euro für die vorgeschriebene Art der Aufstellung der Streckenmarkierungen.

Was wir brauchen & Was Du bekommst

Wir brauchen Sponsoren! Durch Deine Unterstützung wirst Du ein wesentlicher Teil des inklusiven Laufparks in den neuen Wiesen. Dein Name erscheint als Sponsor auf unserer Webseite und Du erhältst ein Namensschild auf der Übersichtstafel des Laufparks.

Für eine Summe von 500 Euro erhält eine der Laufstrecken Deinen Namen oder den Namen einer Person, die Du mit einem außergewöhnlichen Geschenk überraschen möchtest.

Schon seit vielen Jahren kann man einsame Inseln kaufen, die niemand erreichen kann oder Sterne am Himmel, die keiner sehen kann. Bei uns aber erhältst Du einen konkreten Gegenwert. Du kannst auf deiner eigenen Laufstrecke Sport treiben. Ist das nicht der Hammer?

Sobald wir unser Ziel erreicht haben, lassen wir die Streckenmarkierungen aufstellen. Sollten wir nicht das ganze Geld zusammenbekommen, lassen wir zumindest einen Teil der Markierungen aufstellen.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Nutze persönliche und soziale Netzwerke, um Freunde und Bekannte auf unsere Indiegogo-Kampagne aufmerksam zu machen.

story:
About Inspire-Works

Inspire-works deliver world-music workshops to over 65,000 children and young adults in over 650 schools throughout the UK each academic year, delivering whole-class programmes in a wide range of global drumming workshops open to all ages from babies to adults!

 

What We Need:

Funding to cover two Drum Club Cafe pilot-sessions at the end of November & beginning of December for families on the Broom Farm Estate. The funding will cover all running costs and help us create a case for future weekly Drum Club Cafe sessions on the estate in 2018. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be immensely grateful for any contribution and would love to have as many people as possible in your networks aware of what we are doing and have an opportunity to get involved by making a contribution or offering some other support.

Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
Rich's New Music Campaign

Hello Everyone. For those of you who don't know me I'm a 18-year-old singer-songwriter-guitarist who has been performing and even touring with his own music for about 2 years now. I've made my way to 10 different states and 25 different cities. I've performed live on a few tv stations and had my music played on several radio stations throughout the region. I'll be starting college soon and with that comes many financial difficulties. Between the cost of tuition and books and constant repairs to my car and my musicial gear there won't be much money left over for much of anything. I've been wanting to record an EP of my new songs for quite sometime now. People have been coming up to me after shows only to find out that their favorite song from set was not included on the CD I have for sale. So I'm now turning to you guys, my fans, family & friends, to help make this dream come to life. I understand completely if you are only able to give the bare minimum. Every little bit helps. I understand completely if you aren't able to give at all. If this is the case I ask only that you share my campaign with your friends in the hopes that one of them is able to.

Thank you very much for your time and contributions,

Richard Strater

http://richstratermusic.webs.com

story:
Who is this weirdo, and why should I give her $$?

My name is Lisa Koch, and I'm a Seattle musician, originally from Ashland, OR.  I have been lucky enough to make my living as an a musician, actor, sketch comic, writer and producer.  I have recorded 4 solo CD's, and am just about ready to release #5.  For those of you who have requested that I "just sing", this latest offering is love songs, song I love, and songs that inspire (only one comedy song, and that's about the vile-smelling natural spring water in my hometown).  I have self-financed all previous recordings, but could really use a little help with this one.  That's where you come in!  I'm on track for an early May release.  Help me meet my goal!

Is that like in soccer?

Uh, no.  My goal is $15,000.  That pays for musicians, studio costs, mastering, graphic design, licensing fees, and duplication.  And for coffee, lots and lots of coffee.  If I don't meet my goal, I'll use every penny raised toward the CD.  If I exceed the goal (I can dream, can't I?), all funds will go toward my next creative endeavor (music, stage, writing).  I'll send updates to keep you all in the loop.

I thought CD's were extinct, like 8-tracks, and the Dodo.

No, CD's are still around.  Usually sold at gigs, where they can be autographed, and then sold decades later, after being appraised for 1.2 million dollars on "Antiques Roadshow".

What's on your CD?

11 songs-- a mix of originals and re-imagined cover tunes.  The title song "Enjoy the Ride" is dedicated to my dear departed father, Frank.  We lost him in 2009, and miss him every day.  The song is about feeling gratitude, not being afraid, taking risks, and living large every day.  And no time like the present, holy crapola.   "This is precisely the time when artists go to work" (thanks, Toni Morrison).

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help by making some noise about the campaign.  Click and Share, it's just that easy!

story:
We Are Kai Andersen And The Pickups

We're an American Indie-Rock band, and after 4 years of playing shows across the country, an EP and a few singles later we're recording our debut full-length album.  We're known for energetic live performances, and we're trying to capture that on our record.  You can also check out some music that we've recorded before at http://kaiandersenandthepickups.bandcamp.com 

We're incredibly lucky to have Alex Dezen of The Damnwells on board as our producer. Alex is not only a multi-platinum selling songwriter, he is also a world-class producer.  He has written for and worked with artists such as The Dixie Chicks, Dave Grohl, Gary Louis of The Jayhawks, Sara Bareilles, Jason Derulo, Christina Perri, Kelly Clarkson, Simple Plan and many others. 

You can be a part of our journey by contributing to our Indiegogo campaign!

 

 

The Long and Short

Making an album isn't easy, or cheap. To make the best album possible we need to raise some serious money. $11,000 serious.

 

The Breakdown

  • $5,000 for 6 days at Pleasantry Lane Studio in Dallas, TX
  • $4,000 for producer cost
  • $2000 for CD and eventual Vinyl pressing
  • $1000 for Mastering
  • 10-15% for Indiegogo and credit card fees

Our listed goal is $11,000, however this only covers the absolute basic costs. There are many hidden costs like travel and other expenses that will be coming out of our own pockets.  The true cost of recording this album will be greater than what we are asking for your help with.  Anything helps!

 

 

Be Our Record Label

We're an independent band, and that means we have to find the funding for everything we do. This also gives us full creative control over our music. When you donate any amount you are actively helping us shape the future of this band. We've come a long way in four years and we do it for the love of our music and our fans. If it wasn't for all the support we couldn't be where we are today.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our video or give us a shout-out anywhere and we will love you forever. We mean it! Thank you!

story:
Apophenia: seeing meaningful patterns or connections in random or meaningless data

Hi, I'm Lee from the band Underpass

I am in the final stages of recording my new album "Apophenia", the follow up to 2011's "Submergence"

15 tracks of shimmering off kilter post-rock electronica.  If you like Mogwai, Jesu, Sigur Ros, or Godspeed! You Black Emperor, this is the project for you.

I'm hoping to raise $650 to cover the pressing of the limited edition CD and pay for the cover art.

Listen to the title track from the album here: http://soundcloud.com/underpass/underpass-apophenia

 

Without funding this CD can never come out, so every donation is vital to the project.

 

  • It's not just money you can contribute.  Tell your friends about the project, tweet, share on facebook, tell a mate, everything helps.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

http://www.underpass.org.uk

story:
Our Story

The Berlin Opera Group is a brand new opera group based in Germany.  We are a group of international singers and musicians from America, Ireland, Israel, Brazil, Germany, and Australia, and we have come together with our shared love for beautiful music in order to bring that music to life on stage.  Our goal is to combine quality, beauty, passion, and sincerity in a magical creation of art. We were founded in a living room in Schöneberg, Berlin at the start of 2016, and what started as a simple vision has grown into a wonderful project that will bring audiences of all ages and backgrounds together to enjoy this unique art form.  

Because of your support, we were able to put on two full operas with orchestra: Mozart's Le Nozze di Figaro, at the ehemaliges stummfilmkino Delphi Theater Berlin at the end of May, and Puccini's La Boheme, at the Brotfabrik Berlin in October .  Because of our previous two successes which were only made possible because of YOU, we are now working on our THIRD opera, Ariadne auf Naxos by Richard Strauss.  Ariadne auf Naxos is the hilariously drastic result of when comedy meets tragedy and must find a way to work together for the sake of art.  The Berlin Opera Group will perform the work with two stellar casts and full orchestra at the Pfefferberg Theater in Berlin on April 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th.  This is our biggest endeavor yet because of a bigger orchestra, complex set and costumes, a bigger and more beautiful venue (with a revolving stage!), and extra rehearsals because of the big cast.  We are so excited to put on this magical opera, and now more than ever we need YOUR help once again! 

You can check out our website here to learn more about our team and get more information about our third opera: www.theberlinoperagroup.com

You can also check out our wonderful theater where we will put on our opera here: http://pfefferberg-theater.de/

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where we need your help.  To put on Ariadne auf Naxos, we will need to raise about $9,500.  There are so many costs involved in putting on an opera including the venue, pianist, orchestra, rehearsal spaces, costumes, marketing material, and set pieces. Another big cost that is very specific to this opera is the expense of the rights of the opera.  In Germany, Ariadne auf Naxos is not public domain yet because the composer has not been dead for 70 years, so we need to pay rights to the publisher.  Your generous donations will make it possible for us to put our highest quality opera yet in April.  

Here is an exact breakdown of what we are trying to raise for Ariadne auf Naxos:

Venue for 4 nights: $2,000

Lighting Designer for 4 nights: $500

Set, costumes, and props: $600

Pianist fee for all rehearsals and performances: $500

Posters and marketing materials: $300

Rehearsal space: $600

Conductor and Orchestra: $3,000

Rights to Publisher: $2,000

Total: $9,500

Every donation you give gets you a special perk-from a postcard from Berlin, a CD of duets and arias from the cast of The Berlin Opera Group, to a DVD and a ticket for our performance of Ariadne auf Naxos!  Plus anyone who donates will get their name printed in our program for the opera.  The perk you get depends on the amount you donate.  You can see which donation gets you which perk on the right side of this page! 

 

The Impact

Our mission is to create performance opportunities for ourselves and fellow singers in a setting we can be proud of and our audiences can be moved by, while upholding the quality and integrity of this beautiful art form.

By donating, you will help us on our next step to a professional career.  With your help, we will gain performance experience, build our repertoire, be heard by important audience members, and become ready for the big stages in Germany, simultaneously making opera alive and accessible to modern and diverse audiences in Berlin.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, or if you want to help us even more, you can also help by sharing our campaign and posting this link on all the social networking websites like Facebook, Google +, Twitter, and even e-mail! We will appreciate every little thing you do!

Vielen, vielen Dank für Alles!

Another big cost that is very specific to this opera is the expense of the rights of the opera.  In Germany, Ariadne auf Naxos is not public domain yet because the composer has not been dead for 70 years, so we need to pay rights to the publisher.  Your generous donations will make it possible for us to put our highest quality opera yet in April.  Here is an exact breakdown of what we are trying to raise for Ariadne auf Naxos:Venue for 4 nights: $2,000Lighting Designer for 4 nights: $500Set, costumes, and props: $600Pianist fee for all rehearsals and performances: $500Posters and marketing materials: $300Rehearsal space: $600Conductor and Orchestra: $3,000Rights to Publisher: $2,000Total: $9,500Every donation you give gets you a special perk-from a postcard from Berlin, a CD of duets and arias from the cast of The Berlin Opera Group, to a DVD and a ticket for our performance of Ariadne auf Naxos!  Plus anyone who donates will get their name printed in our program for the opera.  The perk you get depends on the amount you donate.  You can see which donation gets you which perk on the right side of this page!  The ImpactOur mission is to create performance opportunities for ourselves and fellow singers in a setting we can be proud of and our audiences can be moved by, while upholding the quality and integrity of this beautiful art form.By donating, you will help us on our next step to a professional career.  With your help, we will gain performance experience, build our repertoire, be heard by important audience members, and become ready for the big stages in Germany, simultaneously making opera alive and accessible to modern and diverse audiences in Berlin. Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't donate, or if you want to help us even more, you can also help by sharing our campaign and posting this link on all the social networking websites like Facebook, Google +, Twitter, and even e-mail! We will appreciate every little thing you do!Vielen, vielen Dank für Alles!

story:
What’s good it’s ya boy Knu York. We all have dreams in life & things we believe in, but we can’t succeed or accomplish them all by ourselves. Without fans I will never be anything or get where I would like to be, so I am reaching out and asking for your help. My team and I truly believe in the message my song “Good Time” delivers. That message is no matter what you’re going through in life, like getting your lights cut off OR losing your job, set some time aside, hit da club OR do whatever you consider a Good Time!

We would like to make a video for “Good Time” and bring this powerful message to life. Please make a donation to my operation “Good Time” video fund.  It is deeply appreciated. Of course since you guys are my fans and the only ones that will help make this possible, it wouldn’t be right if I didn’t do something for ya. We got some very special prizes in play. If you donate $25 you can be in the video and I mean IN THE VIDEO. If you donate $15, I will record a personal shot out to ya on the Intro track of my debut EP “All Signs Say Yesss!!!” that I will send you. There are incentives as low as $5 so don’t fret if you ain’t got $15 or $25.

Incentives include:

$5: “All Signs Say Yes” Album (mp3) and shot out on Facebook and/or Twitter

$10: “All Signs Say Yesss!!!” Album (physical CD) and shot out on Facebook and/or Twitter

$15: “All Signs Say Yes” Album (mp3) and recorded shout out to you by Knu York as Intro track.

$20: Signed “All Signs Say Yesss!!!” Album (physical CD) and Youtube video shot out

$25: Appear in video (will be shot professionally), Signed “All Signs Say Yesss!!! (physical CD), and Youtube video shot out

With your support, we are hoping to reach a goal of $1500 by 5/12/12. Words can’t describe how much this means to me. I love my fans and thank you all so very much ! Yearn Excellence and Supply Something Special. Yesss!!!

story:
Hey y'all, I'm Paulie Think.  I am a writer, performer, manchild, warrior, yoga instructor, MC, genius, dummy, and all around dunny.  I have been rocking indy music since the late 1980's.  I have performed and traveled all across North America, and surfed on many a couch.  I've brought smiles, tears, aggravations, and inspirations to many people across the continent.

This Boom Box project is a life and land reclamation project, bringing the music back to the people. Inspired by the public jams that I have done previously in Portland and Chicago, and the continuous reminders from the music industry (even on the independent level) that the middle man (in the music industry) impedes and stains the relationship between the artists and the crowd; this project is meant to celebrate the absence of this vampire, and bring the performer and the people more intimately connected. This project will be made in to a documentary.

This Boom Box Project will kickoff at SXSW 2013 in Austin TX.  On various corners, streetparks, college campuses, and maybe by a few creeks, this project will roll through many different towns after SXSW in to Summer 2013.  The only means will be a boom box, a microphone, and a dunny with a dream.  The boom box will be for land and water, having a wagon for the land and a flotation raft custom built for the water (pools and creeks, and maybe even puddles).  There will also be surprise guests at almost every location.

Please support this project!!! If you can't donate or support financially, please support by sharing this project on the various social media outlets and tell the dunnies on the streets.  Don't make me lay on those tracks!!  I love yaz! :)

story:
The Elizabeth Dane has existed as a band since the Fall of 2013. Over the last several months, and with shared interest in many aspects of cinema and literature, we have written, refined, and recorded ten of our best songs, and we want to put them out on vinyl.

All four members of the band are vinyl enthusiasts, so we are looking very forward to the prospect of our first release being on our favorite format.

Since the album is done, we are only asking for money to get the records pressed. You are essentially pre-ordering the album. Most of what we raise will be going to United Record Pressing, where they will press our album, and print our jackets. The rest will cover shipping and fees.

Our drummer has used URP before to press a 7" EP, which he successfully funded through a similar campaign in 2011, so we have a pretty good idea of what to expect from this process. That said, the timing is a bit up in the air. The continuing rise of vinyl's popularity means that turnaround times are longer than ever. We may have the finished products in our hands and ready to send to you by the end of October, but we may not have them until December.

We will be paying a tiny bit extra and sending in 24-bit, 44.1 kHz WAV files (the format in which we recorded) for the highest sound quality we can get.

If we meet our goal, we should be able to break even, and sell the remaining copies of our album at shows and through our Bandcamp page.

The cover art for the album will be done by Alicia Gaines, a skilled artist and graphic designer. She also did artwork for our drummer's most recent album, Primal.

Every reward comes with an instant download* of the "Skeletal Sounds" single, which includes one song from the album and one b-side.

The "Prone" companion EP features five songs that couldn't fit on the album, mostly due to time constraints.

The tracklist for the album:

  1. Eastland
  2. Nantucket Sleighride
  3. Strange Disease
  4. Skeletal Sounds
  5. Secrets

  6. The Thinny
  7. LotF
  8. You Are Safe Now
  9. To The Death
  10. Blood Waltz

The tracklist for the EP (subject to change):

  1. Turn Obscure
  2. No More Death
  3. Bug Powder (Acoustic)
  4. Little Girl
  5. Nantucket Sleighride (With Bells)

Every download comes with a digital PDF booklet featuring original artwork, lyrics, and credits.

If we exceed our goal, we can afford to do the following:

$2300 - Pay our visual artist: Having creative friends is great, but being able to pay them for the work they do is important.

$2500 - 150g vinyl: Any vinyl is awesome, but the heavier the better, right?!

$2700 - Colored vinyl: Everyone loves colored vinyl! We're planning on doing Coke-bottle clear.

$3000 - 180g vinyl: Audiophile quality vinyl. This is gonna sound amazing!

$3500 - 500 copies: We'll bump the number of copies pressed to 500, because if we make this much money, chances are we're not going to have enough records to send to everyone.

*The link will be e-mailed to you within 24 hours of your donation.

story:
CRACK!

Turns out that’s the sound a double bass makes when the wood splits open (mid-rehearsal, of course). I was pretty mortified – people stared, I freaked out a little bit (okay, maybe more than a little bit). It was great, and probably highly entertaining for everyone (in a horrifying sort of way), except for the fact that I now have a broken bass. As both a grad student studying music performance and professional musician, it is sort of putting a damper on my life.

I believe that music exists for the community surrounding it. I am a musician dedicated to serving that community, by performing music in both traditional and non-traditional ways and spaces. This music can reach anyone, and it is our job as musicians to make that possible. Unfortunately, since the Chicago winter destroyed my bass, and the cost of fixing the instrument is beyond what the instrument is worth, I cannot do this job. Some people have totaled cars. I totaled a bass.

While I would like to continue to bring music into the community through performance, share my passion for classical music with the world around me, and pass my knowledge onto the next generation of musicians, I simply cannot do these things with a broken instrument. This is where you come in. By donating to this campaign, you will be helping me purchase a new instrument, but more than that, you will be helping bring music into people’s lives.

A Bit About Me

I was born and raised in Alexandria, VA, and began my musical career as a violinist at the age of nine. It was not until my freshman year of college that I picked up classical bass, thinking it was a kind of hobby. However, things didn’t go as planned – I fell in love with the instrument, and pursued it seriously, practicing like a maniac.  In the five years since, I have attended two summer festivals in North Carolina – Eastern Music Festival and Brevard Music Festival, and performed in master classes for Ranaan Meyer, Leonid Finkelshteyn, Robert Nairn, and others. Additionally, I was a founding teacher of the Bass Academy at the Music Academy of Eastern North Carolina, and performed with the Fayetteville Symphony and the Raleigh Chamber Players. Since moving to Chicago to pursue a Masters Degree in Bass Performance at DePaul University, I have helped found the halsted eight ensemble, and will be performing more chamber music with several groups this spring at venues around the city.

Links to my Work

https://soundcloud.com/halsted-eight-ensemble

https://soundcloud.com/contrabassic

The Impact

In addition to providing me an instrument with which to launch my career and bring music into my community, you will be giving me an opportunity to connect with you. Music is a conversation between composer, performer, and audience, and it is not complete without that audience. I would like to see that conversation more actively recognized in classical music, and I think this project has the potential to make that happen through the resulting performances.

What You Will Get

Different levels of support earn you different things – check out the side of this website for more details.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you’re not able to donate, please share this page on facebook, twitter, google+, whatever the kids are into these days. Help me get the word out!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joannah Zamora. I'm a singer/ songwriter in Phoenix, AZ and I'm making my first album. I'm pursuing my music career because I love singing and I love making and hearing music that really touches the soul. I'm excited to begin this journey and look forward to seeing who will be touched by my music and to putting beautiful sounds into the world. Watch "My Music Journey" on my YouTube channel "Joannah AZ Living" to see how the journey unfolds. Let's make it happen together!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how the $14,000 of funds will be used:

  • 5 songs fully produced (Producer/ Engineer/ Equipment fees): $9,997
  • Recording, Mixing, Mastering: $1,890
  • Copyright and Music Licensing Setup: $200
  • Studio Rent/ Vocal Coaching: $930
  • Merchandise and Promotional Products: $1,000

Perks!

Free merchandise, tickets, and VIP passes to shows! All donations receive an autographed pictured "Thank You" postcard written and signed by me personally thanking you for your support and donation. See details of gifts to donors below.

Where do funds go if goal is not reached?

I deeply appreciate all funds donated to this campaign, all funds will be used strictly for the creation of the album even if my goal is not reached.

Personal investment:

I've personally invested over $1,000 already into the production of this album and will pay the fee to IndieGogo of 4% (of $14,000 if goal is met) or 9% (of $14,000 if goal is not met), and the remainder of the cost as well.

The Impact

You will be helping me put my music into the world to inspire and enliven everyone. You'll be helping me make music that touches the soul, makes you want to groove, to dance, to cry, to burst into song. That's the type of music I make and I want to share it with you all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Watch my YouTube web series "My Music Journey" on my channel "Joannah AZ Living" every Sunday @ 7:00 P.M. (Phoenix time). Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram under the same name "Joannah AZ Living". And of course, come to my shows! That's what all this is about right - having fun and making music to enjoy!
