story:
This is not a night at “Cirque du Soleil” or “Teatro Zinzani.”  This is PAGLIACCI.

THIS IS A STORY ABOUT SEX, SCANDAL, & MURDER...THE SECRETS BEHIND THE RITUALS, MAKEUP, ACTING & SINGING OF PERFORMERS ON STAGE ...

What happens to a group of traveling actors when real life starts to imitate performance?  Leoncavallo’s famous opera thriller explores how relationships unravel in the face of careless flirtation, misplaced jealousy, intimate secrets, and unexpected betrayal.  These clowns are people too, and the danger becomes very real when the audience still believes they’re playing the part instead of plotting revenge.


WHO WE ARE - PAGLIACCI FOR THE PEOPLE

We are a group of San Francisco based singing actors, brought together by acclaimed stage director and founder of the Opera Academy of California, Yefim Maizel.  We believe that quality entertainment belongs to the community as a whole, and we can't wait to share the thrilling story of Pagliacci with you.

Opera is a story-telling experience about passion, love, lust, sex, morality, and desperate choices, which are examined through the marriage of music and lyrics. We often hear that "opera is stuffy”, “not understandable, accessible, or affordable".  We want to change that for you.  You don't need to be a musician, an opera expert, or fluent in foreign languages to experience deep emotions at an opera.  We are committed to showing you how accessible, affordable, and tangible opera can be.


OUR PROJECT

This is a unique performance, both for our team to put together and for you to attend!  We are thrilled to work with Yefim Maizel, who has been a guest stage director at the Metropolitan Opera and San Francisco Opera, and founded the Opera Academy of California.  We also have the great luck and pleasure to work with the internationally renown conductor Michel Singher, who has conducted over seventy operas from Europe to the US.  Among our cast members are the founders of local performance series “Don’t be afraid...It’s just opera!!!”, an organization committed to producing local operas.  Last season, this group produced Madame Butterfly completely through community funding.  Let’s do it again.


WHY FUND US?

Our goal of $5,750 will cover the costs for:

  • Paying our Music Director, Stage Director, Pianist, and Content Producer

  • Renting our venues

  • Setting up and running super-titles, and producing written translations

  • Producing and distributing flyers, as well as marketing our show online and around town

  • Supporting the complimentary champagne reception and “Mingle with the Singers” Q&A after the shows

With your help, we not only can properly pay the talented and hardworking people involved, but we can keep creating high-quality, valuable, accessible performance experiences to our community.  Opera shouldn’t be “stuffy” or “elite” - this is an art form everyone deserves to experience, and believe us, Pagliacci is a thrilling story you don’t want to miss!


WHAT YOU GET

There are three opportunities to see us!  Due to the show's intense content, we don't recommend the performance for kids.

  • Friday, August 1st - 8pm (Berkeley United Methodist Church)

  • Saturday, August 2nd - 8pm (Berkeley United Methodist Church)

  • Thursday, August 7th - 8pm (Old First Presbyterian Church)

Map: Berkeley United Methodist Church (1710 Carleton St., Berkeley)

Map: Old First Presbyterian Church (1751 Sacramento St., San Francisco)


Our productions are supported by English super-titles and translations in our programs.  With the purchase of your ticket, you are invited to a complimentary champagne reception following each performance, for a “Mingle with the Singers” Q&A session.  If that’s not enough, we’re also hosting an exclusive pre-show talk with the cast, director, conductor and pianist to answer all your questions and get you excited about our show. Sound fun yet?  We’re offering something for opera lovers and opera newcomers alike - a completely unique, community-centered experience that you’ll love.


TICKETS AND ADDITIONAL PERKS

Explore our perks to see which one fits your needs!  We’re offering discounts for group tickets, solo CD highlights, photos with the cast, behind the scenes access to an open rehearsal, and even private voice lessons!  

Please note: When you buy your tickets, you will be contacted via email within 24 hours to confirm your Perk and choose your performance dates.  We will be using a Will Call list in lieu of physical tickets. 


Need a little inspiration?

  • Maybe it’s date night: buying 2 tickets at once gets you access to the pre-show talk and champagne reception. (Perk #3)

  • Maybe your group of friends has never been to the opera: good thing buying 5 tickets at once saves you 20% and gets you a cast photo after the show! (Perk #4)

  • If that same group of 5 chips in another $10 each, you can attend an open rehearsal to watch us work in action - now, where else can you get that? (Perk #5)

  • Maybe you can’t attend the show, but you support our cause - we need help from everyone to make this possible.  Donations of $10 get you an honorable mention on our program and the Opera Academy of California website. (Perk #1)


YOU CAN SUPPORT HIGH-LEVEL, AFFORDABLE ART IN OUR COMMUNITY.

Please spread the word of this campaign to anyone who is interested by email, phone, Facebook, Twitter, and anywhere else you can think of.  This opportunity is perfect for opera lovers and opera new-comers alike!

Visit our website at operaacademyCA.wix.com/pagliacci, or email us directly at operaacademyCA@gmail.com.


SEE YOU AT THE SHOW!
story_txt:
This is not a night at “Cirque du Soleil” or “Teatro Zinzani.”  This is PAGLIACCI.THIS IS A STORY ABOUT SEX, SCANDAL, & MURDER...THE SECRETS BEHIND THE RITUALS, MAKEUP, ACTING & SINGING OF PERFORMERS ON STAGE ...What happens to a group of traveling actors when real life starts to imitate performance?  Leoncavallo’s famous opera thriller explores how relationships unravel in the face of careless flirtation, misplaced jealousy, intimate secrets, and unexpected betrayal.  These clowns are people too, and the danger becomes very real when the audience still believes they’re playing the part instead of plotting revenge.WHO WE ARE - PAGLIACCI FOR THE PEOPLEWe are a group of San Francisco based singing actors, brought together by acclaimed stage director and founder of the Opera Academy of California, Yefim Maizel.  We believe that quality entertainment belongs to the community as a whole, and we can't wait to share the thrilling story of Pagliacci with you.Opera is a story-telling experience about passion, love, lust, sex, morality, and desperate choices, which are examined through the marriage of music and lyrics. We often hear that "opera is stuffy”, “not understandable, accessible, or affordable".  We want to change that for you.  You don't need to be a musician, an opera expert, or fluent in foreign languages to experience deep emotions at an opera.  We are committed to showing you how accessible, affordable, and tangible opera can be.OUR PROJECTThis is a unique performance, both for our team to put together and for you to attend!  We are thrilled to work with Yefim Maizel, who has been a guest stage director at the Metropolitan Opera and San Francisco Opera, and founded the Opera Academy of California.  We also have the great luck and pleasure to work with the internationally renown conductor Michel Singher, who has conducted over seventy operas from Europe to the US.  Among our cast members are the founders of local performance series “Don’t be afraid...It’s just opera!!!”, an organization committed to producing local operas.  Last season, this group produced Madame Butterfly completely through community funding.  Let’s do it again.WHY FUND US?Our goal of $5,750 will cover the costs for:
Paying our Music Director, Stage Director, Pianist, and Content Producer
Renting our venues
Setting up and running super-titles, and producing written translations
Producing and distributing flyers, as well as marketing our show online and around town
Supporting the complimentary champagne reception and “Mingle with the Singers” Q&A after the shows
With your help, we not only can properly pay the talented and hardworking people involved, but we can keep creating high-quality, valuable, accessible performance experiences to our community.  Opera shouldn’t be “stuffy” or “elite” - this is an art form everyone deserves to experience, and believe us, Pagliacci is a thrilling story you don’t want to miss!WHAT YOU GETThere are three opportunities to see us!  Due to the show's intense content, we don't recommend the performance for kids.
Friday, August 1st - 8pm (Berkeley United Methodist Church)
Saturday, August 2nd - 8pm (Berkeley United Methodist Church)
Thursday, August 7th - 8pm (Old First Presbyterian Church)
Map: Berkeley United Methodist Church (1710 Carleton St., Berkeley)Map: Old First Presbyterian Church (1751 Sacramento St., San Francisco)Our productions are supported by English super-titles and translations in our programs.  With the purchase of your ticket, you are invited to a complimentary champagne reception following each performance, for a “Mingle with the Singers” Q&A session.  If that’s not enough, we’re also hosting an exclusive pre-show talk with the cast, director, conductor and pianist to answer all your questions and get you excited about our show. Sound fun yet?  We’re offering something for opera lovers and opera newcomers alike - a completely unique, community-centered experience that you’ll love.TICKETS AND ADDITIONAL PERKSExplore our perks to see which one fits your needs!  We’re offering discounts for group tickets, solo CD highlights, photos with the cast, behind the scenes access to an open rehearsal, and even private voice lessons!  Please note: When you buy your tickets, you will be contacted via email within 24 hours to confirm your Perk and choose your performance dates.  We will be using a Will Call list in lieu of physical tickets. Need a little inspiration?Maybe it’s date night: buying 2 tickets at once gets you access to the pre-show talk and champagne reception. (Perk #3)
Maybe your group of friends has never been to the opera: good thing buying 5 tickets at once saves you 20% and gets you a cast photo after the show! (Perk #4)
If that same group of 5 chips in another $10 each, you can attend an open rehearsal to watch us work in action - now, where else can you get that? (Perk #5)
Maybe you can’t attend the show, but you support our cause - we need help from everyone to make this possible.  Donations of $10 get you an honorable mention on our program and the Opera Academy of California website. (Perk #1)
YOU CAN SUPPORT HIGH-LEVEL, AFFORDABLE ART IN OUR COMMUNITY.Please spread the word of this campaign to anyone who is interested by email, phone, Facebook, Twitter, and anywhere else you can think of.  This opportunity is perfect for opera lovers and opera new-comers alike!Visit our website at operaacademyCA.wix.com/pagliacci, or email us directly at operaacademyCA@gmail.com.SEE YOU AT THE SHOW!

story:
About me.....

Hey:) Thanks for taking the time to read about me and my campaign! I am a country rock/pop independent recording artist from New Zealand. I have great dreams to become internationally known  as an artist in this genre. I have been professional for three years and recorded my debut album 'Here We Go' (See www.jodydireen.com to listen to samples) in February 2011, it launched in NZ April 2011 and has opened many doors for me since. Here are a few of the major events I have been involved in this year:

 

- Placed third in NZ's Good Morning Find A Star Competition (aired on live national TV) judged by national and international judges.

- Performed at the Big Night In concert at Dunedin, NZ's Forsyth Barr Stadium. I performed two songs backed by a 19 piece band (a cover & Comin To Town) & 26 000 people turned up to watch the show so was a biggy! AMAZING experience!

- A support act for the Waratahs (well known NZ band) at the Mandeville Music Festival.

-Performed Comin To Town on national TV again (Good Morning)

-Offered first international record deal - however am remaining as an independent artist for now.


PLEASE NOTE THAT DONATIONS ARE IN USD!!! $10 US = $13.29 NZD :)

 

I am REALLY determined to take my career to the next level. I would love to release my first official single in NZ and Australia in the new year and to do this I need a music video! Comin To Town is the single that I want to release (see video). It is a fresh, up beat, international sounding country rock song. I have had great feedback on the song from the general pubic, my fans and national and international music professionals. The music video will be sexy, have attitude, a little bit of humor & make viewers want to press the reply button! I am hoping to shoot the video mid February 2012 around my home town, Wanaka, NZ.

 

I strongly believe that I can make my dreams become reality, knowing that your money has gone into it will motivate me even more! It will mean soo much to me to know that once its happened - YOU helped me get there. If you do decide to donate some of your hard earned money towards my campaign I know you wont regret it because I will make sure the final product will be one that eveyone will enjoy - you will be proud of being part of its succcess!

 

If you donate please add me as a personal friend on facebook and send me a message letting me know that is what you did as I want to get to know you - I think your generosity is amazing! I was fairly standoffish at first about the whole fundraising thing - I almost 'feel bad' doing this! But I know now that I cant do it all on my own in the time that I need to....I have invested around $50 000 of my own money into my career already & I dont have an endless supply!

So this is a brief overview of my story and why I need your help!! I promise I wont let you down! A HUGE THANK YOU to you:) X

 

 The Impact

 Firstly, the music video will have an impact on anybody who views it. A positive impact. Comin To Town is a feel-good song, bringing about good emotion when people listen to it. Having a video to go with it will enhance this emotion even further! This is one thing I am always striving for with my music - is to write songs that make people feel good!

A major goal of mine is to help promote modern, up beat country rock music internationally as well as NZ. Particularly NZ because a) it is my home country and b) this kind of music has very little exposure here. I find this hard to believe as there is a huge amout of people here that LOVE the very genre! People dont want to have to fly to Australia or the states to go to a country music concert/festival. It needs to start happening here. The country music industry in NZ is almost non-existent - BUT there are the young artists here to help fuel & build the industry - the issue is, is that they all end up dissapearing overseas in seach of a country music career! The music video will play a small part in helping to build an industry in NZ so our young artists who want to be able to have a country music career in NZ dont HAVE to head over seas.  It will be a huge marketing tool to help get my name out there as well as expose the genre to people who dont realise how far country music has come since the legendary days of Merel Haggard etc.

 

Country music has soul & a country song is NEVER meaningless - country music can help people.

 

International:

Even though a major goal of mine is to help get modern, country rock/pop music cranking in NZ, I will go wherever there are oppurtunities for my career. If I need to go to Australia or America to push my career along I will as this will have a indirect influence on country music in NZ - because I am a kiwi!

 

Lastly it will have a positive impact on you! Knowing that you have helped me along the way through donation/ support (if you decide to) will make you proud - as you were part of the success - its a domino effect. My album has opened many doors for me and I wouldnt be as far along as I am now if I hadnt recorded the album. The same thing will happen with the music video - it will open doors for me as it is a powerful tool I can use to get my self as an artist and country rock/pop music noticed! I will never take your generosity for granted or ever forget it!

 

 What We Need & What You Get

I have already had numerous meetings with the people who are going to be involved in the shooting of the video. We have come to a ball park figure of $8000 NZD to shoot the video with the ideas I/we have in mind - to make it really exciting! There will be lots of 4 wheel drive trucks and utes involved as well as a fairly big cast including dancers & 3 different shooting locations. I will need about $500 on top of this to release the single in Australia which includes distribution on i-tunes and record stores and trying to get my song onto the charts. This means I will need about $6500 USD.It is likely to cost me more than this at the end of they day - but I will top up as the 'top up' amount will be minimal compared to the overall cost.

 

If I dont recieve the total sum through fundraising then (depending on my financial situation at the time) I will either top up the rest myself or put it into a holding account until i can afford to top it up and go ahead with the music video. Either way the music video WILL happen with the money I have made through fundraising - its just a matter of time.

 

PERKS:

 

As a thank you from me toward your contribution to the campaign I will have different combinations of the following perks:

 

Personal thankyou's on my fan facebook page, twitter, myspace, you tube channel and website, signed thank you cards sent out to your physical address, Jody Direen Tee-shirts & caps, signed CD's & posters, tickets to my shows, a link of your business website address linked from my website alongside your personal thankyou, mystery gift sent out to your personal address, a phone call from me to personally thankyou!

 

I will ensure you are all regularly updated on the happenings of the music video through You Tube videos, behind the scences footage, photos etc.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out! Tell all your friends and family about my campaign - let them listen to my music, get them to visit my website, use your social media pages to share my campaign:) Use the sharing tools on Indiegog also! Again, I THANKYOU for your time and HELP.

story:
Our Story

From New Plymouth, New Zealand, comes Darkwater, a 4 piece originals rock band, who formed late 2009.

Their first year together was spent developing their sound and style, which is gritty and gripping with a heaviness that enfolds melody.

Darkwater have warmed themselves up by playing at various events such as the high profile G Taranaki Festival, and opening for bands such as I Am Giant, The Checks, An Emerald City and Decortica.

Darkwater released their first demo EP mid 2010 which recieved promising reviews in the NZ Musician Magazine, with Darkwater being described as “dynamic alternative rock with strong songwriting, hooks and warm melodies”...."you won’t know whats hit you...”

2011 is the start of another exciting year for Darkwater, with an album ready to record and tour dates on the agenda.

Keep an eye and an ear out for them.

The Impact

Your investment will be helping us perfect our songs before final recording. It will mean that we can demo our new material, ourselves, without restricting & costly studio time. It would cost at least $10,000 for us to demo these songs in a commercial studio where we would end up rushing to put out a final product. This way we can take our time & really work on the songs to get them how we want them to sound!


What We Need & What You Get

We've been building up our gear over the past 18 months but we still need some recording equipment. Specifically : 'PreSonus FireStudio 2626 FireWire Audio Interface'. We need this so we can record multitrack drum/guitar/vocal tracks for our demo. For the price of this unit we can record all of our own demos... for ever! It would cost the same for us to go into a professional recording studio for just 2 days. We have over 17 songs that need to be recorded & we need your help to achive this.


Donators will get exclusive access to new recordings, videos & shows. Free copies of our album will also be available(see the sidebar-> for a full list of perks)


Join us on facebook!

If you have any questions about the indiegogo donations or you would like to know more about us then please get onto our facebook page & ask away!


www.facebook.com/darkwaternz

story:
Hello, everyone!

Welcome to EZ Tiger’s fundraiser page for our upcoming EP! For those of you who aren’t familiar with us here’s a bit of info: “EZ Tiger, female power trio from Los Angeles, CA, has created a multi-layered, melodic and driving pop/rock sound led by singer/guitarist Tina DiGeorge’s unconventional songwriting and richly captivating guitar stylings. Drummer and backing vocalist, Kristy McInnis provides tight, inventive and explosive rhythms. Bass player and background vocalist, Teresa Cowles brings a solid backbone with a keen pop sensibility. EZ Tiger pulls off pulsing rockers as well as heart-crushing ballads with well-crafted skill and finesse. The songs are uniquely infectious. Scott Bennett, Brian Wilson’s keyboardist and collaborator, who has also worked with Liz Phair, Flaming Lips, to name a few, took quick notice of the band’s talents, taking them under his wing and into the studio, producing an amazing “self-titled” debut LP. Bennett’s creative contributions were invaluable, heightening the beauty and raw power of EZ Tiger’s unique sound.”

We’re happy to be teaming up with Scott again to bring you this EP of brand new songs. Since the release of our debut, we have been busy with live performances, writing loads of new material, released two singles and have been thrilled to have garnered some great reviews and praise. Here is a small sample of what people have been saying about the debut record and, in general, about EZ Tiger:

"Everyone, it seems, loves the EZ Tiger sound, which lies somewhere near The Pixies or The Breeders..." - Maria De La O, Curve Magazine 

"The best song on the CD, Dancing for Dimes, has a menacing punk rhythm and a tasty guitar outro by DiGeorge. It demonstrates that EZ Tiger can turn up the heat and channel the Buzzcocks as convincingly as they can perform sweeter, more introspective material." - Jade Blackmore, The Slums Off Hollywood Boulevard 

"EZ Tiger’s playful yet deliberately written songs are paradoxes: the tracks that are sweet and lush at certain points, are raw and driving at others. The album bears a potent energy that pops and soars... /// ...EZ Tiger seems to spin their own brand of wool that is delicately cultivated." - Jackie Lam, Radio Free Silverlake

"...EZ Tiger's music is more Clash than Sex Pistols, in fact it's not all the far from power pop, albeit, with much rougher edges and more inventive arrangements. These songs have finesse and are accessible...plenty melodic enough to work on soundtracks or get a few TV placements."

- Dean Moore, Music Connection

“The self-titled debut album from EZ Tiger has everything one could want or expect from a rock album: infectious rhythms, excellent vocals (and backing vocals), interesting and moving lyrics. On top of it, this band has heart. This band doesn't hold back - in any area. They rock, but they also don't shy away from pop grooves. Tina DiGeorge (the lead singer and guitarist) has both power and vulnerability in her voice. 

- Michael Doherty, Suite 101.com

"...the tunes were well crafted /// these women put on a good show /// EZ Tiger's music is incredibly enticing." - Michele McManmon, LA Indie Music Examiner 

We are very excited about releasing a new body of work. This, of course, will take some funding. Which, in the ever-changing climate of the art/music world, requires us to be creative and reach out to as many supporters as possible. Any little bit towards our goal will help. Anything above our goal will go towards promotion of the recording. Nothing will be wasted. We believe strongly in supporting the arts in any way possible. Contributing to artists projects directly is one of the best and most rewarding ways to do this. Expenses for this EP include but aren’t limited to:

- Studio Time

- Producer 

- Mastering 

- Pressing of physical CD’s 

- Promotion

PERKS:

We’ve put a lot of time into coming up with some perks as a “thank you” for your donations! Your donations will basically be a pre-order with some pretty exciting prizes!  Please have a look at them on the side of this page!  We thank you so much for your time and any contribution you can make! It is because of you this record will be possible. 

Thanks, again!

Tina, Kristy and Teresa 

EZ Tiger

this record will be possible. 
Thanks, again!









Tina, Kristy and Teresa 
EZ Tiger

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I am Atiim Chenzira, and I have been writing songs since 1987, when I was 12 yo. Today I am reaching out to access support for funding my sophomore album, Aspects of Me, because I cannot afford to do it all alone. It has been 11years since I've released a body of work, but I've been recording with other musicians, have gone to graduate school to become a mental health therapist, and I have built up quite a reserve of songs that have never been released since 2001.

I have recently signed with a management company, Rio Vida (http://www.riovida.net/), and their distribution department wishes for me to have a product to them before the holidays (Nov. 10th, 2012). This financial campaign ends on December 10th, which will hopefully give me, and you, enough time to fully fund this amazing project. So, I have enlisted the support/help of quite a few amazing musicians and great artists to help me record, mix, master, and package my sophomore album, Aspect of Me. However, most of the work put forth in support is on deferment until I can raise the appropriate funds to pay for their time and efforts. Please consider funding my project, so that I may pay the talent that is working so hard at helping me achieve my goals and deadline. 

This project is a compilation of many aspects of my expression. There is only one project missing from this album, my new band FatheR BrotheR Son. I will eventually share my newest project with everyone, and those that contribute in the $500 range will get to experience a live show of my newest project. 

_______________________________________________________________________

If you use Facebook, please to this link and add yourself for updates to this campaign and for future shows and news regarding my musical projects:

Link: http://www.facebook.com/RidahRidah

If you do not use FB and wish to stay informed about my musical endeavors and shows, please go to this link and add yourself to my Reverbnation website for future news"

Link: http://Reverbnation.com/AtiimChenzira

 

Please continue to read along.... Thank you. 

 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

What We Need 

Details:

 

I. Music: Recording, Mixes, & Mastering ~ 

Total: $2200.00

 

$500 goes to Tunemaster (owner of Backyard Entertaiment/Martinez, CA.) for recording and mixing three tracks for my album. He and I have spent years together making music for free, and he should be paid for his time. I would like to pay Tunemaster for his time, energy, and genius.

Link: http://www.soundclick.com/bands/default.cfm?bandID=419041

 

$500 goes to JasWho? (owner of Whoville Studios/Berkeley, CA.) for the time he is spending mixing the three tracks that he has recorded for me in deferment, and he is being very very generous with me. If I get more from the campaign than I ask for, I will surely pay him more.

Link: http://www.jaswho.com

 

$300 goes to Mike Stevens (owner of The Lost Monkey Studio/Hayward, CA) who has recorded, mixed, arranged, and played on one track of this project.

Link: http://lostmonkeystudio.com/

 

$300 goes to Doc Melody & Danny Visual for producing and mixing two tracks on this project.

Link: Unavailable (check back)

 

$450 goes to John Dahl Honoré (owner of Master Fade) for mastering the 11 tracks at $40 a song.  It is my job to get them mixed and in his possession. He is also supporting me with and by teaching me to manage my publishing.

Link: http://www.masterfade.net/

 

$110 goes to Andrew Gibson (Upright and Electric bass player, etc.) for supporting me with arrangement, and for playing on one track on the album. 

To hire Andrew:
Email: AndrewNGibson@gmail.com

 

$75 goes to Micah Drubriel (keys player with Con Brio & session player) a phenomenal keyboardist who is responsible for the magic on one of the coming tracks. I will share with you a project I've been blessed to guest with him on, which he is full time in; Con Brio.

Link: http://www.thebandconbrio.com/home/band/

 

$75 goes to Mike Nelson, an amazing singer, who will perform support vocals on one track of the album.

Link: http://www.reverbnation.com/micdmusic

 

 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 II. Packaging: Album Artwork, Photo Shoot, Professional Bio, Physical Copies, and Distribution~

Total = $2490.00

 

Bio: $140 goes to Whitney Lewis (owner and writer of Bio Basement) for the work she is doing to revamp my bio and electronic one-pager.

Link: www.biobasement.com

 

Album Artwork: $350 goes to the artist Jack Eastgate (owner and artist of Fiji Designs) for the work he is currently doing to produce my album artwork.

Link: http://www.fijidesigns.com/

 

Website: $500 goes to Keith Crusher for web-design. He will redesign my current website and make it more user friendly for me to update my calendar, information (bio, gallery, music, etc.), and enable me to keep you, my investors, supporters, and fans, up to date on shows and the progress of my projects. . Until then, please look at my old website, and note that it does need to be more attractive.

Link: http://AtiimChenzira.com

Link: http://shortyawards.com/kcrusher

 

CD Production: $1000 goes to Tunecore producing the physical copies of the album, which you will have one of you contribute to this project. They make CD’s at 100 per $99, and I wish to make 1000 CD’s.

Link: http://www.tunecore.com/index/pricing

 

Distribution: $500 goes to the distributor to begin digital distribution once all of the music is mixed and mastered.

Link: Unavailable (check back)

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Subtotal for I & II = $4690 

$5000.00 - $4800.00 = $200 (fee for Indiegogo)

4% if I make my target donation/contribution

9% if I do not make my target donation/contribution

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A. Either way, I get to keep whatever donations/contributions you make. Some or all of what I raise, and you help me raise, will pay for some or all of what I am asking for your help with, as an investor. 

B. Please feel free to make any suggestions, and to ask any questions that will make you more comfortable with making a contribution. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Contact info:

Atiim Chenzira

Atiim@RidahRidah.com

510-593-4636c 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please read the perks that I have listed in this campaign. I will be signing and delivering copies of the physical CD, and distributing digital copies to contributors, releasing previously un-released songs in an MP3 format to certain contributors, and for some donors I will play live, and/or invite to one or more of my up-coming shows. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Impact

As a day job, I am a mental health therapist in San Francisco, and I am not a rich man by no means. However, I understand that rich has another interpretation. I am very rich when it comes to having great community. People are the resources, and this is why I ask you to help support me in a way that I cannot fully support myself; funding my project. Your dollars will help me achieve a goal that I keep putting off due to funds. 

The message I share with the world is one that I live daily. I am a public servant, a musician, and a scholar. I am a teacher and a student, and I would be elated to have your support in helping support me with my endeavor of creating, finishing, and distributing this body of work to the world. 

Your support will help me continue with my art of expression, and I will never forget your contribution, no matter how small or large. Thank you. 

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

I understand this, so if the only support you can give me is 'sharing' my campaingn with people you think may wish to contribute, please do. No matter what you are able or unable to contribute, I appreciate your time and effort, energy, and support. Thank you for considering me. 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Greetings, 
 
My name is Jesse Snyder and I am a professional photographer specializing in Architecture in the Washington D.C. area. I am planning to travel to Uganda in Eastern Africa this coming November for two weeks to produce a photographic essay on homeless children and orphans there. According to UNICEF, Uganda has more than 2 million orphans. I will work with people from Active Blessing Uganda, an NGO run by Ex-Child Soldiers who care for orphans. As most of you know, my mother, Jane Snyder is the founder of Melchizedek’s Treasure, a charity that funds this work in Uganda and has recently expanded into six more countries. She has written a few books regarding her work with the child-soldiers and homeless children living in the streets. Her editor has given her a list of photo’s needed for these books, and she has asked me to participate in this project through photographing these children.

 

I am in need of $3,500 to help finance the trip. Any donations you are able to give for this adventure are greatly appreciated! Active Blessing is part of Melchizedek's Treasure; a 501c-3 tax exempt organization, so your donation is fully tax-deductible. Donations can be made through paypal here on Indiegogo, they can be sent to the address of Active Blessing and marked (Jesse) on a separate paper, or be made on-line at: http://ActiveBlessing.com/donate. Please designate “Jesse” on the PayPal form.

 

Your contributions will help fund 1. Airfare to and from Uganda, 2. travel inside the country to cover as much ground as possible, and 3. specific equipment needed to make this trip more productive such as lenses and travel gear. 
 
I really want to take this opportunity to help with her work, as I consider it to be a blessing to the thousands of abandoned children that ABU serves (Active Blessing Uganda). Our mission is to give a voice to those who have had none. 
 
Please pass the word along to as many as you can. Make some noise about what we are trying to do!
 
Jesse
 
Check out my work: jessesnyder.com
Check out Active Blessing Uganda: activeblessing.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! I’m an indie musician based in Nashville and I need help finishing a swing song + music video. Way back in February I recorded a bunch of amazing footage of swing dancers dancing in the corner of Nashville Palace. My intention was to professionally produce the song and make a music video with the dance footage. 

Since then, the world turned upside down, both globally and for me, personally. That’s where you come in. I need your help to finish this song + video! 

What We Need & What You Get

I’ve teamed up with Eric Hevron-Smith and he is going to produce the song. Altogether it will cost $500. Eric is a talented producer, engineer and multi-instrumentalist. 

  • We need $500 to make this happen
  • All the funds go straight to Eric
  • If for some reason the amount goes over $500, I will invest that money into making my next record!

The Impact

Making a fun music video right now may seem like a waste of time given the current state of the world, but I actually see it as the opposite: we need joy right now. This music video will bring a little light refreshment to the dark days of this year, like a drink of cold water. Song and dance are never not needed. In a time when the dance community is isolated and unable to partake in our favorite activity, I hope this video is a reminder of the joy that dance brings.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give to this campaign, no worries! Here are some ways you can help:

  • Share the campaign on socials
  • Follow the campaign and share the video + song when they come out!

story:
I am Brian Gibbs and I make music. I have more than 100 records out on labels all over the world. I am asking for 10k to be able to record an album from the heart and unrestricted by technical difficulties. This is a chance to finally live up to my potential as an artist, a chance for creative freedom in the face of adversity.

With the funds from this campaign I plan to:
Buy headphones, a new condenser mic, studio monitors, and a keyboard controller. Rent a proper studio space. Create a concept album, have it mastered in London by Masterpiece and manufactured at MPO in France. CDs, Vinyl and digital copies will be distributed worldwide via one of the many quality distributors with whom I work. A music video will be recorded and promo can be done.

The resources are there to get the thing played on FM radio stations all over the world including the BBC and video channels in the States and Latin America. I could also finally do some local promo here in Santiago where I live, which would have a big impact on the day to day quality of life for me and my family.

You can be a part of an historical piece of pop culture and help facilitate innovation! You know those magic second or third albums where the artist seems to have really hit a creative stride? They don't happen by accident. Together we can put out some passionate music and present it properly.

Can't contribute? Help out with a tweet or a repost on your social sites!
 
 
THANK YOU!
 

echo park's "fiber optic"voted within the top tunes of 2011 by mixmag and dazed and confused magazine:
http://www.mixmag.net/events/holidays/tunes-of-the-year-no-55--51
http://www.dazeddigital.com/music/article/12211/1/dazed-digital-top-100-songs-of-2011
 
listen:
www.soundcloud.com/echoparkbeats
 
like:
www.facebook.com/echoparkfan
 
tweet:
www.twitter.com/echoparkbeats
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Español
 
Soy Brian Gibbs y hago música. Tengo más de 100 discos en vinilo en sellos por todo el mundo. Estoy pidiendo 10k para poder grabar un álbum desde el corazón y sin restricciones por dificultades técnicas. Esta es una oportunidad para finalmente a la altura de mi potencial como un artista, una oportunidad de libertad creativa frente a la adversidad. 

Con los fondos de esta campaña espero poder: 
Comprar headphones, un nuevo micrófono de condensador, monitores de estudio, y un controlador de teclado. Alquilar un buen espacio en el estudio. Crear un álbum de concepto, que se masteriza en Londres por Masterpiece y fabricados en MPO en Francia. Cd, vinilo y copias digitales se distribuirá en todo el mundo a través de uno de los muchos distribuidores de alta calidad con quienes trabajo. Un video musical será grabado y promoción se puede realizar. 

Existen los recursos para sacarlo en las estaciones de radio FM en todo el mundo incluyendo la BBC y canales de vídeo en los Estados Unidos, y América Latina. También podría por fin hacer promoción local aquí en Santiago donde vivo, que tendría un gran impacto en el calidad de vida para mí y para mi familia. 

Usted puede ser parte de una pieza histórica de la cultura pop y ayudar a facilitar la innovación! Usted sabe los magicos segunda o tercera álbumes donde el artista parece haber realmente una racha creativo? No ocurren por accidente. Juntos podemos sacar música apasionada y presentarlo en forma adecuada.

No puedo contribuir? Ayuda pegando un tweet o un repost en sus sitios de redes sociales.
 
GRACIAS!!!

story:
HI! It’s us...

     We are the Blackfoot Gypsies, a real life band doing all we can to keep our wheels on the road. Traveling is our LIFE and we need a reliable vehicle so we can spend our time and efforts making the best music we can for you, instead of van repairs.

     This campaign is extremely important to us because we are firm believers in playing live music and experiencing the sonic energy first hand. We need a lean, mean, get-across-the-country machine because we want to be in your face, in your town, having the good times we all deserve. With your help we can make that happen.

     This is the largest obstacle our band faces everyday: whether or not we will make it to our next gig. It's terrifyingly stressful and horribly heartbreaking when we have to cancel because we're broken down on the side of the road... again.

     Everything you donate is HUGE to us. Really HUGE! We cannot emphasize how important traveling and coming to see you face-to-face is for us. Please help with however much or little you can. Your graciousness will never be taken for granted or go unappreciated. YOU'RE why we keep going!

 

What We Need & What You Get

     Our Goal is simple: Get a road-warrior vehicle that will last a very, very long time. We are real musicians, coming in person to make real music in front of you. We were born to do this and we will continue until our dying breath, Scouts honor!

     Our perks we have in store for you are AWEsOME! We are in the midst of recording a limited run of 7-inch multi-colored vinyl singles with never before heard songs and you have the chance to get them first. We also have t-shirts, CD's, vinyl full length records, buttons, tattoos, stickers, free concerts, BAR-B-Q's/ Yard Parties, and OUR VAN!

     With Indiegogo's awesome business model, f we don't reach our entire goal, every dollar will go towards our new vehicle just the same. We are going to make this happen, and with your aid we can make this world a better place.

 

The Impact

     A traveling band's most valuable tools are the wheels under their heels, ya dig? With every dollar of generosity you contribute towards us, you are changing the course of musical history for everyone who has/will ever encounter us.

     We have resisted the option of asking for donations for years, but we finally have been caught where we need a hand. This campaign opens the floodgates for us to tour and work for YEARS to come. We rest delicately in your hands... please have confidence that we will not let you down.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, YOU CAN STILL HELP!

You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign on:

Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Tumblr, E-mail, Instagram, AND, most importantly, IN REAL LIFE!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Please howl as loud as you can and help us KEEP THE WHEELS ROLLIN'!

story:
Project title:  Connecting to the Rhythms of our Forefathers: Kriol Immersion into                                         the Rhythmic Traditions of West Africa

 

Submitted to:  

Submitted by:   National Kriol Council on Behalf of Emmeth Young and the Talla Walla group

Contact                              methos_drums@hotmail.com, Cell: 668-7733

                              National Kriol Council     nkcbelize@yahoo.com 623-8278, 6296802

Total project cost     USD:

Time frame           January  - April 2013

Date submitted

INTRODUCTION              

Emmeth Young is a Belizean kriol drummer originally from Gale's Point, Manatee. He is considered to be one of  cultural ambassador of Kriol music,and the keeper of the African rhythms of his village and culture by extension. He is connected to the rhythmic traditions of his African ancestors since learning the traditional rhythms and dances of his unique village as a boy—the Sambai, the Kunjai, Bruk down, and Sadunga. He has been on a mission to share his culture through his music ever since, and this has taken him to all parts of Belize,  Mexico, and to the United States where he toured as part of a Belizean performance troupe in 1994.

 

Emmeth’s African identity is evident in the drums that he carves, and in the rhythms that he expresses with those instruments.  Since studying with West African master drummers during excursions to the United States between 1994 and 2001, Emmeth has been building West African Drums out of Belizean hardwood. Many tourists, and others visit his Drum school in his village where they learn to carve their drum and learn the rhythms so that they could take it with them.

Emmeth performs today in the Talla Walla Vibrations Band with his childhood friend, Randolph Andrewin, and several of the youth he has trained. The African rhythms and garb mixed with the infectious positive energy of his group has earned them national respect, including in Dangriga for the annual Garifuna Settlement Day celebration where they play every year. The Garinagu is the only other Afro-descendant group in Belize.

Emmeth is a member of the National Kriol Council, one of the two afro-descent groups in Belize.

 

PROJECT PROPOSAL OVERVIEW

Emmeth’s lifelong dream is to travel to West Africa to study music and dance, to reconnect with the traditions of his ancestors, and to bring knowledge back to Belize to share with youths and the public.  Through his network of drumming friends, Emmeth has a unique opportunity to embed himself and members of his group with professional musicians trained by one of the grand masters of West African traditional music—Famoudou Konate—in Guinea, West Africa.  They would be mentored by one of Famoudou’s protégé’s, Amadou Diakite, living in his home next to Famoudou’s family compound, and taking lessons with him and other world class musicians.  they will also have the opportunity to travel to remote villages to experience the music and dance in the  traditional contexts, to learn the deeper cultural significance of the art, and to receive mentorship in drum carving the African way.  This once in a lifetime opportunity is Emmeth’s and his group to seize if thy can make the long journey to Africa and sustain themselves once there.

 

This proposal is seeking  financial support to cover airfare, lodging, lessons in Guinea, and subsistence needs for four persons for a three month period starting in January 2013.  With this support, the group will reconnect with their culture, learn the rhythms and dances of the region, and expand their skills as carvers.  The output of this training will be for the group to return to Belize with a plan to impart their  knowledge to young people of the Afro-descent population and others countrywide. It is hoped that this will be another avenue of working with the afro-descendant population to teach them about their great heritage as well as an alternative to crime and violence.

 

This proposal is requesting  that four persons be apart of this venture, Emmeth Young, Randolph Andrewin, Richard Cherrington and Denroy Castillo. If all four  cannot be funded then the request would be for the two master drummers, Emmeth Young and Randolf Andrewin

 

Budget and justification

 

The budget below reflects costs for Emmeth to travel alone, and the cost for each additional traveler should funding be allowed (up to three; Randolph, Richard, and Denroy).  Estimates were established with the assistance of Amadou’s former band mate, Abass Camara who now lives and works in the United States and is in direct contact with Amadou.  Abass’ family also lives in the neighborhood and two of his brothers speak English fluently and will help Emmeth and any travel companions with translations to French. 

 

Emmeth Young (first traveler):

Item

Description

Units

Cost   per unit

#

Cost   ($US)

Airfare

BZE to ATL to Conakry, Guinea

Round trip airfare

2,100

Visas

Lodging/lessons

Secure guest house and daily lessons

Additional travelers (each):

Item

Airfare

BZE to ATL to Conakry, Guinea

Round trip airfare

Lodging/lessons

750

3

2,250

 

The single largest budget item is a fee that includes modern lodging in Simbaya (including running water and bathrooms) and instruction from Amadou and his fellow musicians.  The fee for instruction covers immersion into the world of Guinean professional musicians, including daily lessons in music and technique.  This fee is lowered for additional travelers because lodging would be covered already.  The second largest line item is the fee for international travel to Guinea from Belize.  This fee is the same for each traveler.  The third largest line item is for incidentals, which include in-country transportation to and from the city and the villages, purified water, snacks, medicine, and spending cash.   Meals and a 90-day visa are about US$3/day and $100 respectively. 

 

The cost for Emmeth is estimated at $8,170 for three months.  Because multiple travelers can leverage the funds of the others, additional travelers could participate in the experience for the full three months for $5,170 per person.  For two travelers, the cost is US$13,340; three travelers will cost US$18,510; and four travelers will cost US$23,680.  It would be incredible for the entire Talla Walla Vibrations band to immerse in African music and culture, to carry it back for the enrichment of Belizeans and visitors of Belize for decades to come.

 

 

Some videos of the musicians that Emmeth will work with:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kumg-260mCwTH

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DalHlaiKszs&feature=related

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8R7ZvXNuATo

story:
music service

Last night I got this idea for a free music service based on the largest library on the internet - YouTube. So this project will use YouTube as the music library and combines that with other services like iTunes for charts, lyrics and downloads.

I started coding this project today and hope that I will finish it on the end of next month. I think it is a really cool project and you will like it.

It's like Spotify but completely free for most of the parts. There will be some options you can buy, e.g. an ad free option.

who i am

I'm a 20 years old guy from germany that has about 6 years experience in developing web applications.

where your money goes

  • designer 
  • server

Please submit some ideas for the site name!

Updates will be posted soon.

story:
Suénalo "Keep It Groovin'" Album Release

SUÉNALO (sweh-na-low) v. - Latin funk. Fusion. Jam band. Multicultural cocktail. The sound of Miami. Afro-Latin-Baby-Makin’-Descarga-Funk. They’re all names that we have used to describe Suénalo, and they’re all on the money. . . to a point. Because somehow, even the lengthy, hyphenated description we came up with to describe our hard-to-pin-down style falls short of the true breadth of what we represent. If Suenalo's one-of-a-kind fusion is hard to pinpoint, it’s only because no one’s ever done anything quite like it before. 

The fans have spoken and now after more than four years, Suénalo has answered with the release of Keep it Groovin'. On this 4th studio album, we have worked our butts off and spent countless hours touring, writing and rehearsing.

The Boston Globe said it best - "...dancing, twisting, shouting -- press toward the 10-piece band and a barrage of music that's simultaneously Afro-Cuban, hip-hop, R&B, Latin, funk, and unmistakably Miami." 2/11/07

This is the result of a 12-year process of compromise and of growth between some of South Florida’s most talented musicians, who come together and share an ideal: that music should move their audience. Suenalo’s roster is stacked with nine full-time members boasting chops to rival anyone, anywhere.

Our lineup is a who’s-who of brilliant musicians who have not only made their immovable imprint on Miami’s local music scene, but well beyond. 

Abner I Drums ( Oops- Missed the shoot)

We make music that crosses all boundaries and cultures, and appeals to all ages. This is original music that sometimes defies logic, yet still finds balance from such diverse influences.  

Please help us take our band to the next level. We have done it on our own without any labels or backers, but now it's time to let our fans take us to the next level. We know this will be the best album we have put out to date. This money will help us make a product that truly represents us, and will help us promote our music and reach new audiences beyond the 305. THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!  

What We Need

Music Video                                                                 $4,750

CD Release Marketing                                                $2,000

CD Release Concert Production                                 $2,000

Perks, Merchandise, and CD Printing            (20%)    $1,750

                                                                        Total    $10,500

Indiegogo 4%                                                                  $420

                                                                                   $10,920

What You Get

$ 5- Official Krave designed Keep It Groovin' bumper sticker

$10 - Official Krave designed Keep it Groovin' poster

$20 - Keep it Groovin' CD

$50 - Original Krave designed Keep it Groovin' t-shirt and CD

$100- Original Signed Keep it Groovin' Poster, t-shirt, CD and bumper sticker

$200- Entire Suenalo CD Discography (4 Albums including Collages (digital download), Suenalo Sound System, Live at Transit and Keep it Groovin'; plus bumper sticker, Keep it Groovin' t-shirt and signed poster.

$500-  4 VIP Tickets to the Keep it Groovin' CD Release Party, 4 copies of Keep it Groovin' CD, and 4 Official signed posters. 

$1,500-  Live one-hour set by Suenalo at venue of your choosing  (does not include location, travel, accommodations or sound/PA). 

$2,000 plus - Live one-hour set at venue of your choosing, plus 4 VIP Tickets to the Keep it Groovin' CD Release Party, 4 copies of Keep it Groovin' CD, your name/credits in our website, and 4 Official Signed Posters. (Does not include location, travel, accommodations or sound/PA).

Spread the word

Don't worry if you can’t make a donation, you can still help BIG time by just spreading the word and reposting our campaign using the indiegogo share tools and social media links on our page.

SEE YOU ON THE FLIP SIDE!

story:
Short Summary

Gypsy Elise and husband Ryan De Sade Way have been a constant in Ready Teddy's life since his accident.  Bringing music to Teddy each month, they became close with Teddy's family.  In this time of loss, they have been asked by Teddy's family to organize the celebration of Teddy's life, and to assist with the gathering of funds for his final expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds will be used soley for Teddy's Official second line permits and private police detail fees, as well as his cremation costs and urn charge.  As well as burial, dependent on his families wishes in this.
  • We will have gifts for contributors, including the CD Single, Chairman Of The Blues, as well as memorial T Shirts
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be used to assist the family as far as the fund-age garnered will allow.

The Impact

  • Ready Teddy made a positive impact on so many lives. This is our chance to give back, and place him at peace.
  • It's time to show that New Orleans love.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are looking for a Brass Band for the second line.  If yours is available, please contact via text to 504.344.2607
  • Please SHARE this info so we can reach the goal set

It's time to show that New Orleans love.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are looking for a Brass Band for the second line.  If yours is available, please contact via text to 504.344.2607
Please SHARE this info so we can reach the goal set

story:
->  Listen to the song "Road Trip"  <-

 

What a great way to start the weekend! We just reached the indiegogo goal... We're going to shoot music video for "Road Trip" in July! I'm sooo excited! Thank you to the funders that so generously helped make this happen!

With 12 days to go, anything extra we make will go towards recording the rest of the album! I love you guys!

 

INTRODUCING ME


Hi, my name is Niv Kaikov and I'm a singer/songwriter. I’m originally from Israel but am now currently based in New York.

A couple of years ago, I had very scary accident which led to a long 9 months of recovery and  soul-searching. During that time, I had an epiphany. I realized that I had been living half a life, where I was moderately successful but wasn't truly happy. So I decided it was time to embark on a new journey and pursue my real passion in life, MUSIC, and thus began the “Road Trip” of my life.

Now, I've teamed up with an awesome group of students at the New York Film Academy to shoot and release my new song, Road Trip, but we need your help! So please join the NK Team and show your support by donating and sharing this page!

 

 

JOIN ME ON MY "ROAD TRIP"

Over the last year, I've been performing around New York City and recording new songs in my home studio. Now it’s time for me to share my music with the rest of the world. I’ve already professionally recorded my first single “Road Trip”, but there’s still a lot to be done. I need to have the song mixed and mastered in a professional studio plus shoot the music video so I’m going to need your help. Therefore I'm inviting you all to take an active part in my journey! Being a part of the NK Team will give you access to some cool perks from me (see on the right) and you might even get to be a part of my music video for “Road Trip!" 

As I mentioned, I've already recorded the song professionally however I really want to shoot the music video for it, and that's where all the costs come in. I've teamed up with some AMAZING students from the New York Film Academy who are willing to help me. Thanks to them I've cut down some of the costs for the equipment but I still need to cover things like props, locations, hair, make-up and, of course, hiring a professional editor to put it all together in the end. 

Any additional money made past the goal will go towards recording the rest of my album. I cant wait! :)

Thank you so much for being a part of this and for helping to make my dream a reality!!! Whatever you can pledge would be amazing, and sharing the project on Facebook, Twitter, and email helps, too!

- Niv

P.S.: Check out my music and download my songs for free:
www.nivkaikov.com

story:
Ok so here's the deal:

Crooked Bangs is about to embark on another tour, this time to the west coast! Everything is set in stone and the shows have all been booked by our guitarist Samantha as well as contributing resources by Leda and I (Phillip). This process takes a lot of work and has been in the works for a long long time now. 
The Problem?
As our departure date nears we have run into a couple of problems... We bought a van that has some issues that might put the tour in jeopardy. What we thought were minor issues turned out to be worse than we expected. This was not planned and the last thing we ever wanted to do is ask for handouts to fix our van... Unfortunately were getting desperate as time nears. 
Why?
It's hard to get people on board with personal project, we understand, everyone is busy these days and money is not exactly something we can just toss around... But we are extremely passionate and work extremely hard at what we do, and were in it to win it. We are not asking you to fund our vacation, thats far from what tour is like. We just need a little boost to get us and keep us on the road, and safe. This industry is incredibly hard and it takes harder work to get anywhere, which is why we practice relentlessly and play as many shows as we can. We value artistic creativity and the bold who pursue goals that few people have the will to go for their dreams. 
Anyways, 
Anything helps and we value everyone who takes the time even to read this, if you cannot contribute directly, do it by spreading the word for us. We have come a long way in a very short amount of time and we do not plan on stopping. Hopefully some of you can find value in the Perks we are offering contributors. If you have read to this point, we love you and look forward to shipping you fun stuff we have put together!
TOUR CITIES:
Austin, TX
Las Cruces, NM
Tucson, AZ
Tempe,AZ
San Diego, CA
Fullerton, CA
Los Angeles, CA
Oakland, CA
San Francisco, CA
Portland, OR
Tacoma, WA
Seattle, WA
Vancouver, BC
Olympia, WA
Boise, ID
Salt Lake City, UT
Denver, CO
Kansas City, MO
Oklahoma City, OK
Denton, TX

story:
Short Summary

A Careless Skyline has been offered a HUGE opportunity to go on tour with another big act! It has always been our dream to tour and get our music out there to other parts of the country. Music is our passion, and we are so excited about this chance. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need your help for:

We are all working guys and are taking the time off to live our dream. However, as you all know, touring can be expensive and we just don't have the funds to pay for everything on the road. The money we are raising is for gas, motels, and any possible things that could happen on the road. None of your money is going to our personal needs of food or souvenirs or anything like that. And don't think you wont be rewarded. We have some awesome things we are giving away for your contributions. :)

The Impact

Anyone close to music or us, knows that getting out there is a huge way to spread your music. We have some shows on this tour that could gain us HUGE exposure to record labels and agents. We would love to pay for everything on our own, but sadly we cant. We just need a little boost from you guys. And hey, if we make it big, you all know you will be rewarded with A LOT, because we believe that our fans and friends are what make it all happen and make us successful!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tough and maybe not everyone can help out. But, we know our friends still love us and will help out. Some ways you can are:

Spread the word about our campaign! Facebook it, text it, tweet it, or shout it from a mountain top. Whatever floats your boat.

story:
Hey friends!

The story:

So after our incredible last tour this past December, our transmission basically checked out of existence. We limped home at an incredible 30 MPH after returning our borrowed trailer a week after the tour ended. While the time and place were fortunate for this occurance, our bank account wasn't so lucky. We simply just don't have enough funds to repair the Allegaeonmobile.  We have this incredible tour coming up and literally no way of going out and rocking for you guys.  While the repairs are estimated in the quad digits, and as if this wasn't going to be hard enough, our lovely trailer we were borrowing was sold. Add "need a trailer" to our problems and here we are coming to you, our friends, to help us out. Normally we'd just push our merch store really hard to try and raise the funds, however, we simply do not have enough merch left to help us out with this high a bill. So it really comes down to this: if you don't like these fundraising things (and believe me, it was a highly debated topic within the band), then please go with your conscience and rock on! If you wanna see us come to your town, (and even if that is not this tour then stay tuned) it'd be unbelievably humbling if you can help us out.

We've had a really hard time trying to get tours and this is a great opportunity that we simply don't want to miss. We want to grow and be around to bring you Allegaeon music for years to come, so thanks for taking the time to read this and check out our page. Hopefully we'll see your beautiful face in the near future so we can melt it off!

 

E.P. reprint:

If we do surpass our goal, we will reprint hard copies of the E.P. (recorded in 2008). We know a lot of you have mentioned this and we hope this comes to pass. If it does, we will be sending these to those who donate at the 20 dollar level and above. You guys rock!

MEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEETTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTAAAAAAAAAAAAALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!

 

Love,
the Allegaeon boys

story:
I Call The Living 

"Vivos Voco" (Latin), from The Song of the Bell, by Friedrich von Schiller (1798), and later the motto of the revolutionary peasant journal, Kolokol (1857-1867). 

I did not wear clothing when I was a child. I wore costumes. My closet was an old wooden chest full of fantastic raiments and eclectic ornaments collected from attics, grandparents, older cousins' hand-me-downs, musty theatre closets, and ok yeah the Disney store sometimes. Even on the days my mom made me wear "normal" clothes, I'd be wearing water-based warpaint and a homemade loincloth underneath. Whether I was a cowboy, a lost boy, a pirate, Tommy the green (or white) power ranger, Indiana Jones, a knight, or some strange amalgam of every adventurer I'd ever admired I was not content with the numbing and excruciatingly mundane world I was born into. I always had a deep desire to inject it with creativity. Not much has changed, except the tools I keep in that chest.

I am not an entertainer. The last thing I want is to be another opiate for the masses, by which they might remain distracted and apathetic. My goal as a musician is to sing ancient worlds into memory and future worlds into being. I know there's not a lot of money in that genre, hence the Indiegogo campaign, but I believe that music, like every art form, should transform you in some way. If you walk away from a painting, or a movie, or a viral video, or a musical performance, exactly the same as you were before, what was the purpose of that piece? How is the world any different?

So, two years since my last release, "When I Rise," I have written a piece of music (indeed, more of a piece in its entirety than a collection of individual songs) that is meant to awaken something in you. "I Call The Living" Is a mountaintop declaration of love and a quixotic battle cry all at once. It is an invitation and a challenge. It is a record not just about my struggle to find meaning in the world and the different costumes I've worn along the way, but about our collective struggle as one human race to find our place of balance in the natural order of things. But, just as no true change in the world can come from the work of one person, this album cannot be born through my efforts alone. I need your help!

What I Need & What You Get    

While the bulk of the cost will be recording the album itself, there are other important costs as well. I have several amazingly talented friends (engineers, string players, percussionists, a harpist, and a champion dulcimer player among them) who are helping me with this project and I'm really tired of mooching off them. They deserve to be paid for their talent. I'm also working closely with friend and photographer extraordinaire, Laura E. Partain (laurapartain.com) on creating the visual aesthetic to accompany the music. She too deserves fair compensation for her amazing work on my promotional video and photos.    

I'll also be taking a lot of time off of working my customer service jobs to focus on making the record, including several long drives, so there will be significant expenses there as well. 

Breakdown

  • Tracking, Producing, Mastering: $1,800
  • Guest musicians: $800
  • Manufacturing CDs, liner notes, packaging, etc.: $1,300
  • Promotional photos, video, posters, etc.: $520
  • Fees, Gas, food, shipping, perks, indiegogo cut: $960

For a grand total of $5,380!
If I reach my goal, I only lose %4 to Indiegogo and keep the rest! If 200 people donate just $27, we can do it! But remember, even if I don't reach my total goal I'll still receive however much I do raise (minus a %9 cut for Indiegogo). So, even if I only raise $2000, I can still begin production! 

In return for your support you'll get lots of goodies. Think of your contribution as an investment rather than a donation. Check out all the sweet perks on the right! (Note: all perks except personal shout outs will be awarded after the album is finished. Estimated delivery by July 2014.) 

Why?

I am an independent musician. That means that without the help of a manager, agent, record label, or Ryan Seacrest, in order for what I’m doing to be sustainable I need to rely directly on the support of my listeners. YOU. I’m not searching for fame or fortune, but I do have a Song in my heart that needs to be sung. You can help me sing it, and maybe pierce a few hardened hearts and tear down a few walls of isolation and oppression. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Be my street team! Do some grassroots promotion for me among your friends.
  • Spread the word via email and social media. Use the indiegogo sharing tools! 
  • "Like" my facebook page, listen on bandcamp, follow on twitter, and stay tuned!

story:
The best dreams are those which are bigger than we could ever hope to achieve by ourselves. Our dream is to make a high quality debut album in both digital and physical formats, which measures up to the high standards of todays music industry.

We don't have a record label to support us.

We don't have a pile of cash.

What we do have is a passion for our music and a group of friends who we hope will believe in us enough to sponsor the creation of this ambitious project.

The amount of money we raise will directly affect the production decisions we make. Decisions around: 

Professional mixing and mastering

Quality recording space

Professional artwork

Quality CD production

To name a few. If we attempted this alone on a shoestring budget we would ultimately fail. We need friends like you to back us up and spend a little money which will go a very long way towards making this dream a reality. 

Having a high quality album would help us to establish ourselves as serious artists and act as a spring board for us to properly launch our career as a band. So with all that in mind please select a perk and make your contribution, your help would mean the world to us.

 

Thank you

story:
Intro

Whats up guys and girls, welcome!
I'm an Alt Pop/Rock artist from Hull, currently based in London writing/releasing music and playing live. My music consists dirty guitar tones, anthemic choruses, and punching beats that sit in a hip hop groove. My first single "Trouble (Pull That Trigger)" was released after a Billboard premiere, and has since then, had the support of champions within the press, the BBC and of course my loyal supporters. I am now about to release my second single "MAD", and currently planning recording for future singles, and eventually an EP.


Campaign

I'm putting together a crowd funding campaign to make this recording process possible, as with currently being an independent artist, many hit the financial wall when it comes to being able to afford the things like PR, music video, artwork and merch production etc. As an artist i know exactly what i want to do, and how to do it, now i just need your support!
If you would like more music, for making a financial contribution to my campaign, you shall not only recieve one of the bad ass gifts in the websites "perks" section, but you of course WILL be able to have more music being produced and released by myself, a LOT faster.


What YOU Will Get In Return

In return for your contribution towards making my goal a reality, you will recieve perks such as
Signed T Shirt Signed Poster
A Cover Of Your Favourite Song 1 hour vocal lesson Dinner with Izzy Thomas & friend
Exclusive behind the scenes footage
& more!

How Much I Want To Raise

I need to raise £4k, this will go towards
* Studio fees (Mixing/Mastering)
* Music videos * Paying musicians * Artwork/graphic design * CD printing/distribution * Publicity/promotion * Distribution/shipping * Single release events
If i don't reach my entire goal, whatever i have earned will go towards studio time.

What Impact Will This Have On You, & The Rest Of The World?

Right now lets face it, popular music is on its arse. My goal is to introduce guitar back in to the music world, before kids even forget what it is..
I want to create music with meaning, empowering music. Music that the youth of today will be humming the melodies to when they are older. I honestly dont remember 80 percent of the stuff that comes on the radio, because i feel a lot of it is lacking substance. I am inspired by new artists like Rag 'N' Bone Man, Lewis Capaldi, Bishop Briggs, and of course legends like MJ, Audioslave, Lenny Kravitz & Christina Aguilera who all said something within their music.
If i raise over my target, remaining funds will be put towards more school tours, where i will continue to perform in secondary school assembilies, and educate students on the importance of Autism wareness, mental health, equality and cyber bullying. Also, a possible full band venue tour around the UK.


Thank you for taking your time to read this, if you support me with this, you WILL recieve more music from me, and eternal respect for your loyalty and faith.

Much love, Izzy X
